reviews: Gastroteca is great new edition restaurant in Astoria. The have outside seating for great spring/ summer days and offer a great list of cocktail you simply can't beat. There pasta game is great and the brunch here is A1, but then again everything on their menu is good.I love the ambience in this place. The drinks are great, the staff is very helpful, & the food is amazing!Really great pasta dishes, appetizers and their drinks are great. The chicken and waffles for brunch here is one of the best by far i've had.Great neighborhood gem, brunch lunch or dinner is awesome. It Can be a bit noisy at times inside when busy, but thats every where with great food. I definitely recommend getting outside seatings in spring/summer timeGreat staple for weekend brunch & dog friendly. Great service!

The drinks are great, the staff is very helpful, & the food is amazing!Really great pasta dishes, appetizers and their drinks are great. It Can be a bit noisy at times inside when busy, but thats every where with great food.

reviews: We came here on Sunday around 1:45pm. It was kind of busy, but there were available seats inside and out. Unfortunately, the menu was limited. They didn't have crostinos and other stuff on the menu that were listed on their website menu. They also do not have wifi for customers.I ordered crispy gnocchi for $16. It consists of spinach, pistachio pesto, and ricotta salata. Unfortunately, I got so little on my plate. It literally took me about 5 mins to eat everything on my plate. Not worth $16. My other friend created her own brunch meal: wheat toast, two scrambled eggs, and home fries. My other friend ordered smoked atlantic salmon crostino for $14.50. Their meals were not small like mine. Pros: free coffee refills, clean restrooms, clean restaurant, outdoor seating available, and decent serviceDo not order crispy gnocchi if you're hungry. I would come back to try their eggs benedict next time.

Their meals were not small like mine. Pros: free coffee refills, clean restrooms, clean restaurant, outdoor seating available, and decent serviceDo not order crispy gnocchi if you're hungry. I would come back to try their eggs benedict next time.

reviews: 4 stars for the ambience/decor/waiters/their spinach gnocchi.. actually everything. It's just a block away from where I live and I am proud of having such a place in my neighborhood. U get great dinner , breakfast & brunch.and I like how a Black&white movie runs in the background- perfect setup for a date too.Food is great as well but it could be better and healthier .
extracted: U get great dinner , breakfast & brunch.and I like how a Black&white movie runs in the background- perfect setup for a date too.Food is great as well but it could be better and healthier .

reviews: This is indeed an outstanding brunch place. Everything is good! We ordered the famous banana ricotta which is perfect wth my coffee. I also had the salmon which is great. Have no complaints. Worth a second visit! Staff is very courteous.
extracted: Everything is good! Have no complaints Worth a second visit Staff is very courteous.

reviews: This is a random choice for tuesday brunch. We called before we get there & ask if they have table for 2. A person put us on hold for so long & we hang up but shes really nice that she called me back & told me theirs available tables inside. Got there & change our table to seat outside. We got seated on the corner of this restaurant. We called one of their waitress & inform her we're ready to order, she said shes gonna call our waitress but then shes still the one who came back & took our order. To start I got mimosa. For food my bf got the chicken sandwich & I got the sphagetti carbonara. They served the food real fast. My food was alright. It is topped with egg. My bf didn't like his sandwich, he said it taste like the tyson's chicken or chicken that we just microwave at home & it supposed to have avocado on it but theirs no avocado. We ask the waitress about it & she said shes gonna check about it & she never came back. So we called another waitress & ask for menu so we can double check the sandwich. The only time the waitress came back is when we ask our check. So we figured out that theirs 2 chicken sandwich in the menu (chicken sandwich & chicken cutlet & pesto sandwich) so she serves us pesto sandwich. Its weird because the pesto is more expensive than the other one with avocado & we ask for chicken sandwich. Sorry but we didn't enjoy our meal. No one check up on us and ask if we need anything and its so hard to catch their attention.
extracted: We got seated on the corner of this restaurant It is topped with egg So we called another waitress & ask for menu so we can double check the sandwich. Its weird because the pesto is more expensive than the other one with avocado & we ask for chicken sandwich. enjoy

reviews: Great ambience, nice waitress, delicious food, but kinda slow service. It's fine if you come in a group and you have a lot to chat to kill the wait time. We waited for almost 10 mins to order and another 15 mins or more for our food to come (restaurant was indeed pretty packed). Yet drinks were served fairly quickly (before ordering food).My friends got Scampi and Grits ($16) and Chicken and Waffle ($18) with 2 fried eggs and home fries. I ordered the Fried Eggplants and Burrata Sandwich ($13.5) with salad (can choose fries too). I tried a bit of my friends' dishes and I loved all of them, including mine! -- The polenta was so creamy and buttery, and the scampi was so chewy; the tomato sauce (I guess) was so delicious that had the perfect sourness and went so well with the scampi. -- The mascarpone cheese was sweet but not too thick, although the fried chicken was okay. -- My sandwich was really good! The fried eggplants had a thin crust, a bit dry, but the eggplants were very moist and watery, and the burrata was simply tasty and refreshing, which added moisture to the bread. The bread was crunchy/crispy outside, but doughy inside. With the moisture given from the eggplants and burrata cheese, you wouldn't feel very dry or hard to swallow. My iced coffee was not rich at all, though, too plain and watery. Anyway, we all agree that this is the type of place we want to come again.

The fried eggplants had a thin crust, a bit dry, but the eggplants were very moist and watery, and the burrata was simply tasty and refreshing, which added moisture to the bread. The bread was crunchy/crispy outside, but doughy inside. With the moisture given from the eggplants and burrata cheese, you wouldn't feel very dry or hard to swallow. My iced coffee was not rich at all, though, too plain and watery.

reviews: Perfection. My crostini with smoked salmon (and ricotta and this insane spicy jam/compote and perfect sunny side eggs) was probably the best thing I've ordered in a very long time!!! It was SO GOOD. Thick country bread, spread with fresh ricotta (it's usually mixed with fresh dill but I asked for it without since I haaaaaate dill), a dash of spicy compote (I think it had olives?), slices of smoked Atlantic salmon, and 2 sunny side eggs. YUM. Flavor explosion in my mouth!I also opted for the side salad which was fresh arugula and radicchio tossed in a fresh vinegary dressing - I could NOT stop eating that!! My entire plate was FANTASTIC. Husband ordered the Italian Benedict which he LOVED - it had parmacotto (cooked prosciutto - MEATY and DELICIOUS), and we were amazed that we had never had this before!! We shared the zeppoles to end our meal - we were so full we couldn't eat more than 2 a piece. The service was excellent, the coffee was excellent, and our dishes were OUTSTANDING. It was so good we literally made reservations for the weekend after for brunch while paying our check! Cannot wait to come back here!

We shared the zeppoles to end our meal - we were so full we couldn't eat more than 2 a piece. The service was excellent, the coffee was excellent, and our dishes were OUTSTANDING. It was so good we literally made reservations for the weekend after for brunch while paying our check! Cannot wait to come back here

reviews: We came in for Sunday brunch around 11AM and surprisingly, it wasn't too packed. It's quite a picturesque little restaurant, the floor to ceiling windows and outdoor seating shaded with greenery add to its charm.I ordered the Smoked Atlantic Salmon Crostini with sunny side up eggs and a side salad. It's a simple plate and they let the ingredients speak for themselves - SO refreshing and delicious! It was a little difficult to eat as the crostini is a huge slice of bread, would have been better for them to cut it up into two portions perhaps. But nonetheless, I can appreciate generous quantities of food. My friend ordered the crispy gnocchi and THIS..... this was wow. It's already great texture-wise, initially crunchy and then chewy on the inside. Then you add the pesto sauce and shaved ricotta and it's a done deal. The portion looks small at first but it fills you up fast. I couldn't help myself from stealing some off her plate. The only complaint we have was for the mimosas. Their servings are quite small for the price and ours tasted watered down. Otherwise, the food was spot on - would definitely come back for more!
extracted: It was a little difficult to eat as the crostini is a huge slice of bread, would have been better for them to cut it up into two portions perhaps. But nonetheless, I can appreciate generous quantities of food. It's already great texture-wise, initially crunchy and then chewy on the inside. The portion looks small at first but it fills you up fast. I couldn't help myself from stealing some off her plate. Their servings are quite small for the price and ours tasted watered down. Sunday brunch

reviews: I came by with two friends on a Saturday around 12:00 PM and thankfully did not have to wait for a table.  We ordered the following:Smoked Atlantic Salmon Crostino ($13.50): the salmon came on a huge toast but I thought the toast was a bit too hard to chew.Belgian Waffles ($12.00): banana caramel sauce, walnut, and whipped cream on top of a huge waffle!  The waffle tasted really distinct (but good) and it was soft but a bit crunchy at the same time.  I really liked it!Scampi & Grits ($14.00): my friend ordered this and she thought it was good!The portions of the food were a bit above average!  None of us could finish our dish.  Service here was a bit slow... it took them a little over 30 mins to serve our food after ordering!  Our waitress also came by a little too often to check on our table - and it really seemed like she was rushing us... we felt a bit uncomfortable.Overall, a very average brunch spot.

The waffle tasted really distinct (but good) and it was soft but a bit crunchy at the same time. None of us could finish our dish. Our waitress also came by a little too often to check on our table - and it really seemed like she was rushing us... we felt a bit uncomfortable.Overall, a very average brunch spot.

reviews: I came in for brunch on a Sunday around 1:45pm and this place was packed. They had an ample amount of outside seating as well as tables and high tops but every table was full. Thankfully we were seated rather quickly as we were a group of 2. I had the California Benedict with potatoes and my friend had the burger with fries. The California Benedict comes with two poached eggs sitting atop  mashed avocado and two mini tomatoes on small ciabatta rolls. The size of my dish took me by surprise. It looked more like a finger food than an actual breakfast dish. If you're hungry then this dish prob won't fulfill your appetite. They gave a decent amount of potatoes but I was still left a little hungry after. I will say that the eggs were poached perfectly and although the dish was rather small it was still quite tasty! My friend's burger, however, was much larger in size. The patty was bigger than the bun which is a plus in my book. And she had plenty of fries. She wasn't even able to finish her entire burger and she was starving when we arrived. So the dish size varies a lot per dish here. Our waiter was attentive and quick with servicing us with a full water vase when we finished ours. Overall a decent experience here.
extracted: The California Benedict comes with two poached eggs sitting atop  mashed avocado and two mini tomatoes on small ciabatta rolls. I will say that the eggs were poached perfectly and although the dish was rather small it was still quite tasty! The patty was bigger than the bun which is a plus in my book. Our waiter was attentive and quick with servicing us with a full water vase when we finished ours. Overall a decent experience here

reviews: Had an excellent rehearsal dinner here recently. The lamb ribs appetizer was exceptional. Also enjoyed the shaved brussels sprouts salad, fried calamari, crispy pesto gnocchi, and a perfect salmon (w/ clams, broccoli rabe, gnocchi) entree. Great service, to boot.
extracted: Had an excellent rehearsal dinner here recently The lamb ribs appetizer was exceptional. enjoy

reviews: Brunch here is on point! Absolutely loved the Zeppoles with Nutella syrup to start.  The Chef makes an amazing Italian Fried Chicken & Waffles with agro dolce + mascarpone butter.  The chicken is big in portion and perfectly crispy! The waffle tasted different from other places. Couldn't tell what was different but we liked it. They brought over this home made balsamic maple syrup to the table and it complements the chicken really well. Also ordered the Brunch Lasagna with bacon, sausage, bechamel, mozzarella, spinach with a fried egg on top!  What a nice way to make a classic dinner dish into breakfast. We enjoyed our food here. Will go back again to try other dishes.

They brought over this home made balsamic maple syrup to the table and it complements the chicken really well. What a nice way to make a classic dinner dish into breakfast Will go back again to try other dishes enjoy

reviews: Came here on a Saturday @ 11:45 we were seated but told we had until 1 to eat. It is better if you make a reservation. It fills up quickly here.Good brunch menu, I wanted to try crostinos-they are only served during dinner but I was still happy with my dish. I got Scampi and grits - it was delicious with generous portions my bf had eggplant burrata sandwich plate with fries- sandwich wasn't filled at all 80% bread with 1 slice of eggplant. We also got eggs California  Benedict which was ridiculously tiny-literally 4 bites, the portions are definitely skewed depending on what you get so beware.Service was good no complaints there and the Place is spacious well lit. Might come back sometime.

reviews: I came here yesterday with my gf for my birthday brunch and I was satisfy with my meal.  Food wise: I order The steak (medium well) and eggs (over easy) with a side order of smoked bacon and everything was cooked to perfection. The steak was juicy and tender just how I like it. Also the Belgium waffle my gf order was fluffy and tasty I can't go more into details because she didn't want to give me half hahaha, but from what I tasted it worth the purchase if you are into waffle. It is a decent size for the price. Resturant wise: Furthermore, the atmosphere of the place was welcoming; the staff was polite and very attentive. I been to other restaurants that they would just sit you take your order and that about it. However,  in this restaurants they care about the costumer and check up on you to see if everything is to your liking. If you are looking for a weekend brunch date I recommend this restaurant. P.S. If you are a foodie and love to take pics then this restaurant is also for you lol. Natural lighting all around so go nuts :)

If you are looking for a weekend brunch date I recommend this restaurant If you are a foodie and love to take pics then this restaurant is also for you lol

reviews: We didn't have a reservation (It was a Saturday afternoon) but they were able to seat us at the bar. Bartender was there, but not very attentive. The food was good- I had the baked eggs and my friend had the benedict with the pesto hollandaise. We also shared the nutella french toast, which had to be taken to go since we definitely over ordered.The really disappointing part was how long it took for our food to come. Not just food, but cappuccinos!! It must have taken at least 30 minutes for two CAPPUCCINOS. (meaning it took almost an hour for food) We kindly told the bartender that we were still waiting and ..."I know. It's coming". Ten minutes later they arrive. The restaurant was mildly busy, but coffee shouldn't take that long. And if it's that busy or you're short staffed, just check in with your customers! We can be understanding. And we were the only ones sitting at the bar at the time!Even though we enjoyed the food (though not sure if it was because we were starving when we got it), we were pretty annoyed that it took that long with no apologies or check ins. Probably will not be coming back.

It must have taken at least 30 minutes for two CAPPUCCINOS. The restaurant was mildly busy, but coffee shouldn't take that long. We can be understanding. Probably will not be coming back enjoy

reviews: A very welcoming restaurant with beautiful outdoor seating. Have passed this literally every week when we go grocery shopping and when today the question of brunch came up, we decided to give this place a try. It has spacious seating both indoor and outdoor. The staff was excellent and catered to our requests quite gracefully. We ordered goat cheese omlette and chicken sandwich (our waiter was kind enough to accept my request to substitute grilled chicken for fried cutlet). We had to wait for over 30 minutes, which was okay because I really like to relax during brunch rather than shoving everything down quickly.The food arrived very cold, which kinda ruined every good things I just listed above. Also the pesto or the tomato in my sandwich was very rotten that I choked after eating that. Besides the rotten part, the cutlet was good (I feel weird saying this btw).Don't think I will be returning here.

reviews: Very disappointing. **EVERYONE, MAKE SURE TO CHECK IF THE BILL MATCHES THE PRICES LISTED ON THE MENU** I've attached a picture of our bill and the menu because I did not believe this situation.When we got the bill, we realized that our server charged us 2 dollars extra on all 3 dishes that we ordered. We brought this up to the server and asked to see the menu again (this was when I took the picture below to show comparison for fellow yelpers). Our server then tells us that she heard that there were some price changes "last week" but was not sure and that she had to speak to someone regarding this. Then some guy comes out and talks to our server right behind us talking very loud and clear about this situation as if they wanted us to listen and says, "Someone must have brought up our old menus from storage. But you can take out the 6 dollars from their bill."Just out of curiosity, I just went on their website to check if there had been any price changes to the weekday brunch menu since the menus they gave us were "old menus from storage" but seems like they haven't updated their "old menus" online either. Just sounds like a bunch of bs to me. As for food, we ordered the CALIFORNIA BENEDICT, SCAMPI & GRITS and ITALIAN FRIED CHICKEN & BUTTERMILK WAFFLE with a side of HOME FRIES and APPLEWOOD SMOKED BACON. The food was decent, nothing spectacular. Portions were pretty big, we all had some leftovers. I liked the decor and ambience of this place, cute spot. I don't know if I'll ever go back but if I do, I'm definitely checking to see if there are any price changes.

reviews: Occasion: Sunday brunch with a friendFood:Italian Fried Chicken with Waffle ($18)CappuccinoThe fried chicken was cooked very well - retaining the right balance of moist and crunchiness. And it was huge! Together with the butter and syrup glazed waffle, it was a fulfilling and delicious combo! Also a honorary mention: the Cappuccino was surprisingly good - aromatic, strong, and smooth with the perfect amount of foam.I took one star off because the toilet was kinda a mess. It smelled so bad I almost thew up.

reviews: Good food at reasonable prices in a beautiful restaurant with friends ? What's not to like ? Came here on my short vacation for a little breakfast and I was not disappointed. The service was good and the food was also very good. It's a very relaxing place with these gorgeous windows that made me wish my husband would have been there with me. Anyone that knows me knows well that I love small local spots. They need a bigger menu but it was good food at a fair price. If I'm ever in that neighborhood again I'll go back and try something more adventurous. My only tip to the restaurant, use salt.

reviews: Monique was an exceptional waitress. She provided us about the best advice about entrees and dessert options. Our experience at Gatroteca was great and we will be back for brunch.
extracted: Monique was an exceptional waitress. Our experience at Gatroteca was great and we will be back for brunch.

reviews: Had a lovely brunch here with friends. Came on a Saturday around 11:30. We were seated immediately.  The service was very attentive, and the food was great. The menu has interesting and inventive brunch options. We were all satisfied with the taste and portion size of our dishes. I had the Nutella filled Texas toast. It was a delicious dish-- the toast was not too doughy, nor too sweet. Well balanced and tasty.The restaurant has a nice sunny outdoor seating. Definitely recommend for a casual brunch.

reviews: Amazing place, found while passing by 34th Avenue. From the outside the place looked amazing for my wife's anniversary celebration diner. When we finally went there, no regrets. Amazing food specially the Rizzoto matriciana. Good appetizers as well.
extracted: Amazing food specially the Rizzoto matriciana Good appetizers as well

reviews: great spot. new for me and little out of my way but will be back for sure for full diner ;) I'm glad my friend brought me here.

A very cute, hip and spacious location tucked away in a more quiet and peaceful part of Astoria. Locale is fun and a great date night spot! Love the huge glass exterior giving the place a very "NYC" type of vibe. The food here is absolutely delicious! Met up with a couple girls here and we tried various items from the menu. We started off with their cheese platter with came with various cheese and bread. If you love cheese then this is a great way to explore your cheese buds. We also had their crostini trio with hummus artichoke, Burrata bruschetta and olive mix. OMG! The Burrata here is to die for! And upon inquiring about it the waitress informed me that it's homemade, which made the experience even more heavenly. Soft, gooey, yummy cheese that you won't be able to get enough of! Then, we shared an entree of the Gnocchi with truffle! Unique and creamy flavor, yet not as heavy as it looked which was great (if you're not a fan of truffles then this is not for you). Our waitress was awesome and service was excellent! They also offer a great brunch menu here which I'm definitely coming back!
extracted: The food here is absolutely delicious! If you love cheese then this is a great way to explore your cheese buds Soft, gooey, yummy cheese that you won't be able to get enough of! Our waitress was awesome and service was excellent!

reviews: VERY good!!! One of the best restaurants in the Astoria/Long Island City/Sunnyside neighborhood!! Been twice for brunch and everything has been wonderful! Get the side of bacon!!
extracted: VERY good Been twice for brunch and everything has been wonderful! Get the side of bacon

reviews: Came here for a weekend brunch. Cute space with a small surprise birthday party going on in the back section. We sat at the bar because the tables are full. The bartender who served us was welcoming. We got the fried oyster sandwich and california egg benedict. Absolutely in love with the sandwich!! The portion was also so big that my boyfriend and I had to finished it together. The egg Benedict was so-so. Probably should have tried the french toast because it looked amazing from other tables ;)The 10% discount deal was a plus. Will come back!
extracted: Came here for a weekend brunch We sat at the bar because the tables are full. Absolutely in love with the sandwich The egg Benedict was so-so. Will come back

reviews: This is one of the best brunch places in Astoria. This corner spot has a very peaceful vibe with wide/tall windows. The staff is very kind. We sat at the bar for brunch and our sandwiches were great. Side dishes awesome as well. Our bartender was very attentive and friendly. Would certainly go back.

reviews: This place is 3 blocks from my house its amazing! Robert, Anna, and (I believe his name is) Igor are the best! I love the food, and probably eat here more than my apartment!! Just a great atmosphere, on a very nice quiet street! and the food is fresh and always taste great! There are some reviews about waiting long for food, well the food is fresh-- and fresh food can sometimes take a little longer to cook then frozen fries in a deep frier! McDonalds is around the corner if you want fast food! Gastroteca is on 33rd if you want great food!

reviews: I think it's a good brunch spot here. I went here to try their oyster sandwich and smoke atlantic salmon crostino. I find it to be wonderful experience. I especially love the bread as it gave it a crunch texture from every bite you take. The poach eggs were pretty good and on spot. The place has a nice environment. It's good to take for the weekend brunch. I do have suggestions on improving the taste of the salad and roasted potatoes, which prevents me to give it a full five stars. The salad taste a bit bitter to me, but not sure if it's the salad dressing or not. Also, I feel that the potatoes should be moist yet crisp. It felt kind of dry, but everything else is great!
extracted: I especially love the bread as it gave it a crunch texture from every bite you take The poach eggs were pretty good and on spot. The place has a nice environment.

reviews: There are so many amazing things about this restaurant that I can't name a bad trait yet! The incredible atmosphere, amazing service, delicious food and decent prices, you can't go wrong with this place! It's become our new go-to. Next, we need to try brunch!
extracted: There are so many amazing things about this restaurant that I can't name a bad trait yet! The incredible atmosphere, amazing service, delicious food and decent prices, you can't go wrong with this place!

reviews: The ricotta donuts were hands down the best part. I could've eaten a whole brunch of JUST those. Everything else was good too -- we got the scampi polenta, and Californa benedict -- but really just raving about the donuts.
extracted: I could've eaten a whole brunch of JUST those.

reviews: Came for brunch and was very excited to be coming back here because I remembered the dinners being pretty good. When I saw one of my favorite country staples on the menu, I was overjoyed. However, what I received was quite a sad excuse for biscuits and gravy. My first gripe was the gravy, it was watery and tasted like they simply took a bit of hollandaise sauce and put some pan drippings in it to darken the color. Country gravy is supposed to be thick and milk based, made with chunks of sausage and sausage grease, loaded with pepper and spice. My second issue with the extremely thin buttermilk biscuit it arrived on, i'm going to guess the kitchen forgot the leaving agent because this thing was more like a dense pancake.TLDR Summary; Stick with the italian food and avoid the biscuits and gravy.

Came for brunch

reviews: The water was great; it was all down here from there. Our waitress was sweet. But the food was not to be desired. We went to a different place for dessert. Just a cool place to get a drink
extracted: The water was great; it was all down here from there. Our waitress was sweet.

reviews: I would have given your location 4 stars if the bartender would have not gotten upset over the fact that I pointed out my glass was dirty. I'm sorry but I refuse to drink from a dirty glass. As for the food the chef is a master indeed, the California egg benedict was made to perfection this includes the the home fries.  We also had the eggs benedict over a biscuit with gravy.....which was delicious.  As for the decor it's very hip and calls you in. The brunch is a little over priced, but the food is worth the price. Thanks again chef! On a positive note the bartender did change her attitude at the end, but the 1st impression is the last impression.
extracted: As for the decor it's very hip and calls you in. The brunch is a little over priced, but the food is worth the price. Thanks again chef On a positive note the bartender did change her attitude at the end, but the 1st impression is the last impression.

reviews: Ate here recently. The food was good, but the portions were small, and the pasta dishes were not served with any bread. The waiter was not particularly friendly. Will not eat here again.

reviews: Gastroteca is a great, inexpensive brunch spot in Astoria. I got the fried eggplant and burrata sandwich which was incredible, and a glass of mango juice. This place is extremely affordable- my sandwich was only about $12 and came with a salad or fries. I would recommend this place if you're in Astoria.
extracted: Gastroteca is a great, inexpensive brunch spot in Astoria. This place is extremely affordable- my sandwich was only about $12 and came with a salad or fries. I would recommend this place if you're in Astoria.

reviews: I loved it! Perfectly romatic place to finish off our movie night. :)
extracted: Perfectly romatic place to finish off our movie night.

reviews: Where do I start? We dropped by Gastroteca on a Sunday for brunch. It was our first time there and the decor from the outside drew is in although the ratings were not very high.I ordered the Bloody Mary to start and I must say, it had all the works but the taste was uninspiring. In it was cauliflower, celery, pickle and an olive amongst other fashionable ingredients but the flavor of the drink tasted watered down with only a bit of spice to show for it.For food, my girl got the California Benedict. She didn't seem to mind it much but she would later say it was just ok.I ordered the smoked salmon crostino with greens (trying to be healthy). The salmon was fishy and when I took a bite of the salad and I felt some sand but I hoped it was my imagination and finished the first bite. But my second bite made me have to spit the food out. I had to hunt down a server to complain and ask for home fries.Not being satisfied, we got the check only to find out they had charged us for coffee which we did not order. When I pointed this out to a server, he told me he'd get our server to fix it but the check came back with no revisions, forcing me to get up, go to the bar and make it more obvious.My final (and additional) thoughts on this place is that the employees are there more to socialize than to actually work a living. They were all just standing around or running around and not paying much attention. This place is not even worth the Yelp check-in and 10% discount!"Worst experience ever." - my fiancé when I told her just now that I'm writing this review

reviews: Used to be called Locale before a new owner bought the joint. nice scene for a brunch spot. tables are small, venue is a bit cramped, with high ceilings and lots of sunlight. Had the smoked salmon, didn't like it. the eggs benedict was alright. Unfortunate i had hair on my food even though they took it off the bill. Only reason id recommend this place is to have their sugar dusted texas french toast - its a must try!

reviews: Really nice brunch spot. We came here before going to the museum of the moving image. The eggs Benny was really good. My dad ordered the waffle but apparently the waffle machine was broken? So he got the Texas toast instead which was divine.
extracted: Really nice brunch spot. The eggs Benny was really good.

reviews: ****check the restaurants website for current menu...menu posted on this page is not current and slightly different Really good Italian food! Had some crostinis to start all were delicious! I think the deal was get 3 for $10 and they cut them in half which was perfect for my boyfriend and i to share. I had the spaghetti in a tomato Sauce with burrata cheese melted on top. SOOO amazing! My boyfriend had the veal which melted in your mouth. He only wished it came with a sauce but he used my extra sauce to dip. Tiramisu was light and fluffy...I usually like more espresso flavor but it was still good. Service was very good. It is on the pricey side but if you want to treat yourself to some nice Italian this would be the place to do it!

reviews: Nice ambience, very helpful bar staff - but the food is a little uneven. Enjoyed crostini with ricotta and honey, but Lamb ribs very overdone - not much edible meat. Brussels sprouts salad nice.

reviews: Great neighborhood spot. I love to sit outside in the warmer weather with a glass of their Super Tuscan and a bowl of Carbonara or Cacio e Pepe. My only complaint is that they can be a bit inconsistent in flavor some days being better than others. Their brunch carbonara topped off with an egg is just what the weekend ordered.

Movie projected on wall behind bar... "You've Got Mail". Über random, but charming. Per our server it's usually old black and white films. Till next time,Shopgirl

The fries were a small portion but just right not to feel super stuffed. Gabby the bartender is sexy and recommend a drink called "Freddy Kruger" spicy and great for my Saturday night hangover. Will be back for Gabby's number and to try another plate.

reviews: This is my go-to place since I live quite close. Great pasta, really nice waitstaff (they were very accommodating to my mom, who has a million restrictions and tends to be rude/cranky in restaurants). Only thing I would complain about is the baked eggs terra cotta. Definitely assumed they would be, you know, BAKED. But when I got them, they were completely runny - almost like they'd just cracked them and thrown them in. Granted, this was an order for pick-up, not eat in, so maybe that's the issue. But really? Not baked at all? They're in my oven now for half an hour. Truly annoying. So, GT, please specify if the dish will not actually be cooked. Everything else is great.

reviews: Roomie and I came for Sunday brunch around 12:30-1pm. We were both starving and looking forward to relaxing and enjoying our meal. We both ordered egg dishes, the California Benedict and the spinach and goat cheese omelet. I was satisfied with my omelet. The portion was filling and the flavors all melded well. My roommate seemed happy with her dish as well however the side of bacon left something else to be imagined. I subtracted a star for service. The waiter appeared to be overwhelmed (yes it was busy) but it also started to stress me out. We also waited a bit to be served. Overall I would come back and recommend it to a friend!

reviews: The food was good but pretty expensive for the portions. I had the carbonara. I liked it but was not filling.
extracted: The food was good but pretty expensive for the portions.

reviews: Negative brunch experience. Will not be returning. I had made a Opentable rezzie which was accommodated quickly, but after being seated, it took 20 minutes to get menus and water. We waited an hour for our brunch entrees and when I asked the server what was happening, she said that several patrons and 2 large groups had come in at the same time and there was a glitch in the computer system and the kitchen was backed up. She then apologized 3 times but not genuinely. More in the "whattaya gonna do?" vibe.To make matters worse, we got the bill and I was expecting some sort of % off for the poor food service. Nope. Full price on everything. No "I'm sorry dessert" or "drinks are on the house" apology from the manager. Come on, man. It would have been the least you could do for making us wait so long for appetizer-sized brunch plates which ranged in price from $9.50-$15.00 plus beverages.Luckily I used my Yelp promo code to get 10% off the bill. I told several people about my experience immediately after and they had said the owner and management changed and the quality of the food and service had gone down. It definitely shows!The best part - my portobello benedict had undercooked eggs. I mean, the egg white was still albumen clear. I didn't realize until after I had taken a bite and I had to go to Lockwood AND Ravenshead to use the bathroom! Thanks for the stomach ailment!AND P.S., Ravenshead has $15 unlimited brunch, large sized portions, no wait, no attitude and friendly staff. Should have gone there (or anywhere else for that matter!).

reviews: We had a lovely experience. Sat at the bar, no hassle, no wait, during brunch time. The outdoor seating was being hogged up, but the place is so airy that it all felt as if we were outside. The decor and ambiance are excellent, and the service at the bar was perfect. The food was good and the drinks were strong. Love the feel of the entire place, love that there is no TV and loved our bartender. Worth the try for brunch.

reviews: Best Italian place in Astoria, hands down. There's no pizza on the menu which is a major plus. Everything I've tried here so far has been amazing. They do weekday brunches which is perfect for someone like me who works over the weekends. My personal favorites are the crispy gnocchi and the spaghetti with blue crab. The food is not too heavy compared to some other Italian restaurants. Service is always friendly and accommodating. I love the decor and vibe of the place. Love the outdoor seating is great for when the weather is nice.
extracted: They do weekday brunches which is perfect for someone like me who works over the weekends The food is not too heavy compared to some other Italian restaurants. Love the outdoor seating is great for when the weather is nice.

reviews: Last night was my second visit to Gastroteca, a restaurant that's rapidly becoming a favorite. Located on a pretty, tree-lined street in Astoria, the cuisine is northern Italian; the ambiance is rustic hip; the service is impeccable, and the food is delectable and creative. The space is spacious with high brick walls, two levels, outdoor seating, a comfortable bar, and subtitled movies playing. On our first visit the young co-owner, who couldn't have more hospitable and welcoming, greeted us. The second time, Greg, the comely manager, was our host. He was suave, charming, and attentive. Our favorite waiter is Robert, an encyclopedia of information about food and the world. The food itself is fabulous. For appetizers, try the crostini with a selection of exotic toppings like ricotta, hazelnut, truffle honey or fig jam, ricotta, prosciutto. The burrata with lightly pickled spring vegetables, charred shallots, and agrodolce was the freshest I've had outside Italy. If they have them, don't miss the arancini with mozzarella and prosciutto. There's a good selection of primi piatti and secondi. One night I had risotto with sweet sausage, kale, fragioli and a fried egg. My companions had tagliata and bronzino. Last night it was cavatelli with lamb sausage and mint pesto. My companion had salads and veal meatballs. We shared a chocolate pots de crème for dessert and wished we had ordered two. The wine list is not extensive, but comprehensive and is well priced, as is the food.Astoria is an easy trip from Manhattan, so don't be daunted. It's worth getting on a subway or going over the bridge.
extracted: Last night was my second visit to Gastroteca, a restaurant that's rapidly becoming a favorite. Located on a pretty, tree-lined street in Astoria, the cuisine is northern Italian; the ambiance is rustic hip; the service is impeccable, and the food is delectable and creative. The space is spacious with high brick walls, two levels, outdoor seating, a comfortable bar, and subtitled movies playing. The burrata with lightly pickled spring vegetables, charred shallots, and agrodolce was the freshest I've had outside Italy. The wine list is not extensive, but comprehensive and is well priced, as is the food.Astoria is an easy trip from Manhattan, so don't be daunted.

reviews: Came here because we wanted to stay close locally and the place looked quaint and cute from the outside.  Big mistake.Sure, the place is gorgeous.  Outside seating with huge spacious tables and couches inside.  Classy urban decor akin to a West Elm/Pottery Barn hybrid.  The good news stops there.We had literally three different servers who were all over the place.  The first one sat us down, brought us our waters, and then disappeared.  The second one comes to take our orders, doesn't even bother to explain the specials or dessert of the day, and then saunters off to a big family who was celebrating a birthday and sticks to them for the rest of the night, completely ignoring us (can you make it any more obvious you were hustling for the tip?) while explaining to them in great detail what the specials were.  The third one stayed with us throughout the meal until the bill came.  The nightmare began with the food.  We ordered calamari to start which was good (can you really go wrong with that?), and then the house pastas which take about 20 min to prepare because they're made fresh.  They ran out of linguine, so they substituted with tagliatelle.  Portions were so small, I thought they were appetizers at first.  I was finished within a few forkfuls.  All that hype and commotion for $17?  It wasn't even that good.  I could've made a better version of my rigatoni.We wanted creme brulee, and then we're told they're out of tiramisu, creme brulee, and some other thing.  So we order the bread pudding instead.  Sugar overload.  I'm still regretting it.Overpriced mediocre food with spotty service along with multiple unavailable items on the menu?  Nah.

I was finished within a few forkfuls I could've made a better version of my rigatoni.We wanted creme brulee, and then we're told they're out of tiramisu, creme brulee, and some other thing. I'm still regretting it.Overpriced mediocre food with spotty service along with multiple unavailable items on the menu?

reviews: Cool location. Great ambiance. Really friendly and helpful staff. I didn't try much of the food, just some bread, olive oil, and pasta. I plan to come back to try more of their menu, but if the rest of it is anything like the embarrassing scoop of spaghetti that they were trying to pass off as cacio e pepe, I'm not optimistic.
extracted: Really friendly and helpful staff I plan to come back to try more of their menu, but if the rest of it is anything like the embarrassing scoop of spaghetti that they were trying to pass off as cacio e pepe, I'm not optimistic.

reviews: So happy to have found this place in Astoria! It's small with both a dining area and a "lounge" area, which is where we sat. We LOVED the 50s-70s music playing and the hangman game going on at the bar.The menu is mostly Italian with a modern twist. We started with 3 crostinos to share- ricotta and honey, burrata, and truffle asparagus w/ runny egg. So hard to choose which was the best, but I'd say my favorite was the last- can't resist a runny yolk!. We then went with the lamb meatballs which were EXCELLENT, and the green lasagna- so filling! Couldn't pass up the almond brownie with marshmallow and gelato! Cocktails were also great- I had the vanilla voltaire and the cinema paradiso with dessert. Both vodka-based and both amazing. The bartender told us that he came up with them himself, so we were definitely impressed! Gotta go if you're in the area- and worth the trip if not!

reviews: What a surprise! We are a family of four and each one of us loved our dish. The atmosphere was casual with large industrial windows allowed natural light into the restaurant. I was surprised how noisy the restaurant was especially since it was less than half full. But the food was wonderful! The Texas toast is a decadent outrage. And our dessert, the chocolate cake with chocolate gelato was one of the best desserts we have had. We will definitely be coming back here!
extracted: What a surprise The atmosphere was casual with large industrial windows allowed natural light into the restaurant. But the food was wonderful! We will definitely be coming back here!

reviews: I have now been here several times,  to include ringing in the New Year,  and it is hand's down,  my favorite spot in Astoria.  Whether I just want a cocktail,  or a gorgeous steak,  I always leave full and happy.  I am on a mission to bring everyone I know to Gastroteca!
extracted: I have now been here several times,  to include ringing in the New Year,  and it is hand's down,  my favorite spot in Astoria.

reviews: Locale is a very cute and hippy location in Astoria. Away from the main street region with a little bit of peace. However, during a hot day, they only have fans on which was very hot and humid inside the restaurant. Not to mention one of the fan was kind of broken. We had eight people in total for brunch. The location doesn't offer unlimited drinks and each of the mimosa costs about 7 each. I did like the flavor of the mango and passion mimosa's. However, it did take 20 minutes for those drinks to come.After ordering food, it took another 40 minutes for food to come, even though the place wasn't packed. The cobb salad I got was ok, nothing special about it. However, the lamb special was pretty good. If they can shorter the wait time and add brunch special to the drinks, i would definitely return.

Not to mention one of the fan was kind of broken. However, the lamb special was pretty good. If they can shorter the wait time and add brunch special to the drinks, i would definitely return.

reviews: A three.four brunch spot. It's a super solid brunch spot but just a few more things and it could have been a four star or higher restaurant/brunch spot.But first off, props to the bartender who was also our server. We were seated at the bar during a busy Sunday (although coincidentally a few minutes later a few seats opened up) and our bartender was not only able to keep up with her busy position but was also able to take our order, have the food come out quickly, and was checking in on us and refilling our water or soda without even asking. Fantastic service from her.Now what may have stopped the review from being a full on four star review was that although the food was satisfying and tasted just great it didn't really stand out too much. It wasn't underwhelming but it just didn't really blow our minds. I had the Ham, swiss, and mushroom omelet with home fries. Now although it tasted just fine, there really wasn't much flavor of cheese, nor was there much ham in the omelet at all. I did find a few mushrooms. And in addition it didn't seem a little "liquidy?" The toast it came with did taste good and the extra order of the side of American bacon I ordered tasted amazing. It was nice and crispy. My girlfriend ordered the California Benedict (which comes with avocado and roasted tomato) and that was pretty good. She had ordered a side of sausage which...was more like a beef patty and didn't have much flavor to it.The home fries were home fries.Overall it was a good experience and I'd be willing to come back here to try other things on the menu. Hopefully we get seated quickly like we did today.

reviews: Brunch was perfection - The Bloody Mary I got to start was delicious and the terracotta with eggs, cheese, beans, mushrooms and kale was well worth the 20 minutes it takes to make.  I'll definitely be back.

reviews: Nice ambiance, okay items on menu but not what I'd consider very brunch able. At least not like other brunches Ive had. The shrimp scampi is very good, but I don't like runny eggs and I asked for them to be cooked but they must've forgotten and it was mixed in with scampi so pointless to ask them to redo so I managed. the sugar toast however is very sweet & artery clogging fattening.

reviews: This is one of my favorite restaurants in Astoria. I come here regularly for dinner. The food is always delicious. The cocktails are great. The atmosphere is really pleasant and fun. Amazing pasta dishes. Kale salad really good. Just tried the asparagus appetizer-- best asparagus I've ever had. Consistently nice service.

reviews: This place has potential, but service is just so bad. Bar staff couldn't give a crap.

reviews: We had heard good things so we were excited to try.  Walk in... 5 open tables.  But were told by a condescending hostess that they were all reserved.  Ok that happens.  No biggie.  We were lookin around as to where we could hang out jackets.  She looked over at the about-to-topple coat rack.  And threw her hands up as if to say you're on your own.  I don't think wanting to hang our jackets is a luxury.  Anywho....Order meal from a hipster bartender who seemed grumpy.  I guess his organic supply store was out of beard cream or something cuz he seemed really annoyed.  Orange juice comes with ice in it.  Which only leads one to believe it's concentrate, at best.  Or orange drink, at worst.  My meal came with polenta.  It was creamy polenta.  Which, I just wish they would specify which kind of polenta it is.  Potatoes sucked.  Rest of it was decent.  Not great not bad.  We get check.  Leave cash.  Hostess rushes over as we put our coats on asking if we paid.  Do we look like we were skipping the tab? Please.  Side note, only one of those five open tables came. We could have sat there.  My recommendation is skip their brunch... but their dinner is still worthwhile.  The end.  Forgot to mention the servers, the ones who actually bring and take plates... were very sweet and kind.  Maybe I'm old fashioned but I think old school places work better where one person takes order and brings food.  It incentivizes good service.
extracted: But were told by a condescending hostess that they were all reserved We were lookin around as to where we could hang out jackets. Which, I just wish they would specify which kind of polenta it is. Rest of it was decent Not great not bad Do we look like we were skipping the tab We could have sat there. My recommendation is skip their brunch... but their dinner is still worthwhile. Forgot to mention the servers, the ones who actually bring and take plates... were very sweet and kind.

reviews: i came here for brunch with Juliet S. and our boos.  i really like the decor of the place, it's open and inviting, not too crowded either.  the window makes the place very bright and airy, perfect natural light for taking photos too.  we started with coffee (strong!) and latte.  after much deliberation, we got cali benedict (juliet), smoked atlantic salmon crostino (her bf), scampi & grits (me), and chicken club (bae).  the wait seems quite long, we chatted and drank lots of coffee until our food arrived.  they looked and smelled amazing!  my scampi and grits had shrimp, sausage, onion, peppers in a tomato sauce, and fried eggs on cheddar polenta and served with buttered toast (awesome!).  the scampi had great flavors and paired very well with the cheddar polenta.  the eggs were cooked sunnyside up, a bit too undercooked for me.  it was a very well executed dish.  the bf's chicken club has cheese-covered bread and sliced chicken breast (instead of whole chicken breast) and it's much more manageable to go with all the other ingredients.  the sandwich tastes really good too.  juliet and her bf seems to really enjoy their food as well.  i really liked this place, the food is excellent and very well-priced (i kept raving to the bf that it would cost much more to get the same quality of food elsewhere).  the service was a bit inattentive at times, but not a big deal breaker.  overall, a winner and we will definitely be back!

reviews: I have walked by this place many times always wanting to go try it, so one day I ended up having Sunday brunch here with my boyfriend.This restaurant had a delicious Sunday brunch. I had the smoked salmon Benedict and we shared the chocolate cake for desert. Will come again. :)
extracted: Will come again Sunday brunch

reviews: Let me start off with the positives: our waitress was an absolute sweet heart and did an awesome job handling our large party. the ambiance of the place is also great as well so definitely a great place for a big group. Foodwise, the calamari was very good as were the mussels and a pasta special with shrimp and sausage. The crostini's were just OK..I've definitely had better elsewhere and the beet salad was meh. I had the short ribs and was really excited to try it..they were cooked well but there was way too much rice and a lack of sauce. Now for the negative: you check in on yelp and are SUPPOSED to get 10% off. We did this and handed the phone to our waitress who seemed happy to cut us the deal. Sadly, some other b*tchy lady came up and said No, 10% off is only for parties of 4 or less - wait what? it doesn't say that anywhere. I decided not to argue because there were so many of us and it was not worth making a scene but come on..don't advertise a deal if you are not going to let yelpers use it. It doesn't specify anywhere that its for parties of 4 or less.Overall, I'd go elsewhere or just stop in here for a quick drink. For the money spent, I expected a heck of a better experience. Also, no reason to be rude when someone has a deal you are advertising!!

It doesn't specify anywhere that its for parties of 4 or less.Overall, I'd go elsewhere or just stop in here for a quick drink.

reviews: Absolutely terrible service. Don't bother making a reservation, it clearly does not matter. After waiting 40 minutes at the bar we still had not been seated. The restaurant clearly does not care about providing good customer service. After sitting down, the service still sucked. Horrible, horrible experience with extremely mediocre food. Overpriced garbage.
extracted: Absolutely terrible service. Horrible, horrible experience with extremely mediocre food.

reviews: Went back today - the last review was from when it was Locale. Anyway, much better meal this time (the shrimp/sausage/polenta dish is amazing) and delicious spicy drink, Freddy Krueger, which is a jalapeño Bloody Mary. The service was fine but slow when getting check, but overall a good experience. Love the many windows and the brightness inside.
extracted: Love the many windows and the brightness inside

reviews: Brunch at 4Had the poached eggs. Expertly crafted soft biscuits not doughy with a hard poached egg (not runny) and topped with a light gravy. Perfect for a light but filling breakfast.Service here is a notch above the rest. Beyond the refills of drinks comes salesmanship and concern for the pleasure of the customer. Try the freddy krueger. Its a bloody mary wi spicy vodka! They do get friendly wi the toppings. Lots of vegetables.

reviews: Great for dinner and for brunch but holy overpriced hell, a tad on the high side :/The decor is splendid, French windows, letting perfect light in during the day and shining perfect candle light out at night, very romantic, European vibe to it. Tasty Crostinis, fave was fig and goat cheese. They make their pasta in house, we had the Tagliatelle with truffle oil and veggies, definitely tasty but DRY, too dry for any pasta dish, especially one that's a small size and costs almost $20. The wine selection is nice, plenty of dishes to choose from on the menu, lovely place overall. GREAT for a date in my opinion, maybe just not a first date, you may creep him/her with the "romantic-ness" of this place.
extracted: The wine selection is nice, plenty of dishes to choose from on the menu, lovely place overall. GREAT for a date in my opinion, maybe just not a first date, you may creep him/her with the "romantic-ness" of this place.

reviews: Food, staff, service, drinks, ambience, prices all on point. Very decent happy hour ($3 Stella/Amstel light, $4 founder IPA, $5 wine). We had two salads and loved them both.pasta was great as well. Great dinner and we can't wait to come back and try the brunch.
extracted: We had two salads and loved them both.pasta was great as well. Great dinner and we can't wait to come back and try the brunch.

reviews: 2.5 stars. Good ambience. Slow service. Have three different types of eggs benedict on the menu, but my poached egg was extremely overcooked (hard yolk) which kills eggs benedict in my opinion.  The baked eggs was flavorful and filling. Ok food, nothing special.
extracted: The baked eggs was flavorful and filling.

reviews: The best brunch place in Astoria. We had vegetable terra cotta, gnocchi, and California  Benedict, and they were all fantastic. Our waiter the last time was a bit snobbish, acting like he had other, more important things to do and we were interrupting him, but other than that great spot in Astoria
extracted: The best brunch place in Astoria

reviews: I have gone here a few times and always have had a good meal.  I enjoy the fried eggs with cheddar polenta and keep having the same dish when I go, but others have had the California Benedict and various omelets and have enjoyed those. Lots of interesting drink choices as well. Service is friendly and attentive. I like eating outside here in the summer
extracted: Lots of interesting drink choices as well enjoy

reviews: Went here for Fathers Day. Great medium sized restaurant thats away from the main hustle bustle of Broadway. The crostinis are delicious and each one is easily shareable by two people so you can sample and discover your favorites.The mussles here in the garlic sauce were perfect. Probably better than some seafood restaurants and french places ive gone to.Vanilla voltaire is a fantastic drink if you're looking for some cocktails.The steak was declious. A little bit overcooked but im not too fussy so I didn't bother to send it back or anything. I ordered a medium and it came out closer to well done.Wait staff is very attentive and smiles al around and it shows they like where they work, which is great to see compared to other restaurants in are where they look like theyre counting down the minutes to go home.The decor of the place is what I'd call vintage 2.0 where early 1900s meets modern conveniences throughout such as built in speakers for music and tvs around. The music is catchy too that they play but it be even more awesome if they played some old school vinyl records or hits to match the decor, maybe not every night but it be a welcome change up from hearing the music you usually hear on the radio....actually a good balance would be finding bands like Scott Bradlee and Post Modern Jukebox who takes pop hits and transforms them to motown verisons etc...playing their music from time to time would really add to the unique atmosphere provided by the space and help separate it further from the generic ultra modern spots in Astoria.Definitely recommend this place for a nice dinner for a date, family outing and groups of friends. Id say make a reservation through opentable though as the place did fill up.

Id say make a reservation through opentable though as the place did fill up

reviews: Great choice for cold weather.Great design by the folks at Locale for incorporating an additional pathway onto the front door that prevented the cold draft from creeping into the restaurant every time someone opens the door. (I guess the owners look at Yelp responses seriously and took the previous feedback into consideration.)The restaurant decor was FANtastic and had an eerie comfort to it. My girlfriend and I were lucky and got seated on top of the podium in the corner. The seats were very comfortable, which made the hike through the storm worth it. She got the Sugar Dusted Texas Toast stuffed with Nutella...and DAM that's some good sweets. Crunchy soft and warm french toast slightly breaded with cornflakes (is that what it was?) And than stuffed generously with Nutella with a side of syrup. ...OYEah.I got the portobello bendict with wilted spinach and truffle oil...Not a typical dish I would order since there's no meat in it, but it did the job. The mushroom appeared to be infused with balsamic vinegar which gave it a nice tangy kick. Hollandaise sauce and egg was perfecto, nice proportion and consistency with the overall size of meal. The truffle oil just brought everything together, happily together..than again when does it not? Had homefries on the side but didn't care much for it. So the meals were perfect but drinks..not so much. I believe it was slightly over priced. The "freddy krueger" which was just a spicier version of the bloody mary .. $9, seriously?  That's the same price as the first dish we got. Maybe if it was $6 or $7, i wouldve gotten another 1-2 refills. After we finished our drinks, the waitress came around and asked if we wanted another round with a smirk on her face. She probably knew we were going to say 'no' but still asked...wonder why she had the smirk?? Wait, but ask us how our food was? Guess she nor anyone else there cared much for that.Overall, our two dishes were great and where we got seated was nice including the overall decor of the restaurant. Minor details need work on but I would not mind coming back...

The seats were very comfortable, which made the hike through the storm worth it. And than stuffed generously with Nutella with a side of syrup ...OYEah.I got the portobello bendict with wilted spinach and truffle oil...Not a typical dish I would order since there's no meat in it, but it did the job. So the meals were perfect but drinks..not so much. I believe it was slightly over priced. Guess she nor anyone else there cared much for that.Overall, our two dishes were great and where we got seated was nice including the overall decor of the restaurant.

reviews: Perhaps, I was reconnecting with a homegirl over wine, talkin' about love, spirituality and the calm after the storm. And this joint made it feel zen. Sweet waitress, fast ass service, lightning bolt bartender....and it was chill and quiet (despite being busy) and lovely.Skatefish appetizer with avocado puree was delish, slightly battered and fried. It was a specialSwordish with purpleeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeee potatoes and crispy onion strings. Being a kid at heart and a chip lover, I think I decided to get this cuz of the onion strings. Kinda like a salt filling magnet, you know. Nonetheless, the fish was cooked perfectly. Silky and gulpy. don't listen to them wine buffs about white with fish. Malbec and fish is also just as marvelous. MmmHomegirl got duck breast. At the first bite, it unraveled me in regards to other finer establishments like Jean Georges which served an almond crusted duck breast and automatically, folks gon be like "oooooooooooo danggg" but it was so confusing in the mouth--too craycray of a fushion for me. Sorry Jean.  An entree like the duck breast. tasted simpler here at Locale and juicier. sometimes you just like shiz as simple as possible. dug this place a lot.

Silky and gulpy An entree like the duck breast tasted simpler here at Locale and juicier sometimes you just like shiz as simple as possible dug this place a lot

reviews: Fantastic spot. Servers are on the ball and attentive. Food is DIVINE. Atmosphere is perfect. Great bar. The service is top notch.
extracted: The service is top notch.

reviews: The former Local still offers up the same American/Italian fare under a completely different name. Gastroteca- as explained by our exemplary waitstaff, is a portmanteau of gastropub and the Italian enoteca, which they is present in their menu, with a melding of Italian and American dishes.It's super cozy, yet out of the way- the bustle of 30th ave is far away, so this stands out as a gem on 36th (although nearby is Mar's and Snowdownia), but still a spot that should be visited. The brunch Bloody Mary comes with a side of salad- carrots in a Bloody Mary are a surprise- because when I'm finished with the olive, the pickle, the cucumber, the carrot has soaked up a delivers the rest of the booze with a crunch. Good stuff.Crispy Gnocchi w/ pistachio, spinach, basil pesto, ricotta salate- perfect. The gnocchi has a slight crunch to it, which for most of the doughy Gnocchi I've had is welcome relief. Very light and very unassuming, as when I was feeling stuffed after four bites. It's definitely for the hearty eater.If visiting the area for brunch, put this on your list. If you live in the area, put this on your list. If you are from out of town, ask your friends/family that live in the area to take you here.
extracted: The former Local still offers up the same American/Italian fare under a completely different name. The brunch Bloody Mary comes with a side of salad- carrots in a Bloody Mary are a surprise- because when I'm finished with the olive, the pickle, the cucumber, the carrot has soaked up a delivers the rest of the booze with a crunch.

reviews: The place is nice mellow environment limited menu. NOTE don't order the chicken club sounds good but it's not happening very dull and tasteless. Although beaked portobello mushrooms with eggs and kale was the upside. Overall decent for only breakfast not recommend for lunch or dinner.

reviews: We were originally sad to see "Locale" go, and we enjoyed it a lot then.  While we enjoyed it before, their cuisine has improved so much from what we enjoyed back then.  The reboot is extremely successful. Fresh, beautiful and delicious.  Staff incredibly friendly and efficient.  Lovely space.

reviews: Perfect brunch spot for delicious cocktails and somewhat new take on brunch inspired dishes.  For example, I ordered the California Benedict, which is eggs Benedict minus the Canadian ham but with avocado.  It was a delicious combination I would definitely order it again. My friend ordered the smoked salmon omelette that came with hashbrowns and she loved it. My other friends ordered the regular omelette and loved that as well. The cocktails were delicious they had mango, passion and regular mimosas, mojitos, bloody marys and my personal fave, the "Freddy Krueger" which was a very special bloody Mary with a peppered rim, and goat cheese stuffed olive and of couse, the celery stick!!!  YummyThe atmosphere is nice and cozy, feels like you are in someone's living room.  High ceilings, curtains, beautiful wallpaper and lots if windows.

My other friends ordered the regular omelette and loved that as well. YummyThe atmosphere is nice and cozy, feels like you are in someone's living room. Yum

reviews: Delicious!!!!!! Such a nice surprise in Astoria. Decor was beautiful, food and cocktails were delicious!!! I had the spaghetti- only complaint was the sauce was a little acidic. Will absolutely go back! Great for a romantic dinner!
extracted: Delicious Such a nice surprise in Astoria Decor was beautiful, food and cocktails were delicious!!! Will absolutely go back Great for a romantic dinner

reviews: Love this place so much! Nice ambiance, good service and excellent food! I had the roasted oysters for appetizer, duck for entree, chocolate cake & coconut custard for dessert! Happy belly!
extracted: Love this place so much Love this place Love this place Love this place Love this place Love this place

reviews: I love this place just everything about it, thumbs up,  been visiting this place for the longest

Really, really enjoyed this place for brunch. I rarely venture into Queens but will be doing so more because of my experience at Gastroteca! I absolutely loved the modern, open space inside. It was simultaneously country/rustic but had that trendy white brick walls and bright red wood for all the tables. We had made a reservation for 12p on a Saturday and it wasn't too packed, but by 1-1:30 it became much more crowded. (0.5 point knocked off for the smell of smoke on our waiter from his seemingly recent smoke break)I got one of their eggs benedict specials with roasted potatoes and bacon the side. All very fresh and well-prepared. I also love how it the restaurant seemed to be a bit off the beaten path. 34th Ave seemed to be quieter, which is always a nice thing in this city.Definitely going to come back!

(0.5 point knocked off for the smell of smoke on our waiter from his seemingly recent smoke break)I got one of their eggs benedict specials with roasted potatoes and bacon the side. enjoy

reviews: I'm a local at Locale (teehee). Its my go-to neighborhood restaurant for that special occasion, girl's night out, or morning after brunch. I take my mom here. It my friend's default first date location. All with good reason!Locale has consistently great food that won't make your wallet cry in the morning. Its comparable to a lot of really good meals you'll have in Manhattan with a shave off the price, less competition for a table, and much less pretentiousness. The brunch is good (eggs benedict is superb) and the waffles too. I typically order off the specials off the menu when it comes to dinner, which is like getting a great surprise every time I eat here. The first time it was a rack of lamb. The second time it was the seafood linguine. Tonight it was a whole grilled branzino and duck with parsnips. Deeeelish! Chocolate souffle is the go to dessert pretty much every time. The ambiance is chill and cozy. The waitstaff is excellent. And I am always thrilled with the food. Enjoy!
extracted: All with good reason!Locale has consistently great food that won't make your wallet cry in the morning. Its comparable to a lot of really good meals you'll have in Manhattan with a shave off the price, less competition for a table, and much less pretentiousness. The brunch is good (eggs benedict is superb) and the waffles too.

reviews: This place is great for a low-key brunch or a big pow-wow. I had the pleasure of dining at Locale with a group of 11 on a Saturday afternoon and the food, drinks, service and decor were all top-notch. When making the reservations, I had to call twice to make an update to the time & headcount and the staff was super accommodating, which was well appreciated & constitutes a note-worthy mention. The dining area was spacious and both inviting and comfortable with ample outdoor seating, for those that wish to dine al-fresco! We ordered a number of different dishes including the smoked salmon crostini, steak & eggs, and nutella french toast to name a few. The smoked salmon was fresh and complemented nicely with the aioli spread served with a fried egg on top and the nutella french toast was a star of its own, as it was devoured quickly among the group. The french toast was perfectly crispy while the nutella melts in your mouth. We all had a great time and were happily satisfied with our meals.  I couldn't have imagined any other way to spend a Saturday brunch with friends! Kudos to Locale for being a neighborhood gem!

The french toast was perfectly crispy while the nutella melts in your mouth. I couldn't have imagined any other way to spend a Saturday brunch with friends! Kudos to Locale for being a neighborhood gem

reviews: Stellar meal. Went after seeing pictures on Instagram week after week, finally got off our butts and went for dinner. For cocktails I had the tully, which was Hendricks gin, grapefruit, cilantro, and bitters. My girlfriend had the honey comb which was bourbon (I think?) chamomile tea, lemon and sugar, served hot. Perfect since it was such a rainy night!Started with three Crostinos: bacon and black pepper aioli, burrata with white bean hummus and tomato sauce, and a special one with roasted garlic purée, basil, and (I forget which) cheese. All fabulous.I had rigatoni bolognese. The sauce was perfectly seasoned and the texture of the fresh made pasta was so great, perfectly al dente. My girlfriend had the crispy pesto gnocchi. We loved it because we had never had anything like it. Seriously, crispy gnocchi? How do you do thatFor dessert we shared the coconut panna cotta with coconut sorbet and guava soup, and the dark chocolate cake with burnt orange ice cream. I honestly loved everything, and have no complaints other than that I completely forgot to use my 10% off yelp coupon, but that's my own fault! Seriously. Go to gastroteca.
extracted: Perfect since it was such a rainy night!Started with three Crostinos: bacon and black pepper aioli, burrata with white bean hummus and tomato sauce, and a special one with roasted garlic purée, basil, and (I forget which) cheese. The sauce was perfectly seasoned and the texture of the fresh made pasta was so great, perfectly al dente. Go to gastroteca

reviews: Had my daughters bridal shower here yesterday food and service impeccable everyone was raving about the food selections can't praise them enough it was a stress free event we emailed two or three times ,dropped off the decorations the day before and they handled it flawlessly all we had to do is show up ,easy to get to from upper east side 35 minutes by subway so worth it .

I was so excited to come here, since I love the space too bad that was the only thing that was good.Basically the food took forever and since everyone else was eating when we got there I didn't understand what took so long. When the food arrived it was cold, and honestly for the price the presentation and portions were underwhelming.Leslie D. got the special which $17 something for a chicken breast and some veggies, it looked pretty un-appetizing to say the least.Overall it was just bad and I left hungry and annoyed, bottom line is there is so many good brunch places closer than me with way better deals for brunch and i will not be coming back here.

reviews: Came here for New Year's brunch and luckily got seated within 10 minutes! My initial impression of this place was that the atmosphere was cute. While the food was decent, the service was not. The servers were socializing a lot more than taking orders/cleaning tables/etc. My favorite part of the meal was the mimosa! The poached eggs and the atlantic salmon were pretty good. The salmon might have been a little salty for my taste. But unfortunately, the experience was ruined due to the lack of service my table received.

The waiter was super nice, patient, and helpful he was trying to help us figure out what we wanted(just like every waiter should be) 100points!!!! And the bartender was super friendly (like every bartender should be) and it as hilarious watching my older brother trying to get her number HAHAHA!! She makes awesome drinks! God job guys!

reviews: Cute place to go for brunch. Staff is very friendly. The Nutella French toast is AMAZING!

reviews: Awesome pasta, awesome space, awesome service. The kale Cesar made our night. I'll be back with or/and without my family.

reviews: Girlfriend and I popped in for brunch on a Sunday. Food was good, service was good. They had a projector playing a movie on the wall, which was nice. There was a hornet buzzing around my girlfriend that I had to kill; I'm not sure if I should give a star for the opportunity to save her life or take a star away for allowing a hornet into the restaurant. But then again, I guess that's the price you have to pay for having an open air restaurant and serving food with syrup. So I'll give a star!

So I'll give a star! Food was good, service was good.

reviews: The food is small portioned but great and our server was doing anything he could to accommodate us, but what I am assuming is the management is lacking majorly here. We came one Friday or Saturday night, made a reservation through open table. checked in and waited at our table for the other members of our group. Unbeknownst to me, one of the other members of our party ended up needing to bring her daughter. They did have a high chair...but absolutely no food to accommodate children. We asked if French fries were possible or a spaghetti with marinara? No and no "No French fries on Fridays"  I could tell in the servers face hat he was embarrassed and said I'll see what I can do, he spoke to the manager and came back with a disappointed face. So the evening goes on and we had our entrees and everything was delicious. I rarely ever finish my entire plate of food...so that means it was great but honestly very small portions  for the price. The thing that threw my entire evening off was them proceeding to close up the restaurant at 11pm. On a weekend. A member of our group wanted to treat the table so had gotten up to do so without anyone knowing. The waiter came back and handed the already processed card receipt over and informed us that our friend (who had stepped outside to smoke) had paid. I asked the waiter if I could have another glass of wine and I would pay cash on a separate check. The waiter walked over to that manager one more time, and came back with a disappointed face one more time. He said I'm sorry we can't. I was in shock after just spending close to $200 on a mediocre meal for four that I wasn't allowed one more glass of wine. What restaurant closes this early in Astoria on a weekend? The food was good, and I have always wanted to try brunch here but maybe when management takes a course in accommodating guests, I'll think about it.

No and no "No French fries on Fridays"  I could tell in the servers face hat he was embarrassed and said I'll see what I can do, he spoke to the manager and came back with a disappointed face. The food was good, and I have always wanted to try brunch here but maybe when management takes a course in accommodating guests, I'll think about it.

reviews: Great food went for my birthday. Like the nice and cozy ambience. Drinks are a bit on the expensive size and foo portion size is somewhat small. But over a great place.

reviews: New management so some new menu items --- shrimp and grits are very good. Mango mojito is still solid. This place used to have the best coffee--- sadly no longer:( pls bring back the original coffee!
extracted: New management so some new menu items --- shrimp and grits are very good. Mango mojito is still solid.

reviews: Brunch was a bit disappointing. I used to go there all the time when  it was Locale but moved out of Queens for a few years. The decor remained the same, still airy and cool, menu seemed similar. Prices for brunch were high in comparison to portion size. The eggs and fries, both my order of poached Italian and my bf's scrambled, lack flavor. The Belgian waffles were pretty good. I'd still give it another chance for dinner, options sound great. Service was lacking, except the host who was more attentive than our waiter and still friendly. Not ready to give up on this place!

reviews: Totally tasty! We had a variety of meals (party of 3) and everything was wonderful! The crustini were tasty and getting a variety was a treat. I had crispy gnocchi and it was amazing! I've never had this before and I am still dreaming about it. My friend had a seafood dish that I can't remember the name of but I can remember the taste! Yum!!!!!! Such a cool atmosphere too! They were playing silent movies on the white brick wall behind the bar. Definitely worth a shot, go check it out!

reviews: Our group ordered a wide variety of appetizers which all happened to be seafood. The crab cakes are closest your going to get to Baltimore status. I'm usually indifferent on mussels but they were outstanding as well as the calamari.The ambiance was very intimate and romantic but our work group make it work. The staff was really nice and attentive.
