reviews: We live in Astoria and had been looking forward to going to Locale for a while. We went for dinner at Locale tonight and we will never go back ever again. The hostess was not even cordial. We were a group of three and were seated outside as requested. After 15mins of being ignored ( not even a glass of water really?) . PS we ended up going to Brick Cafe where their service and food was spectacular!

reviews: order the steak and eggs (poached)... thank me later... for those of you with a sweet tooth... the French Toast is for you... pretty much everything else is on point there... enjoy!!!
extracted: enjoy

reviews: Locale is located in a quiet part of Astoria (well, a block away from bustling Broadway). Since it is a small space, the tables are kind of close together and it gets loud so do not expect to have quiet conversations. Our server was friendly and attentive. Our coffee mugs never got past the half empty point as servers kept coming around with refills.I really enjoyed all aspects of my meal. Their Portabello Benedict and Nutella Stuffed French Toast were to die for. The home fries were well seasoned and delicious. What is that amazing slightly crisp/buttery topping they put on top of the French Toast? I am guessing it was crack since I cannot wait to come back!

reviews: We went here for brunch for the first time today and it was a great experience. I got eggs benedict and my girlfriend got the spinach and goat cheese omelette. The food was good but even better than the food was the service! Hands down one of the best restaurant service experiences we've had. Robert was our waiter and he and the rest of the staff were super friendly and attentive without being overbearing. We'll definitely be back!

reviews: I drove by this place a few times and was mesmerized by the damask wallpaper, and I knew that I had to try this place.  After coming here for a brunch though, I have to say the physical space and decor were the best thing about it.One of the most attractive things about this place is the ambiance.  The restaurant itself is on a corner and has nearly two full walls of windows.  The back corner is on a bit of a platform, which makes for an interesting view if you're seated there.  Also, in the summer, they have a fair amount of outdoor seating on a not-too-busy street.  As I said, I went here for brunch, so I can only really speak about my experience of their brunch menu.  I had the California Benedict, which was a standard eggs benedict with avocado.  My friend ordered a spinach and goat cheese omelet.  Both dishes were good, but there wasn't anything special about it.  The eggs were cooked as we expected, but there wasn't much flavor.  The sides were also standard--nothing too exciting.This place is a fine place for standard brunch, but I don't know that I would return her for anything specific.  The area has so many other restaurants that I'd rather try what others have to offer before coming here again.

The sides were also standard--nothing too exciting.This place is a fine place for standard brunch, but I don't know that I would return her for anything specific. The area has so many other restaurants that I'd rather try what others have to offer before coming here again.

reviews: A good menu that's not too big--hooray for some focus.  The desserts are delicious too (the boyfriend prefers the chocolate cake while I'm partial to the brownie).  Nice big windows and opportunities to sit outside in the good weather.  As I was trying to pick between orange juice and tea, the cheery waitress suggested an orange-flavored tea.  A great beverage solution, and grateful she didn't push the up-sell.  Going here for brunch is much more pleasant than trying to do the same in Manhattan.

reviews: Came here for brunch. Overall, I thought the service and ambiance were nice. The portobella benedict was good, though I would have like more portabella on my benedict, and more home fries on the side (definitely stingy there). I like the diversity of the menu, which includes brunch staples as well as more unique additions. For a nice Astoria brunch, the prices are average and the food is good. It's not crowded either, so if you live in the 'hood it might do you well to come here instead of heading into the city for your benedict. Also, they take reservations for brunch, while some of my favorite Manhattan brunch haunts do not.

It's not crowded either, so if you live in the 'hood it might do you well to come here instead of heading into the city for your benedict.

reviews: The California Benedict is a joke -- "avocado" promised on the menu is a couple dollops of guacamole and you could hardly make out the roasted tomato at all under the poached egg. And while the service started strong, it quickly reverted to Locale's old reliable ineptitude (I was hoping that would not be inherited in the turnover) as I was left without a beverage throughout the majority of my entree (promised hot water for tea never came and my empty water glass never filled.)

reviews: I really want to like Locale more... I like the corner of Astoria it's in. I like the decor. I like their ultra friendly and professional wait staff. But even after coming here every so often for dinner, I was never fully sold on it. The #1 thing that warrants my 3 star rating is the food. Don't get me wrong - it's good. I'd say ever so slightly above average actually. But in the 2 years or so I come here, the menu has never changed and even the 'specials' always seem to be the same. You know how you might have a restaurant, cafe, etc. with a signature dish? A dish that really makes you say "oh man, I just got a hankering for the ABC dish at XYZ establishment?". Locale doesn't have that. The menu is pretty lackluster; you're standards like veal scallopine, seared salmon, a few pasta dishes, etc. Hey, this might be exotic dining for some, but for me, it's a big yawn. Plus, the last drink my girlfriend has there, a mojito, tasted like someone dropped a shot of dish washing soap in it...Unless someone is treating me here, don't know if I'll actively try to come back any time soon.

reviews: Solid brunch spot in Astoria on a quiet street. Easily accessible via NQ trains, lots of street parking nearby. Staff is attentive but the kitchen is slooooow.Every item on the menu was ordered - nobody complained, but there wasn't a wave of silence when the food came either. The bloody mary was on par with my expectations (had to ask for tobasco).
extracted: Solid brunch spot in Astoria on a quiet street Staff is attentive but the kitchen is slooooow.Every item on the menu was ordered - nobody complained, but there wasn't a wave of silence when the food came either.

reviews: I used to really love this place. The food has changed and not for the better. My roommate used to come all of the time and has stopped. I decided to give it another go since it is so cute and so close. Service was.. Ok. Everyone was very nice. But it took forever for anyone to come around to clear plates, refill water, take orders and pick up the bill. The starters were not good. The sprout salad wasn't good either. I hardly touched it. Several different people waited on me so that was confusing and I felt lost in the shuffle. I was going to stay for dessert but it took so long for anyone to come back I decided to just get the bill. I'll come back for the outdoor seating but for the wine and view only.

reviews: A brunch spot for old friends catching up last minute, we went without reservations but were seated immediately at the bar. The bartender and staff addressed us patiently as we changed our minds a dozen times before finally deciding - hey, we can order it all instead of trying to decide what dish to eat!And so we started off with Bloody Mary-s, and for me, a mango Mojito. Poached eggs with biscuits and gravy, and the Begian waffles for me off the menu. Wow. Totally worth feeling like a fatass. Paired with apple smoked bacon to boot. As for everything else, after my meal I couldn't fit to taste, but the plates were eaten clean and by the look of the satisfied smiles all around, this place is a solid 5 I'd say. Definitely give it a go.10% off bill if you check in, which I forgot to do because I was too busy figuring out what to eat. Boo. Well worth the total bill nonetheless!

reviews: The ambiance in this restaurant was very cute and the wait staff was excellent. I would have to give it lower reviews because the chicken club sandwich I ordered was not good at all. the bread was dry and burned and it was sliced chicken like in deli ham. Not what I anticipated. My sister ordered the waffles which were tasty and looked way better than my chicken club. I need to go back and try another meal before I can give it a better review.

reviews: Sunday brunch is the best! Was there a couple of weeks ago, service is fast and food is good! Nice outdoor seating'

reviews: Went here last Sunday with two friends because we were able to make a reservation and I know how crazy brunch can get in Astoria.  The best way to describe Locale is meh.  Two of us got the Chicken Club Sandwich which comes with prosciutto, avocado and garlic aioli.  Those are three of my favorite things so I figured the sandwich had to be great.  Unfortunately, the sandwich was just boring.  I should bring up that even though no cheese is listed on the menu, there was cheese melted onto every slice of bread.  I can't eat dairy, so that was an immediate issue for me.  The waitress was more than kind and brought back a cheese-less sandwich very quickly.  I thought maybe the lack of cheese was why my sandwich was so bland, but my friend who ate the sandwich with cheese also found the meal tasteless.  The aioli was really just mayo, the avocado was under ripe and even the prosciutto didn't taste like much.The atmosphere and service are pretty great, though those are really the only high points of my experience at Locale.

reviews: Came on a dinner date with my wife and the food is awesome! We got the Balsamic Glazed Lamb Ribs and the Tagliatelle Aragosta with lobster. They were tasty! The pasta was freshly made and the lamb was good! To finish we got a Tiramisu! My verdict: GO!!!
extracted: We got the Balsamic Glazed Lamb Ribs and the Tagliatelle Aragosta with lobster. The pasta was freshly made and the lamb was good!

reviews: Good food, nice portion size, amazing wait staff. They were super attentive to us and very accommodating for our large party on Easter Sunday. Would definitely come again!
extracted: Would definitely come again

reviews: We were party of 14 and came here for brunch to celebrate my baby shower. When we arrived to the restaurant we were immediately welcomed by the staff and got escorted to our table that was nicely set up at the balcony area. Ambience is very nice at this place. I believe that whenever you celebrate any event it is never great unless you recieve a great service. Our server Allyson was the BEST, absolute sweetheart! Very knowledgeable about the menu, extremely professional, courteous, attentive and provides A+ quality service. She was always around asking if we were fine or needed anything. Our drinks were refilled on time, and they were absolutely delicious. Their Bloody Mary's and Passion mimosas are a must have. It didn't take long food to arrive and everybody were happy with their meal. I ordered steak and eggs, it was really good, right temperature. The only thing, I wish steak could have a little more char grill taste to it. At the end of our meal they brought our cake with candles and flaming torch on it along with warming congratulations.  It was awesome. Overall our experience at Gastroteca was great and I will definitely come back.

reviews: We went here for brunch today. We are big brunch fans and like to try new places when we can-this place has taken our #1 spot on brunch rankings. I had the Nutella stuffed French toast-it was scrumptious. My friend had the eggs Benedict, which he reviewed as very delicious also.  I also had the Freddy Kreuger-a Bloody Mary with jalapeño infused vodka-which was amazing. The jalapeño vodka gave the Bloody Mary a spicy flavor that made all the difference. I was surprised that the crowd was quite thin on a Saturday at 1130 am-but that just means more brunch for me! Service was great as well!!! We loved everything about Locale!!!!

reviews: Let me start off by saying I don't think this place deserves less than a 4 star. That said, this place is a little underwhelming with the food. The menu is brilliant, but when the food comes out, it's just ok. I got the poached eggs with biscuits and gravy and I honestly thought I'd get a side of b&g, but it was just a small portion of 2 biscuit halves with eggs on it and a spoonful of gravy on each. My his mad got an omelette and potatoes and said the potatoes tasted like they had been frozen. However, the food IS tasty, the service is very friendly, the place is clean, and the ambiance is great. The prices are good and you get enough food. It's probably a place better suited for couples and friends, although you could bring well behaved kids here. The seating is very close together and open. I will say that it was a special occasion, my birthday, and I don't feel like they made any kind of big deal about that (like Martha's Bakery on Ditmars did ) I thought hey, maybe a free OJ on the house or something. I've had a nice experience coming here each time with my husband, though, and we'll definitely be back. It's a solid choice for brunch or any other meal or drinks.

reviews: I really wanted to like this place but somethings disappointed me a bit. My fried egg was still clearly undercooked, the sausage patty was under seasoned, and my boyfriend's steak was cooked unevenly. The coffee was delicious and the atmosphere was nice. I am going to give it another shot for a different course.
extracted: The coffee was delicious and the atmosphere was nice.

reviews: We went here for date night on a whim of trying anew place and headed to a movie after. The food was awesome, not a heavy plated Italian place. The portions were small but in a way that didn't make you feel super full on the way out. Our waitress was lovely, super sweet. Would highly recommend for a a quality place off the main roads in Astoria.
extracted: The portions were small but in a way that didn't make you feel super full on the way out. Would highly recommend for a a quality place off the main roads in Astoria

reviews: Normally I don't write reviews on Yelp but this place is so great I had to! A few months ago I moved to Astoria and my girlfriend and I came for a drink because it looked really cute and intimate. Not only was the wine great (and at 5 dollars a glass for happy hour very affordable) but their homemade pastas were out of this world. I got the spaghetti stracchino and she got the pappardelle verde (white bolognese sauce), which was a special at the time but it was so popular the restaurant put it on their new fall menu. We've been coming back regularly ever since, and have to say the staff is incredibly warm, friendly, and accommodating. We look forward to coming here all the time and are very excited to try more new dishes on their fall menu!  I highly recommend this place for anyone visiting Astoria--although we try new places from time to time we always say Gastroteca is better and that we wish we had gone there instead.

We look forward to coming here all the time and are very excited to try more new dishes on their fall menu!

reviews: I want to like this place SO BAD.  This is my third time there.Reasons to disregard my review:1) It was brunch at noon on a Sunday, so it was crowded2) There were two large parties of about 8 (with children) there when we arrived3) I was with a group of 64) I am generally a cranky personBut here's my experience.The good:-The ambiance is great.  Great size, great light, corner restaurant, option for a more secluded area with couches.  - The server was very nice- Decent coffeeThe not-so-good:The food was terrible.  It took 35 minutes (forgiven, you were busy and had two huge parties ahead of us), and when it arrived, 2 of our entrees were cold.  My guy friends ordered the recommended breakfast burrito - said it was mostly cheese and rice.  My waffles were gross AND THEY USED FAKE SYRUP.  We asked for real syrup but were told "I'm not sure, sometimes we have it but sometimes we don't."  You're called Locale!!! I guess shame on me for believing the name..?The manager (owner?) came by and asked how everything was so I told him the truth.  He was apologetic, and offered to comp one of the meals.  But he didn't -- gave us free mimosas instead (I was sick so alcohol wasn't appealing).  If you take 35 minutes to bring food and it's cold, you should comp it.  If you charge that much for waffles and bring fake syrup, at least warn me that I'm about to get something gross.  None of us were drinking alcohol with our meal; a round of drinks didn't really do it this time (though I don't deny it was a nice gesture).  $18 later for a coffee and bad waffles and I am not pleased.  My boyfriend ordered the burger and he liked it though.So I don't know.  I'll probably go back - that's how much I want to like this place.   But I'm prepared to have another lackluster experience and wanted to warn others of the same.  There's enough competition in Astoria that this mediocrity doesn't really need to be accepted.

My guy friends ordered the recommended breakfast burrito - said it was mostly cheese and rice. We asked for real syrup but were told "I'm not sure, sometimes we have it but sometimes we don't." If you take 35 minutes to bring food and it's cold, you should comp it. I'll probably go back - that's how much I want to like this place.

reviews: Went to Locale on a Tuesday night with a friend. This place was cozy, especially in the back area. The ambiance was also nice, making it a perfect place to bring a date. The food was good; the pork chops with green vegetables I ordered was savory; however, the desserts (mixed berry bread pudding and banana/caramel napolean) were mediocre. Maybe it was me but the desserts could've had more flavor. The cost of food was more than I would have liked to have pay for a meal, but its OK to treat yourself every now and again :) Oh, the staff was very friendly.

The cost of food was more than I would have liked to have pay for a meal, but its OK to treat yourself every now and again :) Oh, the staff was very friendly.

reviews: Another gem in Astoria! I came here for brunch with the boyfriend on a snowy day. It was a bit of a troop to get there since its difficult to find parking, but it was worth it.Service: We missed our reservation by 10 minutes, but we got lucky that it was a snowy day and people were too lazy to come out. Thank you lazy people :) We got seated right away and they seated us in a nice and loungy area of the restaurant, so that was a plus! So the waitress put in our orders and the orders came in a timely manner. The only fault was the waitress never came by once to ask if everything was ok, but asked if we wanted another round of drinks after she cleared the table. Too bad because there was a full bar waiting for me if she was nicer to begin with. Food: I love anything with nutella! (Almost) So I ordered the Texas sugar dusted toast with an option of stuffed nutella! Why have just plain toast, when you can have nutella in it. Once I got my order and had my first bite, I was in a sweet place. This is comfort food. One thing happens when I eat something amazing is that I eat slowly wishing that it will never end. My boyfriend ordered the Portobello Benedict infused with truffle oil. Anything truffle is amazing ! It was light but delicious. The eggs and portbello just melted in your mouth as you eat it. The home fries didn't have a nice presentation to his dish and it was a bit stale.The drinks portion: I orderd a mango mimosa and he ordered a freddy kreuger ( spicier version of the bloody mary) Both drinks were good.Ambiance: It is a modern and pretty place with an full bar in front. The decor was nice and cozy. The couches were a bit worn out but seatable. It was romantic and relaxing feel to it. Overall: It was a good brunch place. If you check in on yelp, you can get 10% off the entire bill, so that's another plus. I would come back in the future!
extracted: Another gem in Astoria It was a bit of a troop to get there since its difficult to find parking, but it was worth it.Service: We missed our reservation by 10 minutes, but we got lucky that it was a snowy day and people were too lazy to come out. Why have just plain toast, when you can have nutella in it. One thing happens when I eat something amazing is that I eat slowly wishing that it will never end. My boyfriend ordered the Portobello Benedict infused with truffle oil. Anything truffle is amazing  It was light but delicious The eggs and portbello just melted in your mouth as you eat it The home fries didn't have a nice presentation to his dish and it was a bit stale.The drinks portion: I orderd a mango mimosa and he ordered a freddy kreuger ( spicier version of the bloody mary) Both drinks were good.Ambiance: It is a modern and pretty place with an full bar in front. The decor was nice and cozy. If you check in on yelp, you can get 10% off the entire bill, so that's another plus. I would come back in the future!

reviews: I was expecting much better based on reviews and we were pretty disappointed. The service was great, but the food was pretty "just Ok" all around. I had the cobb salad, husband had the poached eggs with biscuits and gravy and we ordered a side of grits. Nothing food-wise made me want to come back unfortunately.

reviews: If you want to eat something delicious, do not come here. Service is really good and atmosphere is cool. But today I ate worst seafood pasta in my whole life. Pasta was overcooked and smelly.  Also seafood was not fresh. Once I taste it, I didn't even touch it.
extracted: Service is really good and atmosphere is cool. Also seafood was not fresh.

reviews: Over priced and over hyped food. That's why they changed their name from locale to this. I live on the same block the place is cute but the food only sounds good it's never amazing.

reviews: Stumbled upon this restaurant as I looked for the name LOCALE as posted on maps quest. Figured out it was the same restaurant.  The place has a cool vibe with bar, exposed white wash brick wall and wrought iron details. Not a big establishment but it serves their look to be warm and cozy. Husband and I ordered the cheddar cheese grits as an appetizer to share. It was like a warm blanket and I ordered their Blue cheese burger that were accompanied by the most delicious hand cut fries that were completely addicting. Husband ordered the eggplant and burrata sandwhich which was tasty and bread was fresh. Back to the fries...definitely worth another trip to Astoria just for them. Wait staff was very attentive.
extracted: It was like a warm blanket and I ordered their Blue cheese burger that were accompanied by the most delicious hand cut fries that were completely addicting. Husband ordered the eggplant and burrata sandwhich which was tasty and bread was fresh. Wait staff was very attentive.

reviews: I came here with a couple of friends for dinner one night. It looked tres chic... i loved how it looked from the outside and the inside. My friend was raving about it... so i was a little excited. Definitely saw a few eye-candies... mmm. Loved that! lolBut to be honest,  i wasn't impressed with their food... more disappointed.I had the Rigatoni Bolognese... to my dismay, it didn't taste like anything!!! And it was a little hard to chew. Errr... i'm not dying to come back to this place. Blahhh.

I'm a brunch whore. Seriously I love brunch. However up until yesterday I had always ventured (based on assumption alone) that good worth it brunch could only be found in NYC and maybe Brooklyn. Gastroteca put me in my place. Not only was the ambiance of this place perfect for a Sunday brunch - the food rivaled anything we've had in NYC. For the food itself I want to give Gastroteca four stars. However based on the service we received yesterday I'm less inclined to give my overall experience more than 3 stars. Here's how it went down: the hubby and I made reservations the night before for 1230 on Sunday. We got there on time and found the place was completely empty - not a great sign for a Sunday brunch spot. After a few minutes we learned that they were running behind with opening up due to unforeseen kitchen issues. They did let us know that they'd be ready to go in about 45 minutes and if we wanted to come back we could then. The hubby and I were pretty much starving (blame the pregnancy) so we opted to go elsewhere. Fortunate for Gastroteca we are both spontaneous and ended up running errands, allowing us to go back in time for them to be up and running. We called to make sure they were good to go and let them know we would be on our way. Once we got there we had to wait a few minutes for a table to be cleared but the host seemed gracious enough that we came back after we explained our earlier visit. Once seated we felt a little shafted on service. Our server didn't get our order down until at least 10 minutes and then the wait for the food seemed somewhat endless. Once we had our food we were happy and once we got our coffee (and several refills) we were all smiles. One piece of advice that may have pushed my review to four stars - because it's the little things that go a long way, to make up for the inconvenience of not being ready for us at our reservation time it would have been nice if the restaurant offered us a comp'd appetizer or side or just didn't charge us for the coffee. It's a few bucks, but it's the best way to make sure you send someone out with a positive reason to come back. We will likely be back there for brunch - but we would have raved about how Astoria has more heart when it comes to brunch than NYC had we gotten that extra bit of service!

Once we got there we had to wait a few minutes for a table to be cleared but the host seemed gracious enough that we came back after we explained our earlier visit. reviews: Wow! Talk about luck of the draw on picking a restaurant. Saturday night, the plan was to go for Greek. My parents were in town, mom and I wanted a nice piece of fish so I was doing crazy leg work on Greek places. How I even stumbled across Locale on Yelp is beyond me but that doesn't even matter, all I know I'm happy I did!! I saw that previously one of their special was Chilean Sea Bass and even though I had sea bass the night before I was in the mood for it again. So I called to find out what the specials were and sadly sea bass wasn't one of them. I then asked how long the wait was for a table of two and was told 35 to 40 minutes. At this point my mom and I were really hungry (dad had to sit dinner out because of the sausage he had at the San Gerrano Fest!) and we didn't want to wait. I figured I'd scope out Open Tables to see if there were any reservations available. It was 7:50, there was a reservation for 8 pm! I booked it and then we literally booked it to the car! Good thing I live right around the corner. And to top it all off, we got a spot right out front, talk about lucky! We did have to wait for another couple to finish settling up on their bill and then have them clean the table off before we were seated but that only took 20 minutes. I was shocked at how busy this place was because it's somewhat off the beaten path in Astoria away from the main drags of 30th and Broadway. While we waited we looked over the menu trying to make the next big food decision. Everything looked amazing. Prior to even being at the restaurant we had looked at the menu online and decided that we were going to have the Beet and Brie salad along with the Salmon as one entree. My mom picked the salmon but I was still at a crossroad of what to order. When we were finally seated, I asked the waitress a few questions about the menu. They had quite a few pasta dishes on the menu that looked amazing but then there was a polenta dish that also looked great. I had of the vegetarian pastas which one she would recommend, of course it was the one with the white truffle sauce. She said it was really heavy and both my mom and I were looking for something on the healthier side. While I was torn between a pasta dish and the polenta dish, my mom suggested that I asked if they'll do a half order of each. While they weren't able to do a half order of the polenta they were able to with the pasta! Boom, done!! So I ordered the Locales Faggotini and the Toasty Polenta. We started with the beet and brie cheese salad. This was roasted beets with warm brie cheese, endive, frisee, toasted almonds, chives and a beet vinaigrette. This salad was delicious! They light fried the cheese and placed a silver dollar size piece on top. The presentation of this was really cool. It looks like they made it a spring form pan with about a 2 to 3 inch layer of beets then the lettuce part on top. You did really need to mix it up in order to get everything dressed nicely in the dressing. It also wasn't over dressed which was nice. Very creative dish that I highly recommend. Then our meals came and for us, we were seated at a two person round table, we really needed a table extension!! The salmon was marinated in a hoisin sauce with fennel, carrots and onion. While this was good, it didn't stand out the way the other two dishes did for my mom and I. The Locale Faggotini: Beggers purse shaped pasta stuffed with gorganzola topped with walnuts in a red beet sauce. I'm so happy we ordered this dish and a half size could truly be a meal within itself. It was important that you had a bite of the pasta with the a walnut because the sharpness of the cheese with the nutty walnut flavor was outstanding. The beet was present but it wasn't a very strong flavor, just enough to give a little bit of sweetness. There was also chopped up beets in the dish and the beet sauce gave the pasta this beautiful pink color. The Toasty Polenta: Polenta topped with Mozzarella, arugula and with a red sauce. This polenta was unlike any polenta I've ever had before. My mom pointed out that all the polenta she has had is always very dense whereas this was really nice and light. We did move the massive piece of mozzarella off to the side while star of the dish was the polenta the sauce is what made the polenta that much better. It was a chunky sauce and you could see the veggies but it had this great kick to it. It wasn't overly spicy but it was just enough heat to add a little bite. I would go back for this dish again and sometime very soon!! Again, I was shocked at how busy it was so it was a little on the noisy side but we were still able to have a conversation at the table. The decor also really caught my eye. It has this rustic yet modern look to it. It's an interesting little space which gives the restaurant a very cozy feel. The service was great and very attentive. Great portions as well not huge but enough to satisfy.

reviews: Incredible food matched by impeccable service. It's the best meal I've had out in a long time!
extracted: Incredible food matched by impeccable service.

reviews: Love this place. I come here fairly regularly for brunch because the food is delicious. I highly recommend the benedicts and the texas toast is amazing (it's stuffed with nutella!). It's a little off from central Astoria so it's not usually overcrowded...particularly when the weather is nice since you can sit outside. The wait staff is always friendly and on top of things. Great place for either a casual brunch date or to get your morning started with friends. I've seen everything from families to dates to bridal shower parties here and they all seem to be having a good time. They also play cartoons/television on the wall behind the bar which is an entertaining touch. The one thing I can't vouch for is the drinks/dinner/evening atmosphere because I've never been, but I would certainly be surprised if it was a letdown.

Love this place Love this place Love this place Love this place

reviews: I ALWAYS have a fantastic time at Local.  One of the brightest, prettiest, and reasonably priced places for brunch.  Everyone who works here is incredibly friendly and this place is completely free of that Brooklyn or Manhattan "we are too cool" pretentiousness.  Definitely check it out.

reviews: After Saturday night, this is definitely near the top of my list of more upscale places to go for dinner in Astoria. Apparently they do brunch too, but I have not experienced that (yet).FOOD: Our server recommended the Gorgonzola-stuffed pasta dish, and we were not disappointed. Delicious, super filling, and paired with a great (almost magenta colored!) sauce. The braised meatballs appetizer was delish as well, and I'll definitely be back to try their fish and steak entrees. Also? Try the espresso gelato. It is GOOD.WINE: We were allowed to try the Cab Sauv (Snap Dragon) available by the glass, and to be honest, it was quite dull. We opted for the more expensive Geyser Peak Cab Sauv ($45) and it was much, much better. Definitely worth the difference in price. If you're only up for a glass or two though, then you should probably opt for a different red, or perhaps a white.SERVICE: Pretty great service. Our entrees were kind of rushed out to us after the appetizer, and we ended up sticking around for a while in order to finish off the bottle. They also didn't charge us full price on the one scoop of Gelato that we wanted, which was noticed and appreciated.PRICE: Standard for a more upscale type restaurant, but I feel like their pasta dishes are slightly overpriced. This isn't unique to Locale though. A LOT of places mark up their pasta dishes, which is pretty silly when you think about how much the actual ingredients cost. For their salmon, steak, and chicken dishes, I understand the pricing. But pasta?

They also didn't charge us full price on the one scoop of Gelato that we wanted, which was noticed and appreciated.PRICE: Standard for a more upscale type restaurant, but I feel like their pasta dishes are slightly overpriced. reviews: We Been before but Monique (maybe is spelled differently ) she was ..is great fast service really nice we love her :)

First impression walking in the door was "WOW". There are beautiful people and everyone is a chipper hipster.Sat down and ordered my meal. The service was ok, not the best. I felt with the amount of staff they had the service shouldve been better. There was a different person serving the drinks, maybe they have an in-house Sommelier???Appetizers: Cheese platter- was nothing specialCalamari - was ok but nothing spectacular very small portionMain Course:Branzino - who serves this by the Filet?? You serve the entire fish!!! How do you know what you are getting. They can be serving any white fish and you wouldn't know! Very disappointing.Short Ribs with risotto - this was a bigger joke. If someone orders short ribs, they are expecting actually cuts of beef! what they brought me was broken bits of short ribs over risotto. The menu is misleading. Instead of writing short ribs, you should change it to kibbles of short ribs, because there was no sign of any meat.I thought it was cute that they sprinkled a little blue cheese over the dish.Please rename this dish "Risotto with short ribs drippings"The decor is nice, come here to drink and nibble on small plates. They make nice cocktails and a nice winelist.I ended up having a second dinner a couple of blocks away.Very dissapointed.

reviews: Have been meaning to come here for a while and we showed up without a reservation on a Sunday at noon. Thankfully, there were two seats at the bar that we were able to sit at. If we come back, we will definitely make a reservation as the bar can get quite cramped. We ordered the California Benedict which was perfectly cooked and the French toast was sinfully sweet in the best way. Definitely recommend getting the home fries on the side, the portions are a little on the small side in comparison to brunch places nearby.

We ordered the California Benedict which was perfectly cooked and the French toast was sinfully sweet in the best way.

reviews: One of my favorite dinner spots whenever I don't feel like cooking. I've had here : Grilled Swordfish, Pasta Bolognese and Black Angus steak.Grilled Swordfish tasted ok, didn't know what to expect or how it should taste since I've never had swordfish. Honest to god it just tasted like lean fish. It was served with some fried onions but overall found it a little salty.Pasta Bolognese was about what you would expect, I was kinda wasted for that so I don't remember too much. Black angus steak was delicious, came precut with fries and argula on the side. I loved all of it, but again the meat as just slightly too salty. Overall everything here is just a little too salty but very fresh, well cooked and well executed.I'd also like to note that this is a great place for a date, it's usually very quiet with dim lighting and low music. There is outdoor seating if you'd like and the street is typically pretty quiet. If you come here with a date, expect to walk out with a $80-100 bill before tip. Drinks here aren't cheap and neither is the food but the service is excellent, the food but is well done and overall Locale is probably one of the better restaurants in Astoria.

Black angus steak was delicious, came precut with fries and argula on the side. There is outdoor seating if you'd like and the street is typically pretty quiet. Drinks here aren't cheap and neither is the food but the service is excellent, the food but is well done and overall Locale is probably one of the better restaurants in Astoria.

reviews: Bloody Mary is delicious, the food is consistently good and satisfying. I have always done brunch here with the outdoor sitting its really nice.The service is good, all the waiters are very nice, they always bring water to my dog!

reviews: What a great local spot!This is my second time coming in and I plan on coming back many more times. The food is always fresh and delicious. The waitstaff is courteous and attentive. I would recommend the Nutella 'stuffed' Texas toast.The only down side is it seems they have a small kitchen and staff, it was a little bit of a wait to get out food and the restaurant wasn't even half full. Worth the wait though!!Plus can't beat the yelp 10% discount.

reviews: I have been here a few times now for brunch and lunch and each time I've had delicious food, great drinks and solid service.

Holy smokes!  The owner has no clue how to deal with customers.Let me start by saying this was hands down, one of my favorite restaurants in Astoria, despite the spotty service speed...But tonight we experienced a new low in customer service! (not from our waitress, but from the owner himself.)We showed up and, as usual, informed the waitress that my wife has a gluten allergy and is lactose intolerant.  We were immediately put at ease, as the menu specifies that they carry gluten free pasta, and the waitress seemed to understand.  She told us she would ask the chef himself to make sure anything we ordered was GF.  My wife asked if the shrimp dish was GF and the waitress said she wasn't sure, but she'd ask the chef.  She then returned to confirm that we were in the clear,  but when it came out the yucca appeared to be deep fried.  (not everyone knows this, but folks with gluten allergies have varying levels of sensitivity, and contamination can even occur by using the same deep fryer as one that might have had gluteny items in it.  upon viewing the beautifully fried yucca strips, my suspicions were stirred, so we beckoned the waitress and asked if she was sure these yucca were not fried in a deep fryer.  She admitted that she was not sure and went down to confirm with the chef.  When she returned she said that there had been a mix up in the order, and they had given us one that had been prepared with butter.  While that was not great, it wasn't our main concern.  The Gluten is the big issue.  So she talked to the manager, who came by and said the dish was "100% Gluten Free", but I had to be sure, so I explained to him about the deep fryer situation, and he seemed enlightened and said he would be back.   This is when the owner came to us.   We calmly explained the situation, and he admitted that the yucca was in fact fried in the same deep fryer that they fry everything else in, and he offered to get her a replacement meal.  At this point we didn't really have any faith that the chef understood Gluten issues, so we said "no thank you."  I then- completely calmly and politely, told the owner that Locale is one of my favorite restaurants, and we love coming there, but we can't if they don't understand the complexities of GF cooking.  He argued that they carry GF pasta and she should have ordered that.We calmly explained that she ordered a dish that the chef said was GF.  He argued that we should have read that it was fried on the menu.  (which, for the record, the menu didn't specify)I told him that the chef claimed it was GF, but we understand that he may not have realized that the fryer could contaminate, but they really should know that.  (At this point we were ready to just pay for what we had eaten and cut our losses.)I mentioned BareBurger as an example of a place that has a dedicated deep fryer for GF customers.He got really upset about this and told us Bareburger doesn't use organic meat, and "do you know who my chef is?" he continued, "bareburger, bleh!"  and then he implied that they don't actually use a dedicated deep fryer.Around this point, I got tired of arguing and told him that now he was simply insulting us.  whatever happened to "the customer is always right"?  We argued until I told him I wasn't going to pay for anything and he just walked away.I went over to our waitress and tipped her, as she had clearly done nothing wrong.  and when the manager came by with the bill, I told hem we weren't going to pay.  So then the owner comes up again and says "what do you think you're trying to pull?"I told him we didn't intend on paying considering the horrendous customer service we had experienced.  To which he threatened to call the police.  I said I would pay if that was the case, and then he went to get the bill, but then reconsidered, and told us, "just get out of my restaurant and stop bothering my customers.  We don't want your business.  Idiots."And so we left.  There were in fact many customers that looked mortified at the whole ordeal, and even one who told us she was a celiac and could not believe the owner's attitude.Anyway, the whole thing was so absurd it was kind of funny.  And I'm really sad that I can clearly never return to this restaurant that has such a great atmosphere, and delicious food. (for those of us not concerned with allergies)  I feel truly sorry for the staff that works for this guy.  In the end, all he had to say was "I'm sorry, we didn't realize, is there anything we can do to fix this?"  but apparently that would require him to swallow his clearly not gluten-free pride!

She admitted that she was not sure and went down to confirm with the chef. While that was not great, it wasn't our main concern. So she talked to the manager, who came by and said the dish was "100% Gluten Free", but I had to be sure, so I explained to him about the deep fryer situation, and he seemed enlightened and said he would be back. I then- completely calmly and politely, told the owner that Locale is one of my favorite restaurants, and we love coming there, but we can't if they don't understand the complexities of GF cooking. He argued that they carry GF pasta and she should have ordered that.We calmly explained that she ordered a dish that the chef said was GF. He argued that we should have read that it was fried on the menu. (which, for the record, the menu didn't specify)I told him that the chef claimed it was GF, but we understand that he may not have realized that the fryer could contaminate, but they really should know that. I said I would pay if that was the case, and then he went to get the bill, but then reconsidered, and told us, "just get out of my restaurant and stop bothering my customers. There were in fact many customers that looked mortified at the whole ordeal, and even one who told us she was a celiac and could not believe the owner's attitude.Anyway, the whole thing was so absurd it was kind of funny. And I'm really sad that I can clearly never return to this restaurant that has such a great atmosphere, and delicious food. (for those of us not concerned with allergies)  I feel truly sorry for the staff that works for this guy. In the end, all he had to say was "I'm sorry, we didn't realize, is there anything we can do to fix this?" but apparently that would require him to swallow his clearly not gluten-free pride!

reviews: No French fries on weekends ? No wine after 11? Did we go out to enjoy a dinner? Feels like moms right around the corner about to ground you if you keep your elbows on the table . Wanna be bougie. Great servers terrible manager .

reviews: What a let down for brunch!Came here to Locale with my friend Chris a few weeks ago to try it out and was really disappointed with the overall experience. The Low Points:-Took forever to get someone to take our order (10 minutes when you're hungry is an eternity)-Took forever to get our food (I only complain because there were people who sat down after us getting theirs before us plus it wasn't a full house by any means)-Food was obviously just sitting out as it was barely lukewarm-The "special" was a sad sight to behold with 2 thin slices of chicken breast with 5 pieces of broccoli and 5 pieces of cut baby potatoes-The food honestly reminded me of airplane food (you know, THAT taste)-Took forever to get the checkOh and for the icing on the cake, the "special" Chicken Marsala turned out to be $17.99 and the credit card minimum was something stupid like $20 (I hate that crap!) so we couldn't split our bill as planned. Only positive thing I can say is that we were able to get 10% off the bill using the Yelp app. And the waitress was nice. But meh, the rest left a bad taste in my mouth. Literally. I really had wanted to come here for dinner originally but after my experience with brunch that won't be happening.Bottom line: Both of us left hangry and I won't be coming back since there are TONS of better options on 30th Avenue that offer much better food deals for brunch *cough* William Hallet *cough* Queens Comfort *cough*

Only positive thing I can say is that we were able to get 10% off the bill using the Yelp app. And the waitress was nice. But meh, the rest left a bad taste in my mouth.

reviews: Locale is the kind of place that presents a serious dilemma: Do I come here for dinner or do I come here for drinks at the bar and lounge area? This review is for the former as I was feeling the hunger pains and so opted for a table for two.The decor is definitely easy on the eyes, creating a sense of intimacy that's perfect for conversation and relaxation. Candles ( the real type, not the battery operated), high ceiling, high windows with white drapes create an almost urban gothic setting. While the menu offers up many Italian dishes there's also a selection of other fare, such as crab cake appetizer, cornish hen and salmon. We started with an appetizer of fried calamari.I liked the fact that I could see actual slices of garlic in the dipping sauce. I didn't like salty taste of the fried calamari. Fortunately water refills were plentiful and overall service was spot on.Up next was my main course of pappardelle and lamb ragu. My first glance of the plate caused some confusion as there seemed to be some serious ingredient separation. In the left corner, I give you ragu! And in the right corner, pappardelle! And as referee a large clump of goat's cheese...ding ding ding, let's get ready to eat!Fortunately I was able to stir it all up and the result of my labor was delicious. So delicious that I was scraping my plate in the hope that some more could magically appear.On a serious note, the portion did tend towards the small end of the spectrum and I observed the same with my wife's cornish hen so an appetizer is recommended.With room left for dessert, we decided to share an order of the apple nutella cobbler. The tragedy of this dessert is that it becomes more seductively good the closer it is towards disappearing from the face of this earth-- in other words, when the warmth of the cobbler melts the scoop of ice cream that then blends in with the nutella towards the bottom creating a swirling dervish of delectable delight. Stepping away from the preceding sentence, I do wish that there was a bit more noticeable nutella flavor on top so my first few bites would not be in vain. That's a very minor critique and in no way interfered with the enjoyment of this dish.The appetizer, two entrees, dessert and a soda came to $60. If I return to this part of Astoria, I'd have to do the locale-motion again.(Choose whatever version you prefer)

reviews: Perfect place for brunch. Cozy and fun ambiance. They had some creative  brunch item. Loved it!
extracted: Cozy and fun ambiance

reviews: 3 thumbs up (if I had an extra one!).  After contemplating about coming here for nearly 2 years now, I finally set a day and time to come here...and it was completely worth the wait!  It was a Monday nite, the place was nearly empty and to ourselves.  I figured it would be quiet since it was the day before New Years Eve and just a few days after Christmas.  This place got packed by the time we left.  Who would of thought! We started the nite with drinks at the bar.  I highly enjoyed the passion martini and also the pumpkin pie martini but it got to be a little too sweet by the time I was done.  For my main course, I had the beef short rib risotto.  One word to describe it - AMAZING!  It didn't seem like much on the plate but it was very rich and the beef just melted in your mouth.  They really did a great job on this dish.  Oh, I forgot about the appetizer.  I had the calamari but this wasn't just any calamari.  The roasted jalapeno peppers that accompanied the dish was great.  A bit spicy (obviously) so me and the wife nibbled on it.  By the time dinner was done, I didn't have any space for desert.  Of course the wifey ordered it.  I was already satisfied.  It was Christmas all over again!  Summary:1. Great food/drinks2. Great service3. Great prices4. One hell of a timeCan't wait to come back and try their brunch menu.  Thanks Locale.

Who would of thought It didn't seem like much on the plate but it was very rich and the beef just melted in your mouth.  AMAZING

reviews: Awesome food! Equally awesome service. First impression: cool, Laid back atmosphere & professional, caring staff. Especially our server, Anna, she was prompt and paid attention to our every need! I'm obsessed with the Mmm Mm Mimosa... It's a brunch must!! We will be back soon. Thanks for a great afternoon, Gastroteca!
extracted: Equally awesome service We will be back soon.

reviews: Bad choice for cold weather.The entrance hall added to the front door has one fatal flaw which the restaurant management seems to have missed. It also needs a door in order to create a closed space to prevent the cold air from rushing into the restaurant hall. The one at Locale does not and as a result every time some one opens the main entrance door the seated guests are blasted with arctic air. Needless to say this does not bode well for the cozy dining experience .We came to Locale  when it was a balmy 50F outside. I cannot imagine what it would be like to have a meal when every 10 seconds there is a 20 degree wind chill blowing at you. As for the food, the Eggs Benedict dishes were pretty good. The chef skimped on the Hollandaise sauce. I guess he can't be bothered with making more of it. I think if it wasn't for the miserable cold that we experienced for the duration of our meal i would rate this place at 4 stars as the interior is bright and pleasant and the food, while not spectacular, is good enough to come back for.

I think if it wasn't for the miserable cold that we experienced for the duration of our meal i would rate this place at 4 stars as the interior is bright and pleasant and the food, while not spectacular, is good enough to come back for.

reviews: Had an awesome brunch here Sunday.   Had no trouble making a reservation.   The service was great and the two picky pregnant women at the table were well taken care of by our server. The food was awesome and the menu was so interesting it was difficult to choose what to order.   The Texas toast was amazing.   Everyone loved what they had.   I will be back.

reviews: We went there for a 4 course new years eve dinner. The restaurant was very small yet cozy and nicely decorated for NYE.  They gave us complementary hats, noisemakers and champagne toast at midnight. The staff and ambience was superb, the food was mediocre. Although they said it was an Italian restaurant, it had a lot of French contemporary flare to it. Risotto ball- it was complimentary. The outside was crisp and the inside was soft and risotto was soft and perfectly cooked.Scallops- it needed a sear. They were small and it it came with nice potato purée with mushrooms. Although the puree was good, there an excess of it that it was unproportional to the small 6-8 scallops. Gnocchi with pumpkin sauce- great, it was very creamy. It might have needed a tad bit more sauce. Spaghetti with lamb sauce- the spaghetti itself was amazing. It had great texture and it tasted house made. However I was not expecting the sauce to have shredded lamb, I thought it was going to be ground lamb. Either way, the lamb ruined the sauce and it tasted  very gamey. Roasted duck breast- it was ok, it needed a sear and it was a little chewy. The polenta was very salty, I think it was the breadcrumbs. The foie gras even before I found out what it was, I could just feel the fat particles bouncing off my tongue. Although it was done decently, the texture was too blood curling rich for me.Bass- It also needed a sear. There were 2 other components with it, one of them was fried salted cod and also a lump of fried pancetta. Both of these elements made the overall dish too salty.ricotta cheese cake- very good.chocolate caramel pudding- I thought it was too chocolatey, even with the ice cream and I love my share of chocolate. It was more of a dense brownie. I was expecting a lava cake. Overall, it was a nice place for us to go to for last minute New Years Eve that was close to home.

Both of these elements made the overall dish too salty.ricotta cheese cake- very good.chocolate caramel pudding- I thought it was too chocolatey, even with the ice cream and I love my share of chocolate.

reviews: Locale may be one of my favorite Astoria restaurants...I absolutely loved my experience.First, the space is really cute.  Floor to ceiling windows, dimly lit, cute bar and outside seating.  The service was good.  We waited a while for an outside table even though there were a few open (which bugged me a bit), but everyone was very nice.  Our server was great and was willing to give me a dinner suggestion.The food was fantastic.  For an appetizer we got the Bruschetta Trio and we loved it.For an entree, I got the chicken special which was chicken stuffed with mozzarella and spinach and wrapped with bacon and it was amazing.  My boyfriend got the Lamb Ragu with whipped goat cheese...they had me at whipped goat cheese!Now I have to go back to try the brunch!

We waited a while for an outside table even though there were a few open (which bugged me a bit), but everyone was very nice. Our server was great and was willing to give me a dinner suggestion.The food was fantastic.

reviews: Astoria Revisited Locale is like Astoria. It's snug in parts and means well yet never makes you feel like your missing out either.If I still lived in Astoria, would I drive there and lose my spot when I could go to Vesta or the Astor Bake Shop instead, no, of course not. That's like blowing off those cheap, easy to slam posh blond twins from Basketball Diaries in exchange for a wannabe, more bug eyed,  Zooey Deschanel.But if I lived closer to Kaufman Studios or god for bid got a staff writer job for Nurse Jackie when it was filmed there,  I'd revisit Locale to see if all the Yelp hype was justified or just another example of wannabe Queens hipsters pumping up a so so brunch spot in order to feel better about their locale. I got a bloody marry with a half broken straw which made it harder to suck through. It was like my wife giving me a taste of my own medicine after I drank too much the night before during our free from baby time together which was why I ordered the Bloody Mary in the first place. In general, now that I'm older and have a kid, brunch destination spots don't provide much of a thrill anymore, especially when I jack up the bill by over ordering for my daughter as a lame disguise to sample more side options for myself.  Plus, that big backed, 5'8 Hipster bartender that thinks her heavily tattooed arm gives her the right  to let her arm fat dangle like she's walking the dog doesn't make me hot and bothered in terms of me thinking I still gotta have her in my arms as I launch her up and down my cast iron clad, pogo stick.  This is the type of review you get after I watch Dice's new Showtime special, Invincible. The rap song in honor of Dice at the end is the best part by the way. Now, I'm also real strong at creating and making my own omelettes so unless your serving crisp, non clumpy  hash browns, not the case here, have fresh squeezed OJ that's squeezed from Brooklyn Decker's nipples or make the most mouth watering, respectable pork alternative such as home made sage turkey sausage, I'm not going to lose any sleep over missing out on the peak-less ride.  Having a boorish brunch these days when you consider  all the recipe knowledge at your finger tips is like having boring sex with woman that were taught Sex -Ed on Bang Bus. You take one dip in those still , lifeless waters and think:  "What a waste of bait.  But that's your fault for hooking up with a such a boring slob in the first place, oh!"                                                                        The End

reviews: We live right near this place and walk by it every day, but never made it in. We were craving brunch, so decided to finally give it a try. We ordered eggs Benedict with Canadian bacon and a salad + an egg white omelet with baby spinach & mushrooms with a side of salad. The side salad was very good and complemented the light dishes perfectly. We don't drink caffeine, so we asked for decaf and were surprised by how delicious it was! The service was friendly, but a bit lacking since they were busy and apparently shorthanded. Totally reasonable prices. Not a crazy amount of selection, but I have a feeling the items they do offer are all high quality. We'll definitely have to go back for dinner!

We came for brunch, and for a modest $8, I enjoyed the cornflake-crusted Texas toast with fruit and syrup. It. Was. Awesome. The mimosa was good too, as was the coffee (and bacon! Don't judge me....). Definitely worth a try, if only for their brunch!!

reviews: Decided to check this place out this morning for a solo brunch. All-around everything was pretty good that hit my table. No real complaints about the food and I'd describe it as above-average brunch food. Coffee was great, and my omelette was cooked well, though light on seasoning. My bigger issues were with the service - It took about 8-10 min to be greeted, and another 10 min to get my coffee. That was a bit frustrating. Also, I originally wanted to order the Lamb Hash Benedict on the menu, which was not available that day, at which point I was told about the special (doesn't that usually happen before you order?), which didn't sound so appetizing. That was very disapppointing as it was the only out-of-the-box thing on the menu, which is usually what appeals to me.

reviews: I love the new ownership and what they have done with it.  Fantastic new flare and direction to a always-great brunch.  This is the beginning to the start of a lovely relationship were about to have. ;)

I don't know how it took me so long to try this place out given its trendy ambiance and alluring outdoor seating, but I finally made it for brunch this morning with a friend. We were seated right away with none of the typical Astoria wait at noon. I have to say I was extremely pleased with the experience. My friend and I ordered the goat cheese and baby spinach omelette with home fries and the belgian waffles with berries and cream to share, and both were delicious beyond my expectations. I think they might put some almond extract into the whipped cream; it definitely has something extra to it which makes it unbelievably tasty. The service was great and the prices were much more reasonable than I expected; I think with tip and tax we ended up spending about $13 each. I'll definitely be coming back to check this place out for dinner!

reviews: We ended up here on a Saturday night after I screwed up and didn't make reservations at one of our usual places. I try and not be that guy to write something off after only visiting once, but I will not be visiting Locale again and figure I would share my experience since it seems that many people have strong positive feelings about this restaurant. The best thing about this place was the decore. I have a feeling that a lot of people enjoy being seen here, rather than eating, as the food and service was definitely subpar when it comes to what you can find in Astoria. First off, the two dishes I wanted (the duck, a special, and the cornish hen, a menu staple) were already no longer available at 8:00pm. - Bottle of champagne took 20 minutes to reach our table, because the 'bar tender was really swamped'. It arrived under chilled. - My fiance's hanger steak arrived cool, the sides of mashed potatoes and broccoli were actually cold. Sauce was served on the steak, when we asked for it off. - Lamb ragu with goat cheese. Where to start. How do you overpower lamb flavor with sauce? Make a awful sauce that stayed with my taste buds for the rest of the night. This was honestly one of the worst dishes I have ever paid for. The staff was apologetic because 'the restaurant was so swamped on a Saturday night'. There were tables open, and we were seated immediately. I shouldn't have to suffer at a restaurant because there are other people eating there. This place is expensive enough and should have their act together. My biggest regret was not calling earlier to make a reservation at Trattoria Vesta, which blows this place out of the water on all accounts.

I have a feeling that a lot of people enjoy being seen here, rather than eating, as the food and service was definitely subpar when it comes to what you can find in Astoria.  Lamb ragu with goat cheese Where to start How do you overpower lamb flavor with sauce Make a awful sauce that stayed with my taste buds for the rest of the night The staff was apologetic because 'the restaurant was so swamped on a Saturday night'. I shouldn't have to suffer at a restaurant because there are other people eating there. This place is expensive enough and should have their act together.

reviews: Solid brunch spot in this area. I didn't have to wait for a table which was awesome, and we grabbed a table by the windows which was nice. They have a bunch of options for eggs Benedict which I really appreciate since they are my absolute favorite brunch dish. I went with the Avocado and Tomatoe Benedict which were good, and I tried the Portobello one which I actually liked better. The hollandaise was a tiny bit too buttery but maybe I'm just being picky.My only complaint would be that the orange juice I ordered was 80% ice and 20% orange juice... not cool! And also for a french place they should have MUCH better coffee.
extracted: Solid brunch spot in this area And also for a french place they should have MUCH better coffee.

reviews: SmallCrowd, goodService, niceDesign and aDelicious brunch outdoors with mango drinks.

reviews: I truly adore this place. It was our go-to brunch spot when my boyfriend lived nearby, it had just the perfect atmosphere whether you were vaguely hungover or perky and ready to tackle the day. Plus, their eggs benedict (in varying flavors/styles) are always spot freakin' on. Then about a year ago we went for dinner and now I'm even more hooked. They really know how to make good, flawless food. The seating is a bit weird (big deep benches in some areas) so for short people like me it can be a bit awkward, but the food is so tasty I don't really care. Also their mimosa selection is nice. Oh and their cheese polenta - order it. Die. Go to heaven immediately.
extracted: The seating is a bit weird (big deep benches in some areas) so for short people like me it can be a bit awkward, but the food is so tasty I don't really care. Also their mimosa selection is nice. Go to heaven immediately

reviews: Yes, it's true: I really like this place. No, it's not grimy and no, it's not that cheap. But still, it's one of the cooler, more hip spots in the area (especially during the summer) and the food is great.During the warmer months they take down the walls and completely open up the front, which is a nice touch. The service is tops and the staff always knows how to bump the tunes (ex: an entire Scissor Sisters album). Both brunch and dinner are excellent, but I prefer brunch. The portions are large and the menu is always changing, so make sure you ask about the specials. They have a unique selection of cocktails, but they come at a high price. There's no beer on tap, which is a bummer, but you can't go wrong with icy cold tap water.Note: restaurant.com offers discounted dinner gift certificates but they do not work! I've spoke to the manager about this, who is trying to get the deal removed from the site.

reviews: The gist: Waited nearly an hour for three appetizers while restaurant was half-empty. Others seated after our arrival served before us. Prejudice or ineptitude?  My fiancé, his family and I stopped by this evening for dinner as it was one of the few local restaurants open on July 4th and seemed to have a charming ambiance. Evidently appearances aren't everything. We were seated quickly enough and our waitress seemed friendly, but we were left waiting nearly 45 minutes for the first order placed from our table: a glass of Coke. (Oddly enough, the two glasses of wine we ordered at around the same time appeared a mere five minutes after placing the initial order. I'm at a loss to explain how pouring Coke into a glass is somehow more complex and time-consuming than pouring wine into two glasses.) We ordered three simple appetizers that would be considered standard fare for even the no-frillsiest of dive bars--specifically, meatballs, calamari and a small Caesar salad. After waiting forty-five minutes for these orders and the Coke, my fiancé finally went into the restaurant to inquire, and was told the drink would be coming out shortly, and the appetizers in another ten minutes at most. Though again I'd be hard pressed to explain how the preparation of three appetizers could possibly require the better part of an hour, especially when the establishment is nowhere near full capacity, this element of our experience alone isn't what prompted this negative review. It's the fact that when we arrived at around 7:45 p.m., we were the only ones seated outside (at our request, so as to enjoy the weather). Two other parties--both couples on dates, it seemed--arrived between 7:45 and 8:30 (when our first order came) and were sat outside as well. As we fruitlessly awaited our appetizers, we were astonished to see that both these tables received both their drinks and food before we did, despite both arriving and placing their orders significantly later. I will also note that we were the only minorities at the establishment--make of that what you will. I hesitate to ascribe anything to bald-faced bigotry, especially in a neighborhood as diverse as Astoria, but it was either that or sheer incompetence at the root of our experience. Either way, I'm not coming back. P.S. Those long-awaited appetizers were mediocre.
extracted: enjoy Prejudice or ineptitude My fiancé, his family and I stopped by this evening for dinner as it was one of the few local restaurants open on July 4th and seemed to have a charming ambiance. (Oddly enough, the two glasses of wine we ordered at around the same time appeared a mere five minutes after placing the initial order. After waiting forty-five minutes for these orders and the Coke, my fiancé finally went into the restaurant to inquire, and was told the drink would be coming out shortly, and the appetizers in another ten minutes at most. Though again I'd be hard pressed to explain how the preparation of three appetizers could possibly require the better part of an hour, especially when the establishment is nowhere near full capacity, this element of our experience alone isn't what prompted this negative review. I will also note that we were the only minorities at the establishment--make of that what you will. Those long-awaited appetizers were mediocre.

reviews: The food is delicious, the service is professional and attentive, and the space is beautiful. My friends and I stumbled upon this place after finding the crepe place we had intended to go for brunch on Sunday was closed. We were so pleased with this place, despite being full from Nutella stuffed Texas toast and the best cheddar cheese omelette I ever had, we still ordered dessert. I also had the hot chocolate - I know it's a small thing but it was great. Real milk hot chocolate! Amazing. My friends and I had nothing but good things to say about this place, their very friendly staff, and the beautiful layout. My friends are both designers and so their approval is hard to come by. We will be back soon to try dinner and the bar!

My friends are both designers and so their approval is hard to come by. We will be back soon to try dinner and the bar!

reviews: **Out of a possible 5 stars, here's what we thought....Décor: 4 star                 Service: 3 starsBeverage List: 2 star           Food: 1 starsLocation: 3 star            Overall: 2 starsCost: $30 - $50  per personFor the complete review please go to: nycfoodreview.wordpress.

I ate at Locale yesterday for my roommate's birthday dinner. I have walked past it several times and have always been tempted to eat there, but since dieting lately, I didn't think I could do it healthfully, and boy was I wrong. My friend Jen and I both had the portabello mushroom and roasted red pepper arugula salad with toasted goat cheese. I, however, also started with a soup because I hadn't had much else to eat throughout the day. The soup was pasta e fagioli. My roommate had the squid ink pasta. Jen and my roommate also both had sangria. For dessert, I had a poached pear (no ice cream, no puff pastry, no whipped cream), the birthday girl had what they called Bomba (like the Israeli snack in flavor profile but actually ice cream and chocolate), and Jen had the chocolate cake. I was really happy with the soup in terms of tomato flavor, but was disappointed in the broth to ingredient ratio. There was too much pasta (so I didn't eat it all). I did, however, like the garlic that had softened in the soup. As for the salad, I thought it was great. Really earthy tasting with the arugula and portabello combination. The bill was under $100 for 3 of us, which for a restaurant of this quality, in service and in food, is fairly reasonable. I'd definitely come back, especially for a nice occasion.

Really earthy tasting with the arugula and portabello combination. The bill was under $100 for 3 of us, which for a restaurant of this quality, in service and in food, is fairly reasonable. I'd definitely come back, especially for a nice occasion.

reviews: Lived a few blocks away from here for a good few years and always overlooked it. Boy, was I missing out! Eggs Benedict are the absolute bombdotcom (does anyone even say that anymore?). Service definitely exceeds what I normally expect in Astoria which is a big surprise so please please keep up the good work guys! You're bringing a good name to hospitality in Astoria. New favorite brunch spot. Can't wait to try dinner.
extracted: Lived a few blocks away from here for a good few years and always overlooked it. Service definitely exceeds what I normally expect in Astoria which is a big surprise so please please keep up the good work guys New favorite brunch spot

reviews: stopped in Locale on a Saturday at 9:30 and was able to sit down without a reservation.  They gave us a comfy table for two in the back elevated area that was very cozy.  There was a small party of about 12 next to us that had a few very loud guests but whatever they eventually left.   place is nice looking, exposed brick and iron feel with tin ceilings and antiquely wall coverings.  its not very big so has a nice "locale" vibe.  the waitress was very friendly and bubbly, she seems like she was auditioning for a broadway show but it was somewhat entertaining and she was nice.  we started with a couple of glasses of pinot noir that i didnt like at all. i switched to the petite syrah that was much better. they gave a nice basket of focaccia and olive oil.  for app we shared the artichoke ravioli in truffle cream.  fairly simple dish but very tasty.  generous portion also, more than enough to split for an app.  i had the veal scallopini, it was served with mushrooms kale and some dumplings in a red wine truffle sauce.  my date had a chicken special which was stuffed with mushroom and wrapped in bacon.  both were very good.   skipped dessert.  overall a very pleasant dinner.  one pasta, one veal, one chicken and 4 glasses of wine was $95 i dont know that there is much more on the menu i would run back for, i didnt really see any other entrees that i was interested in.  there was a duck special that i guess they ran out of i would have tried if they had it.   i dont eat fish so i would like to see more meat options in the entree section.  they do offer quite a few pastas that sound good.  so i wouldnt have any problem going back.  and maybe ill will try the brunch.

reviews: Took my Mom here for dinner after a walk in Astoria Park. The exterior did initially draw us in, but the wait staff, host and food kept us. They offer pretty original food combinations and they were all delicious. we started with the trio bruschetta, we chose the hazelnut/honey, pineapple/chili and avocado- all really good. Mom had the fried gnocchi and I ordered the pasta with peas, prosciutto and zabaglione sauce. Really good! The serving sizes are smaller than the gluttonous sizes in most restaurant, but it is plenty and no waste of food. Great to sit outside, the street isn't too busy and the inside is also nice. Good to have lunch, brunch or dinner or to come for just a cheese plate and wine or coffee and desert. Highly recommended.

The serving sizes are smaller than the gluttonous sizes in most restaurant, but it is plenty and no waste of food. Great to sit outside, the street isn't too busy and the inside is also nice.

reviews: FRIGGIN' AWESOME!My boyfriend and I were excited to go out and try a new Italian restaurant that had just opened in Astoria, which will remain nameless.  While we were there the food looked amazing, but the communication between the staff was terrible, after a few mistakes and hearing the couple stand up and say, "After 30-minutes of waiting and they didn't once tell us it's cash only", we departed.As we left, we bumped into that same couple and they said that they were going to Locale a few blocks away since they were set on Italian.  After getting a good whiff of garlic and cheese, we realized that ours were as well so we headed on over to 34th Ave and we were SOOOOO HAPPY we did.We arrived around 8 on a Friday night and we didn't have to wait as we opted to sit inside (most of the outside tables were taken as people enjoyed the weather).  They had "The Godfather" playing on the white brick wall behind the bar and we started to pick through the menu.  We got a bottle of wine, a crostino, veal meatballs, rigatoni with pork cheek, and pork chop.The staff was extremely friendly and helpful with the menu.  Each plate kept getting better and better, but had we eaten the plates in reverse I would say the same.  They were all so delicious!  The burrata on the crostino was so rich and creamy.  The veal meatballs are indescribably tender and perfectly seasoned in a sweet traditional marinara.  The rigatoni had such a rich flavor between the jowl and the onions.  And the pork chop, my word!  It was perfectly cooked and on a bed of broccoli rabe and cannellini beans.  The flavors were amazing!  I wish I had a food critique's repertoire of food adjectives that I could use other than amazing because I don't know how else to describe it.The atmosphere was nice, relaxed, and unpretentious.  We ended up closing the restaurant portion down as we enjoyed our delicious Sirah and none of the staff bothered to rush us out, but let us enjoy our time there.HIGHLY RECOMMENDED and they are even starting a movie night on Tuesdays with half-priced bottles of wine.  We'll be going back this weekend to enjoy another feast with our friends visiting from out of town.Thanks Locale!

reviews: Vey nice décor and great staff. Our server Gabrielle was friendly, professional and helpful. She makes up for this place!Lentil soup was good but our main courses were average, too heavy on sauce and nothing spectacular about it. I had a crème brulee for dessert and again just average. I'll give it another try, maybe the chef was just not in a good mood that night.
