reviews: Pretenious and over-rated. Food was ok, decor was very charming, service was terrible. I found this place here on Yelp as it was rated highly for groups and for brunch. I was looking to host a surprist bridal shower for a close friend. I attempted to make a reservation 3 times before it was acutally completed. I asked if they had a pre-fix brunch menu available for group. They said yes, but they didn't know what it was and they would get back to me. They never got back to me.I had to call several times to get an answer about that. I was finally instructed by the manager that I should pick six items off the current menu, anything except the skirt steak and we would recieve unlimited mimosas, bloody marys, coffee, and tea for $40. I thought that was a little high so I asked if we could get 4 options with unlimited drinks for $35 - no, couldn't do it. Ok - fine. So I then chose my six items, to which the manager replied two of the six items were not available. Why say pick any six if you didn't mean it? Then I asked for savory vegatarian options, the manager replied with two meat filled choices - come on. Fast forward to the morning of - I called around 11 am letting them know that we would only have 10 instead of the intended 15 for our 1:30 reservation. The hostess who I spoke with said thank you for calling - no problem. 5 minutes later my phone rings with the manager asking me if I was cancelling the reservation. I said no I'm not cancelling, I'm letting you know that we will not be as many as originally thought. He told me that I couldn't do that in the future but this time he would let it slide. At no point was I informed that they needed 72 hours notice on adjusting the reservation. Seriously?! I'm freeing up space for you in advance and I get an attitude. I arrive around 1:15 and grab a seat at the bar because our space wasn't ready yet. No worries - I was early. So the table is ready at 1:30 and I begin setting up. We expect the bride to arrive around 2. So the other guests arrive and we order some tea and coffee. The bride ended up being delayed in the city so she didn't arrive until 2:30. I appreciate that it was later than I had said it would be. I didn't appreciate the manager and a waitress repeated pestering me about when would the rest of the party be arriving. The restuarant is busy but no one is waiting for a table at this point. Is it really that serious?The bride arrives - we surprise her - Yay! We all order within the next 5 minutes and get down to enjoying our unlimited beverages and the company. Our waitress is bringing our drinks and proceeds to spill 6 mimosas down the bride's back. After many apologies and a hair dryer in the bathroom, we continued to celebrate and ordered another round of drinks.35 minutes later - our drinks arrive and the waitress tells me that the unlimited portion of our event is over as per the manager. Ok - I'm really not unreasonable but come on - you spill multiple drinks down the back of the guest of honor, replace them 35 minutes later, and then you tell me we're done?! So I ask for the check.The manager brings the check and asks if we want anything else - more drinks? dessert? No thank you - I'll take my overpriced average brunch bill and go. Needless to say I will not be returning. This is not the place for group or a reasonable brunch

reviews: Food was OK but a few things really let the dining experience down.1. White wine was warm - they said they had problems with their refrigerator but still served it to us. For this the service gets a B.2. They brought the main meals when we were clearly still on our appetizers. They looked embarrassed when we glanced up wondering what they were doing there but they proceed sheepishly anyway. For this the service gets a B-3. Four of us at a table but they insist on leaning over me, placing their armpit in my face as they serve the person next to me. Would it kill them to make the extra three steps? For this the service gets a CAll in all - amateur night in great decor. So many possibilities, so much promise, so little effort... Overall - rating? C
extracted: For this the service gets a B.2. So many possibilities, so much promise, so little effort...

reviews: What struck me first was the design of the façade and interior: decidedly not Queens (or at least not the Queens I am used to). Locale has the ambiance of a cafe in Paris and adequate food. There is nothing on the menu that has ever disappoint my myself or my guests, but I usually stick to the eggs benedict. A safe choice. The coffee is strong and the servers are good. What more can you ask for?
extracted: There is nothing on the menu that has ever disappoint my myself or my guests, but I usually stick to the eggs benedict. A safe choice The coffee is strong and the servers are good. What more can you ask for

reviews: Me and 7 friends made a reservation at Locale when we learned that they recently changed management, and it was a great a great choice. You can always tell whether an Italian restaurant is any good by the quality of the staples - calamari, pasta, wine, etc. In all categories, Locale met par, and they really surprised with their cocktails and a few dishes, including the duck, the short ribs, the shaved brussel sprout salad, and the tortellini with braised beef. I wouldn't hesitate to recommend this place.
extracted: You can always tell whether an Italian restaurant is any good by the quality of the staples - calamari, pasta, wine, etc. I wouldn't hesitate to recommend this place.

reviews: My fiancé and I just had our engagement party brunch here and it was AMAZING!!! The staff was awesome and the food was great!  I would recommend this place to anyone.  We had 56 guests and the owners were so accommodating and willing to make the day very special.  All of our guests were complimenting the outstanding service and food.  Our glasses were getting filled constantly and the food came out nice and hot for everyone!  They personalized the chalkboard for us, played a picture slideshow of us, and provided really cute photo props for each table for our guests to enjoy!  We forgot to get batteries for one of our marquee letters for decoration and one of the staff went out to get some!  Also one of our guests were picking at some left over calamari (because it was so good!!) and the owner came over and asked if she wanted more gnocchi (thinking she didn't get enough on her plate...which she did...she just really liked the calamari and the gnocchi is great too..my personal favorite).  They were so great and professional.  I am so glad we chose gastroteca.  Our day couldn't have been better!! THANK YOUUU!!!

They were so great and professional. I am so glad we chose gastroteca. THANK YOUUU  AMAZING

reviews: Minus two stars for service. Minus one for food. The biggest plus here is that I got 10% off my bill by checking in on Yelp. Luckily I actually did get my bill after waiting 20+ minutes after I finished dinner. I acknowledge the restaurant did get busy, but if a server can't come to the table at least once every 15min, even just to refill water, I don't feel appreciated.I wanted to like this place more because it is very local (hah!), but I just couldn't. I am not a picky eater, at all, but the spaetzle and sauce with my pork scaloppini were just yuck. I've had spaetzle before, and it's been better. That said, my boyfriend did love his filet mignon and couldn't even finish it. I would come here for drinks because the bar looked pretty nice.

I am not a picky eater, at all, but the spaetzle and sauce with my pork scaloppini were just yuck. I would come here for drinks because the bar looked pretty nice.

reviews: Brunch here is excellent.  We had a very attentive waitress who was not too chatty (which I liked) and sat inside but next to a huge open wall onto the street - so virtually outside.  The decor is beautiful.  I was worried because the pictures looked so dark, but the whole place opens up for brunch and is full of sunlight.We had cheddar polenta, homefries (they use some rosemary rub which is unexpected but tasty), spinach goat cheese omelet, and I got a chocolate latte which was pretty delicious.The food was good, but the environment was even better.  A really nice place for brunch and awesome that you can make reservations online!

A really nice place for brunch and awesome that you can make reservations online!

reviews: Living south of Broadway, I love having brunch at Locale. The menu is great (the drink menu as well), the food was very good, and the attention from both the staff and the owner was amazing.The corned beef hash eggs benedict was smashing, as was my drink, a red wine sangria based with Montepulciano (my favorite wine, it just so happens, for its fruity hints from the South of Italy). They have a 1,000 different teas, maybe literally. With so many choices, of course we spazzed and got decaf chamomile.We'd been pestered by a bee, attracted to our sweet sangria. Rather than bringing out the toxic raid bee killer extreme 2000, the owner was kind and wise enough to place a bowl of honey out which apparently did the trick.I've eaten here many times for brunch and dinner and I love it here. It's a local establishment (no puns on the name), the food is good and everyone who I've encountered who works here has been extremely friendly.The managers and owner seems extremely receptive to feedback and will go out of their way to make for an excellent dining experience.By the looks of other reviews, I'm not the only one who left happy and on a full stomach....maybe a little tipsy though.****4 stars for great brunch, ever changing dinner menu, beautiful interior decor, outdoor seating in the summer and friendly waiters and owner! Viva la Locale!

Viva la Locale

reviews: Charm ,ambiance and quality in Queens! Plus no obnoxious scene! First off I am not a brunch person for the most part. There are many restaurants that just over charge because it is "brunch". But I had to get my massage and with my condition sitting is the most painful thing for me. After the distress my body was in at Taverna Kyklades (though the food was awesome) we decided I should not go out to eat  unless the restaurant has comfy chairs.So my husband was challenged to find some place that is clean and comfy and warm for me. For some reason I just never saw this or noticed at on Yelp though several Yelp friends have gone. As several other reviewers said I wish I had found it sooner.The reason I needed to get brunch and get my massage so early is (or at least early for me) is our money pit apartment still needed additional work. We had painters come that insisted that they come early. So I got up early for the massage (they came in early for me) they do not really have set hours they will be there if they have customers, so we needed to eat and do errands to stay out until they were finished in our apartment.I thought of Sugar Freak but really the brunch is all high fat and high sugar. There are no healthy choices at all. So my husband found Locale and I am so glad he did. He choose it based on the pictures on their web site of their comfy seating.If you are outside of New York reading this you might not realize that many if not most New York restaurants lack decor space and ambaience. It is stressful for me right now in my condition to deal with and isn't pleasant to go to most restaurants. In NY you pay for comfort. But at Locale the prices are reasonable.We went for brunch but I will go back and have lunch and dinner. The menu is limited but the food is so clean and appropriate for the space. There are so many restaurants that look clean but if you peak into the kitchen there is chaos and dirt. Not here it is really clean all around. I had a Salmon Omelet which was okay it didn't thrill me so I switched with my hubby who had eggs and cheddar cheese polenta. We split the yogurt parfait. He is not really a yogurt person. He said though it was better than any yogurt he's  ever had! It was as good as it looks in the pictures, better even! He loved the banana pudding at Sugar Freak and said that is more his speed. But that is all he liked there. He liked everything about Locale. I was surprised to see that it is not a scene.Very low Key vibe.Others mentioned it is a nice date spot. Which brings me to something we saw that was so adorable. We saw an elderly couple that looked to be in their 80's. They were holding hands on a date. They were so cute! It is a great date spot or place to talk with friends. There were specials not on the menu on line as well as regulars ordering past specials not on the menu and the chef accommodated them.I am really charmed and look forward to going back soon!

reviews: Ehhh I really want to like Locale. I really do. It's the place my friend treated me to on my birthday. It's the place I chose to have my first date with a special lady and I enjoyed tons of good companys here. The place is hip. There's an elevated corner lounge that's great for large, private parties. The full bar stretches itself across the room. It felt like a bar with an extended dining area and outside seating. The waitresses were endearing. The bigger the expectations though, the more harsh I seem to be on reviews. The food wasn't very tastey. I had the Locale burger, medium rare. It came too rare for my taste and it was one of those really mushy burgers. I prefer my meat to have at least some bite to it. The drinks were alright. It doesn't justify the city-like costs though.You can find better options one more subway stop to broadway or better yet, two more to my hood at 30th ave.I am willing to give it another go and try something different on the menu - but am I just in denial?

reviews: A little on the expensive side. My girlfriend and I ordered 2 glasses of wine, 2 entrees, 2 deserts, 1 appetizer and an aperitif and it all cost less than $125.  So judge the prices by that.The service was incredible.  The waiter we had was an extremely knowledgeable in both the menu items and the bar items.  He was also extremely charismatic and persuasive, often saying, why not? when we were offered more drinks and desert. The man must also have the patience of a saint.  As we were leaving some b**ch, who was apparently allergic to everything under the sun was complaining that the restaurant was running out of some of its evening specials and practically everything offered on the menu she was allergic to. Well that's what happens when you go to dinner at 11 pm on a Saturday night, what a horse's a**. The food was excellent.  I ordered the steak special, served with fried onions and mashed potatoes.  The only thing I was disappointed with was that the steak was cut  up into slices, I was hoping for a slab of steak.  The cherry cobbler was amazing! I highly recommend it.

The cherry cobbler was amazing I highly recommend it

reviews: Decent food.  Terrible service.  We had a party of 12 with reservations ahead of time.  Yet when we got there they still had some setup to do.  Fine.  But then it got worse.Super slow with everything, had to ask for extra place settings and water several times.  They were SO stingy with bread and olive oil it was ridiculous.  We had to ask for the same things about 4 times, and some of what we asked for never made it to the table.Took forever to get the appetizers, and waited about another half an hour or more between when appetizers finished to when entrees came.Here are some of the good and bad:Good:- meatballs - tender, juicy, flavorful- wild mushroom ravioli - good, not spectacular- calamari - nicely battered and fried- squid ink linguine - good balance of flavors- lamb pappardelle - again, good, but not spectacular.  Too much pasta to meat in proportionsBad:- Mayan shrimp with yucca - shrimp was DOUSED in seasoning.  strong, heavy, salty seasoning that completely masked the delicateness of the shrimp.  The yucca was hard and dry.- beef short rib risotto.  Who the hell chops short ribs into small cubes?  The flavor was good but the main ingredient was in small pieces and missing from the dish, and the consistency of the risotto was more like mashed potatoes- Grilled flank steak - meat was well seasoned, by dry and chewy.  With all of the "organic, free range" ingredients they say they use, that was NOT grass-fed beef we had at our table.I doubt I'll come back here again.  There are many other place with more consistent food and way better levels of service.

Too much pasta to meat in proportionsBad:- Mayan shrimp with yucca - shrimp was DOUSED in seasoning. The yucca was hard and dry.- beef short rib risotto. With all of the "organic, free range" ingredients they say they use, that was NOT grass-fed beef we had at our table.I doubt I'll come back here again. There are many other place with more consistent food and way better levels of service.

reviews: This place is amazeballs. Sweet and attentive servers, refills on coffee, several types of eggs benedict, and amazing bloody marys. Just make sure to make a reservation- even early for brunch I had to choose between a community high top table or bar seat (I did not care- but others may).
extracted: Just make sure to make a reservation- even early for brunch I had to choose between a community high top table or bar seat (I did not care- but others may).

reviews: Hands down my favorite restaurant in Astoria! This place is slighlty dressy, hip and overall a excellent restaurant. We love the service, the wine menu, the food,and well the desserts are delish! We have never had a bad meal or experience at Locale. The have an amazing cheese plate.They make some yummy cocktails although I usually get wine- I would recommend trying one of them. The specials are almost too good to pass down but sometimes we go wanting something specifically from the menu. The desserts and coffees are fantastic! We love the look and feel of this restaurant. We are so glad we have this restaurant in Astoria- it's a gem!!!

reviews: I recently went to Locale for Saturday brunch with an amazing fashionista from the locale.  I was skeptical when she suggested it but decided to give it a try.  The place was kind of empty at about 3pm...The restaurant is a quaint open space...It has a nice ambiance about it.  I can see it being a cozy candle lit place at night..I took one star off because they sat us near the door in the winter in an otherwise empty restaurant and it was drafty... I was also disappointed by the lack of a more comprehensive and inclusive brunch menu, but I took no stars off for that, as its not their fault that I have been spoiled by the Calle Ocho's of the world.I ordered Rigatoni from the Special's menu...It was in a wine sauce and it was fantastic.  I was more than impressed, especially since I was honestly expecting a bit of a train wreck.  The food was very well prepared and flavorful.  My dining partner ordered breakfast and her food seemed to be quite delicious and she stated several times that she had a great meal and commented on the home fries.  The server was attentive...but the place was not busy, so that wasn't too hard.  However, she always had a smile in her face and sunshine in her heart.I would definitely recommend Locale as a place to go for brunch if you are in the area and unsure of where to eat.  I was quite impressed with my entree...I would say skip the liquor if you are value conscious...but really, the food can hold its own with the best of them...

The server was attentive...but the place was not busy, so that wasn't too hard. I was quite impressed with my entree...I would say skip the liquor if you are value conscious...but really, the food can hold its own with the best of them...

reviews: The food at Locale is great, I've been here a couple times and was generally Wow'ed by every dish. I love that they offer different variations of eggs benedict -- they're all delicious. If you like a sweeter breakfast, they offer super decadent dishes (Belgian waffles/french toast/pancakes) as well.  No complaints about the service -- staff is very friendly and attentive. Ambiance is also alluring.  Overall, it's always a positive experience at Locale!

reviews: Tomato Bisque - great!Calamari - great!Black Pasta - getting tired of saying it's great, but hey... It really is!Love going to Locale.  My girlfriend and I enjoy the quiet atmosphere, the comfortable bench seats with cushions and the very pleasant staff.  It's more expensive than your average neighborhood restaurant, but I haven't found a problem with the price.  I come here for an enjoyable evening to relax. I've yet to be disappointed.
extracted: enjoy

reviews: Had a late brunch here. It was a reasonable experience. My friend enjoyed her carbonara pasta. The burger was a little well done despite me asking for medium rare. The side salad had some mushy leaves. The service was very attentive and the atmosphere was fine.

reviews: The most amazing restaurant in Queens. Love the fresh pasta and the new fall menu. Sexy setting and crowd.

reviews: I wished I came here sooner. The  atmosphere, the food, and the drinks make this restaurant the perfect place for a night out. Another wonderful date restaurant in Astoria! They have outdoor seating and there's a nice lounge like area with couches inside the restaurant as well. I had the crispy zucchini with marinara sauce for an appetizer. The zucchini are cut into really super skinny (think anorexic) shoe string fries. The waiter said that most people ate the zuchinni fries with their fingers like french fries, which I found difficult to do. One,  they gave me a substantial portion (two people could have shared this) and two, the fries are so skinny that they barely got any of sauce when I dipped them. I elected to dump them out onto the plate and poured the sauced over them. The zuchinni fries were really tasty. I didn't care for the fried calamari so much, as I thought it was a bit mushy.For my entree, I had the linguini with clams. It was delicious, but a little too salty. I had to down a couple glasses of water while eating it and then drank another couple glasses when I got home. The drinks were incredible. I loved my blood orange martini. It was sweet and a little tart. The blood orange flavor was out of this world. The pineapple mojito was beautifully delicious and I loved the heady mint scent coming from that drink.$85 for 2 drinks, 2 appetizers, 2 entrees, tax, and tip.

One,  they gave me a substantial portion (two people could have shared this) and two, the fries are so skinny that they barely got any of sauce when I dipped them. The zuchinni fries were really tasty. The drinks were incredible. The pineapple mojito was beautifully delicious and I loved the heady mint scent coming from that drink.$85 for 2 drinks, 2 appetizers, 2 entrees, tax, and tip. It was delicious

reviews: I have been here twice in the past year and while the food and service were 5 star the first time, they were 1 star the second time. It was seasonal food around Halloween the second time, so figure pumpkin ravioli...did not hit the nail on the head that time. Might try again though just to be certain.

reviews: Good food just always packed so you have to call in advance so do so.great place specially for breakfast .two thumbs up!

The staff was friendly and helpful, amibance was nice and cozy but the food tasted only decent and they were not generous with their portions.  Not worth the price I paid for the food. Don't come here on an empty stomach. Have a small snack or coffee before coming here.

reviews: Came across this place when looking for an Italian restaurant in Astoria to check out.  There is a small outdoor seating area in the front.  The inside is quaint with a small lounge area in the back and a nice bar on the side.We started with the fried zucchini appetizer which was surprisingly good.  Cut shoestring style and fried, served with a slightly sweet tomato sauce that went well with the slightly salty zucchini.For our entrees we ordered the shrimp and english pea risotto and the parpadelle and lamb ragu.  Both were nothing to write home about.  Average at best.  The risotto was on the bland side and the rice and just boring.  The parpadelle was on the boring side as well.  Both entrees left us wanting for more.  We were hoping the tasty appetizer was a sign of good things to come with our entrees but we were sadly mislead and left us no desire to return back to this restaurant.

Both were nothing to write home about Average at best The risotto was on the bland side and the rice and just boring

reviews: i really enjoy the interior decor and style of this place-- nothing spectacular, just nice and cozy, and good looking. it's a really nice spot to have drinks and/or dinner on a weekday night.i have had dinner at this place twice now, where i ordered the mushroom ravioli the first time and the artichoke ravioli the second time. i thought the mushroom ravioli was delicious, but the artichoke ravioli was just mediocre (too creamy, and the artichoke could've been fresher). great service both times (the waiter is quite memorable).get the calamari appetizer too, they make it crispy and tasty. p.s. music fans, they were playing this amazing nostalgic 90s indie/alternative playlist (think portishead, dinosaur jr., etc.) the second night i was there and i very much enjoyed that.

reviews: I have been to Locale twice, once for brunch and once for dinner. My experience each time was completely different. When I went for brunch, I absolutely fell in love.. The waitress, was probably one of the best waitresses I have ever had. unfortunately I do not remember her name but she was the most professional and most amicable waitress I have ever seen. I had the eggs benedict with canadian bacon and it was SO GOOD.  My dinner experience however was not so pleasant. After having such a enjoyable brunch experience I convinced my friends to go there for dinner for one of my friend's birthday. The waitress was alright, she was new so she wasn't as efficient as the previous waitress I had encountered at locale. As I mentioned the restaurant is very cute, it is a bit small but the ambiance is perfect. The food off of the dinner menu however, was rather disappointing. For appetizer, we had the the braised meatballs and the regular house salad with italian dressing. The meatballs where decent, the salad was probably something that should be served on the side for free. For our entree's we had the beef short rib risotto, which was VERY heavy and tasted like something you would find in a can of chef boyardee. We also had the organic chicken, which was very dry ( I mean how can you mess up chicken?), the toasted polenta and asparagus that is served with the chicken however was rather good. We also had the pappardelle & lamb ragu and the rigatoni bolognese, these were probably the largest disappointments of all the entrees. The pasta itself  in both dishes were VERY al dente, it was barely edible and as an Italian restaurant you would expect that you get good pasta.So basically, if you want to try locale go for brunch and stay away from the dinner menu!

I had the eggs benedict with canadian bacon and it was SO GOOD. As I mentioned the restaurant is very cute, it is a bit small but the ambiance is perfect. The food off of the dinner menu however, was rather disappointing. For our entree's we had the beef short rib risotto, which was VERY heavy and tasted like something you would find in a can of chef boyardee. We also had the organic chicken, which was very dry ( I mean how can you mess up chicken? ), the toasted polenta and asparagus that is served with the chicken however was rather good. The pasta itself  in both dishes were VERY al dente, it was barely edible and as an Italian restaurant you would expect that you get good pasta.So basically, if you want to try locale go for brunch and stay away from the dinner menu!

reviews: I went here a few times for dinner back in 2006 when I lived closer..came back a few months ago for brunch. I got a spinach and goat cheese omelette that was surprisingly good. Spinach omelettes often taste watery and too "leafy" but this was excellent.We got a side of cheddar polenta, which had way too much cheese in it. You could barely taste the polenta. My dining companion got eggs benedict, which were also cooked funny - not firm enough.When the check came, we happened to look at Yelp and noticed there was a 10% off deal. When I mentioned it to the waiter, she almost seemed offended. They made a whole production and went to talk to a manager. I never understand why places offer deals then get mad/surprised when people use them.After brunch (and paying), we were talking for a few more minutes and a guy came over and said "waaaater?" I declined. He then came over 5 minutes later and said "waaaaaater?" I declined again. I then went to use the bathroom, and on my way back he stopped me to see if we needed water. I have no idea what the water zombie wanted, or how badly he wanted to eat my brains, but we quickly left.

reviews: Love the ambiance and food. It's a great date night place, or brunch with the ladies on a weekend.

reviews: I'm going to go along with the other reviews since I only visited here once. It's good food, in a comfortable atmosphere. Great place for a date since its comfortable and has some more intimate seating up on the platformed area.As enjoyable as it was I had a weird confrontation with someone on shift the night I visited when I tried to use my Yelp discount/promotion. On another note, the waitress we had was brand new and trying extra hard to be helpful. Hopefully things worked out for her.They also would not let us try a wine we were offered after the bottle I wanted, and knew, was not available. That seemed odd.

reviews: Food was good. My service experience was not great but I think that it was rare- probably better usually. We came for Sunday brunch- outside full but inside empty. We were sat promptly and given tap water immediately by a male server. A female server asked us about drinks. Iced coffee yay! Then the male server asked us for drinks. No problem. We told him our coffees were coming but we'll order food. I ordered the chicken club. Server asked if I want the salad or the fries. I chose the salad. Table next to us gets seated and they are offered bottled water. Fine, we'd chose tap anyway. Table next to us' food is brought out. Our coffee is empty. (No refill offers the rest of the visit)Another table next to us (but outside) was sat 10 minutes after us. Their food comes out. We wait at least another 10 min before server says "it'll be out in 2 seconds". We wait 10 more minutes. Then we take matters in our hands and ask. "Soon" they say. It comes out. I get my sandwich with a big pile of fries. I told the server that although I love fries, I ordered a salad. He gets snippy with me and says something like "oh, Um, well I only have 2 hands, I can't carry it all". NO sir, do not get snippy with me. Bad excuse. It's salad OR fries, not both. It would be fine if it was a simple mistake. The excuse really turned me off. Bc it wasn't a good one. But I got both so it was remedied.., although we waited so long that my stomach almost ate itself! Food was great. Only complaint was that salad had nothing but greens and dressing. No cheese, veggies, nuts, whatever. Tasted fine but you know. But maybe that's bc they forgot I ordered it. Whatever! I'll give it one more chance.

We were sat promptly and given tap water immediately by a male server Iced coffee yay We told him our coffees were coming but we'll order food. Table next to us gets seated and they are offered bottled water Fine, we'd chose tap anyway. Our coffee is empty. We wait at least another 10 min before server says "it'll be out in 2 seconds". He gets snippy with me and says something like "oh, Um, well I only have 2 hands, I can't carry it all". It would be fine if it was a simple mistake. Food was great. Tasted fine but you know I'll give it one more chance. Sunday brunch Food was great.

reviews: This place was awesome start to finish and the prices are an amazing value. For our table of 4, we had two bottles of wine, 2 apps, our own entrees, and 2 desserts and it cost us $50/person! That's what I call a DSD steal! Wow!The crostinis were interesting combinations: the pineapple, mascarpone and chili was the standout! Second runner up, taleggio, blackberry and pistachio. So good! The arancini was superb! It was one huge ball that was delicate and creamy on the inside topped with a flavorful tomato sauce. The entrees all were great. My cavatelli with clam sauce and spicy pancetta was really unique. Clams and pork? Say what? It made this distinct flavor where you had the essence of a typical clam sauce but had the salty fatty quality you get from pancetta. It was pretty stellar. My bites of the my friend's risotto and gnocchi were delicious too. No one went wrong with their choices. Then we get to dessert. And I'm not really a sweets person. I would normally want to have an extra appetizer vs dessert, but this place knocked dessert out of the park! Damn. The Nutella bread pudding was slamming. Oh my god that chocolate sauce! And the banana zepoles...hello, can you hear me, I'm in NY dreaming about you and me. Jesus these things were good. They were like balls of heaven. I can't wait to come back to Queens to come here again! Winner winner!
extracted: This place was awesome start to finish and the prices are an amazing value My cavatelli with clam sauce and spicy pancetta was really unique. Clams and pork It made this distinct flavor where you had the essence of a typical clam sauce but had the salty fatty quality you get from pancetta It was pretty stellar. My bites of the my friend's risotto and gnocchi were delicious too. No one went wrong with their choices. I would normally want to have an extra appetizer vs dessert, but this place knocked dessert out of the park! Oh my god that chocolate sauce Jesus these things were good. I can't wait to come back to Queens to come here again! So good

reviews: My first thoughts about Gastroteca was that they have a decent menu with extremely cheap cocktails and the ambience is out of this world.On second thought (after tasting their menu items) I am apt to still believe this, but I feel their food is lacking in flavor.My partner ordered a WINter75 cocktail and a fried eggplant and burrata sandwich and I ordered a bloody mary and had the crispy gnocchi.  Their WINter 75 cocktail was a winner.   Well balanced with the gin, prosecco, earl grey syrup (so delicate) and light on the lemon it was a definite hit.  I felt I was missing out on it once I tried it and wished I had ordered it instead.Their eggplant and burrata sandwich was okay.  The melty burrata seemed to give the sandwich some flavor but otherwise it was rather bland and felt like packing carbs.  It came with a side salad that was some lettuce leaves tossed in a very oiled down yet excellent balsamic.  It tasted good, but you could barely taste it.  Okay, the salad was pretty wimpy if we're being honest. My bloody mary was pretty horrid as far as the standard goes. It came without rimmer and the garnish was two clunkily sliced pieces of lemon and lime.  It looked like garbage, and it tasted merely alright.  The bloody mary mix they used was okay but they seemingly added nothing to it.My gnocchi was scantly plated.  They used a larger plate but there was barely any gnocchi on it.  The gnocchi itself was very fresh but with every bite I was searching for the flavor with it nowhere to be found.  I waited for the basil, pistachio and spinach to hit alas it never came. Would I come here again?  In a pinch, yes.  Will I be going out of my way? No, absolutely not.
extracted: Well balanced with the gin, prosecco, earl grey syrup (so delicate) and light on the lemon it was a definite hit. The melty burrata seemed to give the sandwich some flavor but otherwise it was rather bland and felt like packing carbs It tasted good, but you could barely taste it. Okay, the salad was pretty wimpy if we're being honest. The gnocchi itself was very fresh but with every bite I was searching for the flavor with it nowhere to be found.

reviews: The decor, the menu selection, the layout of the place was a strong 5 in my book. Unfortunately for me the brunch food and drink fell a little flat. Ordered: Lamb & Spinach hash - the eggs were poached perfectly but I didn't get much from the pesto hollandaise in terms of flavor. The lamb was either shredded very finely or there wasn't much of it in the dish which was a bit disappointing. Bloody Mary special - thicker than your average BM mix, which I don't mind at all but the flavor is definitely on the smokier side. The bourbon infused bacon bits were interesting but I don't think I'd order againI really loved the space and there were other items that looked intriguing enough that I would def come back for a second try.
extracted: The decor, the menu selection, the layout of the place was a strong 5 in my book. The bourbon infused bacon bits were interesting but I don't think I'd order againI really loved the space and there were other items that looked intriguing enough that I would def come back for a second try.

reviews: What a gem in the heart of Astoria! After a Friday night of drinking, we were getting hungry and in the mood for some good ol' brunch food so some Yelp searches turned up Gastroteca, only a few blocks away and with high ratings. It was rather chilly, so we were given a seat indoors even though we loved the patio! So neat and cute with vibrant colors accenting the restaurant's black and white base colors.We each ordered a different brunch food off of the brunch menu: I personally got the California benedict (perfectly poached eggs with guacamole, roasted tomatoes and Hollandaise sauce on an English muffin, with delicious homefries). My friends got the Spaghetti Carbonara (this was SO good, and topped with smoked bacon, a fried egg and pecorino cheese - what more can you want in your pasta?) and the Sugar Dusted Texas Toast (stuffed with nutella! This was wonderful too).Overall, it was a wonderful dining experience, our waiter was very attentive and our waters were never empty. They were playing the Magic Schoolbus on the wall above the bar which was actually rather cute, and was very kid friendly too. During our meal, a child at another table actually fell off his high chair, and watching the staff help the boy (and his family!) feel better, even though it was no fault of Gastroteca's own, was charming to see. We'll be back again for your delicious food and wonderful service!
extracted: What a gem in the heart of Astoria My friends got the Spaghetti Carbonara (this was SO good, and topped with smoked bacon, a fried egg and pecorino cheese - what more can you want in your pasta?) This was wonderful too).Overall, it was a wonderful dining experience, our waiter was very attentive and our waters were never empty. They were playing the Magic Schoolbus on the wall above the bar which was actually rather cute, and was very kid friendly too. We'll be back again for your delicious food and wonderful service!

reviews: I went with my friend for the first time and the dish I ordered tastes amazing! shrimps n grits

reviews: The food was good ! The Nutella French toast is a must try. Please tell them lite on the Nutella because they will overload that shit. Besides that the chicken a waffle was okay. The waffle was a bit on the dry side, fried chicken was okay, needs more seasoning. If you are in Astoria area try it out. Enjoy xoxo

reviews: This was the worst brunch experience I have ever had for both the service and the food in Astoria. It was a total rip-off and I left so unsatisfied. I went to brunch with a couple of friends from out of town. I read fairly good reviews online about this place, so we gave it a try. What a big big big disappointment. I can't stop thinking about how bad of a brunch this was - i actually regret going there.The waiter was unwelcoming and cold. All Y/N responses.He was annoyed when I asked for a little adjustment in my meal (egg whites only - oh wait half an egg white and please charge me extra for it, too, and do not tell me about it). I had the most measly meal of all. I got the baked eggs terracotta - not worth the $13 at all. All it was was tomato sauce baked with a sprinkle of kale, beans, mushrooms and mozzarella. Oh yeah and an egg, which they charged me extra for an egg white and I had half of an egg white! What's wrong with you guys? it's brunch - where are the eggs? I paid $15 and was not full. It was like eating half a cup of tomato sauce and 2 slices of bread. Wow. I would be ashamed serving that as a brunch meal. The gnocchi - don't expect to get full because the serving was about maybe a little more than half a cup.  I should've spoke up to management before we paid the check, but I was embarrassed to say anything in front of my guests. What a shame of a place.
extracted: I read fairly good reviews online about this place, so we gave it a try. What a big big big disappointment. I can't stop thinking about how bad of a brunch this was - i actually regret going there.The waiter was unwelcoming and cold. I paid $15 and was not full. I would be ashamed serving that as a brunch meal. I should've spoke up to management before we paid the check, but I was embarrassed to say anything in front of my guests. What a shame of a place

reviews: Very cute ambiance and friendly and professional service make Gastroteca a very solid Astoria brunch option right away.  Great range of brunch beverages, and I would say average menu items.  A recent visit puts Gastroteca at four stars for me - I had the spinach/goat cheese omelette, which, though very well plated, was very over-done resulting in a somewhat unappetizing texture/.flavor on the eggs.  The side salad and toast were good, albeit lacking any sort of punch.  Drinks were excellent.  My dining companions seemed to enjoy some of the other menu items - particularly one of the eggs benedict dishes, which looked very good.  Overall, it's well worth a visit.  It gets noisy and crowded, but all of the windows and tiered seating give it a spacious, airy, pleasant vibe.

The side salad and toast were good, albeit lacking any sort of punch. My dining companions seemed to enjoy some of the other menu items - particularly one of the eggs benedict dishes, which looked very good.

reviews: We came in for brunch after reading all of the wonderful reviews.  The place has a rustic look that's very charming, the service was good and we were excited to try the food here.  We ordered the salmon crostini and the Italian  chicken and waffles. After eating a few bites of my salmon crostini and fries I started to wonder when the wonderful flavor would kick in.  What was really perplexing was the fact that the food looked so amazing however the taste was far from it. The   salmon and egg were very salty and the fries were just meh. I left most of the food on my plate.  I had a few bites of the chicken and waffles and the chicken was practically flavorless, it was as though they forgot to add any seasoning. The waffle was good. Perhaps the chef was just having an off day with the seasoning, the taste of the food left much to be desired.

I had a few bites of the chicken and waffles and the chicken was practically flavorless, it was as though they forgot to add any seasoning. The waffle was good.

reviews: Came here on Sunday for brunch with another couple, and it was absolutely amazing. I don't typically ever go out for brunch, but we were running out of double date ideas so we tried this little place in Astoria, which was a halfway point for us. To start, we got three of their spicy bloody Mary's and my boyfriend got a Moscow Mule. Their bloody Mary's were pretty good. Not too spicy but definitely a kick. I thought they were a tad watery. Not sure if they batch them and let them sit in ice (something a lot of places do) because it tasted a bit too watery. My boyfriends moscow mule had mint in it, so he said it definitely tasted like a mojito rather than a mule, but it was fine cause he likes mojitos anyway so whatever! For food, we had meatball sliders, two orders of the chicken and waffles, the pesto chicken sandwich, and the lamb something. We literally ate EVERYTHING. It was soooo good. Esp the chicken and waffles!!!! I think they use real maple syrup too! I'm originally from the Adirondacks so that's what I'm used to and you would be surprised how many places done use the real stuff!! The service was great as well. Our waitress was super nice. Even when there was a mix up with out reservation, she was still super nice and accommodating. I wish I could remember her name. I felt bad because we were there for like 2 hours because we could just talk for ages, so we definitely ate up a table of hers for awhile, but she was so sweet about it! I live in Bay Ridge, so I don't know how often I will be back, especially because it was my first time in Astoria. However, if I ever find myself in Astoria, or if someone asks me for a recommendation, this will definitely be it!

Our waitress was super nice. Even when there was a mix up with out reservation, she was still super nice and accommodating. I wish I could remember her name. reviews: I brought my family here for brunch on a Saturday. It was a full house, but we had reservations so the wait was not bad at all. Although the food was great, delicious and well prepared, we felt that the portions were a little bit on the small side for their price. The staff was really great - very attentive and did not rush us at all to leave once we were done.I would def be back because some of the items on the menu caught my attention...like nutella French Toast --- WHAAAATTT! I will def need to be on an empty stomach for that one.I was not completely sold on this place - mostly due to price and amount of food. I feel like for the price, there are many other establishments in Astoria that would be a better choice for brunch. Nevertheless, I will be back, and maybe that will result in a changed review as well!

reviews: This is my moms go-to spot for Mother's Day. I always make a early reservation for brunch as they book up very quickly. It was an almost 2 hour wait the day of to be seated.Normally the food is on point and I am never disappointed. However, my meal fell a little flat this time. I ordered the carbonara pasta which would have been delicious, but when I took my first bite, it wasn't even hot. I guess it had been sitting in the kitchen waiting for the other dishes to be completed. I also ordered the kale Caesar salad which was disappointing as well. It was just kale with lardons and very little dressing. I wasn't expecting anything spectacular but it was less than average and Gastroteca has never been average.Our started, however, were absolutely delightful! We always order the Texas toast which is stuffed with Nutella and coated in corn flakes (YUM!). We also chose the banana ricotta donuts which were like fluffy pillows of deliciousness in your mouth. They didn't have a lot of banana flavor which is a plus for me and they were so perfectly fried. Those a definite must try!

I wasn't expecting anything spectacular but it was less than average and Gastroteca has never been average.Our started, however, were absolutely delightful! Those a definite must try

reviews: I came here with two girlfriend to enjoying the day off.. What better more then to have some brunch.. This place is beautiful very rustic I'd say. Waitress  extremely helpful since one my friends has Celiac Dieases. Everything we ordered was delicious..  I enjoyed a smoke salmon with fried capers and sautéed onions. I put a poached egg over it with flavorful hollandaise sauce. My friend had the fried chicken with buttermilk waffles and the other had  a shrimp scampi with grits I tried them both and very good choice.. Everything was so good.. All 3 of us washed it down with a Spicy bloody Mary and mimosa.. I will return everything from staff to food and location was amazing..

reviews: Omg this is like a hidden gem. This visit is based on one visit to brunch.As an appetizer I had the Stromboli which was just out of this world. It was super tasty.Next, I had the baked lasagna. This platter was super cheesy and delicious. The other person I had a shrimp scampi which was also very good. As a dessert, I had the Zeppoli's and honestly they weren't all that.I was super excited because all of the reviews mention it but it honestly isn't worth it. The only reason I am giving it four stars is because of the service.The service was not the greatest.Also they need more drink variations.More of the brunch drinks are bloody Mary's which I am not a fan of.

reviews: this place is ok, is does have a great location and decor, but the menu is tiny. I went for brunch very early Sunday right after I went to the gym, wasn't looking to drink really. Was happy they have nice juice choices but for $3.00 they serve it in a rocks glass, so basically you dont with it within 10 minutes. I had the salmon crostino, which wasn't bad. It was fresh and filling. I was asked several times throughout my short stay if I wanted anything to drink, aka pushing for those liquor costs, which became annoying after awhile. I would return if in the area, would try dinner next time.

reviews: This restaurant has a modern decor with outdoor seating that I like. I came here to try their brunch on a Friday morning at 11:30. I had the opportunity to try their Rigatoni Carbonara  pasta dish. Gastroteca makes their pasta in house & it came out quite delicious and flavorful. The only thing was - I felt the pasta needed to be cooked a tad bit longer, just a tad. Other than that it was really good.I also had couple bites of the California Benedict. The eggs were perfectly poached & the yolk was snapchat worthy: runny. One of the eggs benedict, however, had a bit too much minced garlic but the other half was fine. The dish also came with home fries, which were seasoned so well and deliciously. Perfect. The decor was nice but the tables were sticky. Other than that, I had an excellent experience at Gastroteca & would definitely try this spot again!
extracted: This restaurant has a modern decor with outdoor seating that I like. The eggs were perfectly poached & the yolk was snapchat worthy: runny. The decor was nice but the tables were sticky.

reviews: Great brunch spot! The food is consistently good weekend after weekend, the staff relaxed and welcoming (although every once in a whiley group will get an inattentive waitress, but usually stay for 3+ hours so it makes no difference), and the carafes typically strong. They are on Open Table and take rezzies for brunch which is a plus. Try the zeppoles and if you order the eggplant sandwhich definitely order extra sauce!

Try the zeppoles and if you order the eggplant sandwhich definitely order extra sauce

reviews: Came here for brunch and had their belgian waffles and smoked atlantic salmon crostino. Both were decent dishes but nothing on these dishes made this place stand out. The waffle itself was kind of dry but all the toppings on it and syrup was much needed to help offset it. All the ingredients used were standard. It really felt like something I could have made at home if I had the ingredients.  My same thoughts are echoed to the salmon dish.Service was excellent. The place feels very spacious because of ceiling to floor windows.I'm sure the food is consistent but it's not a place that I will remember when looking for a brunch place given the many choices in the neighborhood.

The place feels very spacious because of ceiling to floor windows.I'm sure the food is consistent but it's not a place that I will remember when looking for a brunch place given the many choices in the neighborhood.

reviews: Came for brunch once it brunch was almost done but I decided that based on that menu I had to come back. And I did. So happy I did. I was seated at the high table and initially I was annoyed but hey, it was packed. After two mimosas I was loving the high tables. I went ahead and ordered the breakfast lasagna. And it was everything I needed to compliment my drink. It was hearty, and moist, cheesy and fresh. My only complaint was the size. But maybe it was just too darn good. Either way, my companion had the brunch Caesar salad and that too was delicious. Prices were standard, and waitress was friendly. Would come back
extracted: Prices were standard, and waitress was friendly. Came for brunch

reviews: This place has been bookmarked for me since I moved to Astoria about a year ago! I finally go to go this morning and I'm so happy to finally cross this one off. A friend and I went here around noon (on Sunday) so right smack dab in the middle of brunch time. I thought we'd have a hard time getting a seat, but we were able to get seated right away at the bar. This may have had to do with the fact it was raining, but they do take reservations too if you want to be sure you won't wait! My friend and I both ordered iced coffees which were refreshing but, you know, iced coffee. For brunch I got the California Benedict with homefries and oh by I was in heaven! Super flavorful and the perfect portion so you can leaving feeling full but not sick. Everything tasted super fresh and was hot when we got it. My friend got the salmon crostini which she also loved. It seemed like everyone was pretty happy with their food and it was definitely a very lively place. Highly recommend bringing some friends here to brunch right! Definitely a super cool spot for brunch with instagrammable decor :) looking forward to coming back for dinner!

reviews: The atmosphere caught my attention so my girlfriend and I popped in for some quick drinks and dinner. Save yourself the disappointment and don't bother eating anything. The bread at the table was nothing short of some cornbread wonder bread hybrid. Far from Italian anything. It was awful. Our meals came, simple pasta dishes (ravioli and seafood pasta)  that should have been hard to mess up. The ravioli was caked in butter, the cheese was cold and dry inside. The seafood pasta had two shrimp and the tiniest muscles I've ever seen. Both portions small and very disappointing. I don't mind paying 15-25 a plate for good Italian food even if the portions are on the small side. This place over charged for just sub par food. I'll most likely never eat here again. Its like a nice place to get a drink... So that's where the two stars come from.

reviews: One of the best brunches in Astoria! I can't count how many times I've been here for brunch (usually with a group of 8-10)  and we usually reserve the "elevated" dining area for ourselves. The food is always really good! They have standard brunch options with sandwiches and some pasta dishes mixed in, everything is always tasty - especially the fries! The service isn't always the quickest or friendliest but they do their job. Really good bloody marys and mimosas to compliment your brunch! I know we'll be back

reviews: Um, seriously? I can only describe my experience at Locale as bizarre. Though the restaurant wasn't full, we still had to wait to be seated. Then after we were seated, we were asked separately by three different servers if we wanted tap or sparkling water before we ended up having our glasses filled by a server that happened to be walking by with a pitcher. I had to order my coffee twice before I got it, and when it arrived, the coffee cup had a bright pink lipstick stain on it. Seriously? Then, we waited more than 30 minutes for our entrées. It wasn't even until the restaurant started to clear out that we got our food. How long does it take to poach an egg?ALL of this would be semi-forgivable if the food was outstanding, but unfortunately I found Locale's food to be just OK. Not only did it look a little bland, it tasted a little bland. My friends and I ordered three different versions of Eggs Benedict. I ordered the plain EGGS BENEDICT yelp.com/biz_photos/SPYM for the Canadian bacon but unfortunately there was only a meager piece on each english muffin. Sad. My friend who had the POACHED EGGS WITH BUTTERMILK BISCUIT AND COUNTRY GRAVY yelp.com/biz_photos/SPYM was equally disappointed. When our plates arrived, the first thing she said was, "There's no green!" Indeed, the brunch entrées that don't include vegetables don't even come with a small salad on the side - not a very balanced meal. My friend who ordered the PORTOBELLO BENEDICT yelp.com/biz_photos/SPYM fared much better and she really enjoyed her entrée. We also shared a side of CHEDDAR POLENTA. yelp.com/biz_photos/SPYM It was pretty decent, but when I think polenta I think of Vesta's amazing polenta brunch entrée and suddenly Locale's just can't compare.If I thought that this was just an isolated or fluke experience, I would have given Locale 3 stars, but my friend said she experienced the same lack of service the last time she was at Locale. With so many great brunch options in Astoria, Locale's lackluster food and careless service just doesn't cut it.

reviews: The salads are amazing! Pasta always al dente, pesto and tomato sauces are ALWAYS on point. Locale has changed the game in astoria when it comes to Italian foods. Also has an excellent atmosphere. This place is good all around, I'm excited to try the the rest of they're menu!

reviews: Great brunch location.  The Freddy Kreuger Bloody Mary is a must!  Make reservations or expect to wait.  Upside: Great food & beverage options.  Nice ambiance, trendy but not hipster.  Lots of windows (if you're into people-watching).  Clean.  Good coffee. Friendly service.Downside: Limited seating so there's usually a wait (but it's not usually long).  A bit pricey for Queens.
extracted: Great brunch location The Freddy Kreuger Bloody Mary is a must Make reservations or expect to wait A bit pricey for Queens

reviews: Came here for Saturday brunch with friends. They have both outdoor and indoor seatings.  We were seated inside.  That day was 85 degrees, and it was too hot eating w/o AC.I ordered Fried eggs with cheddar polenta & sausage patty.  Everything was good except the polenta was a bit too salty.  I like the decor of the place.  vintage and spacious.  has an airy feel.  I would probably go back, but will  have outdoor seating.

reviews: After one or two changes of chefs, Locale is just not what it used to be.  Don't get me wrong, I still think they have some of the best food around, but for the complete package, they have fallen off quite a bit.  As is frequently the case, I think Locale got a little too popular for its own good.  Its not a hidden gem anymore, its a weekend hotspot.Here is a sample of my issues tonight:Strike 1: I had made a reservation for 8pm and was called 2 hours before to let me know that only the lounge area was available.  I mentioned my wife was pregnant, but it seemed to be the lounge area or bust, so I begrudgingly accepted.  I really don't like sitting in the lounge area (even though I have many times).  The tables are just so low it makes it difficult to eat (especially if you have a bun in the oven) and it is basically knee-height causing extra discomfort.Strike 2:  They really overpack the restaurant at peak times.  It was extremely hot and crowded.  Also, the restaurant is one big fire hazard when its packed.  Tables feel a bit on top of each other.  My recommendation would be to go to Locale for an early dinner or brunch, but for peak times, it is just too hectic.Strike 3:  Speed of food service.  This is somewhat related to Strike 2 (see above), as the kitchen apparently can't handle the amount of tables they seat during peak times.  Tonight, our food was extremely slow.  Our waitress told us the food was being "plated" at one point, but it didn't come out until over 10 minutes later.  I think in the service industry it is never wise to promise something, then underperform, its rather bothersome.  Also, it should come as no surprise to a restaurant that it is going to be bumping on a Friday night and the kitchen should either (1) be prepared for the crowd, (2) don't seat so many tables so you can handle the orders timely and efficiently, or (3) move to a larger location and hire the appropriate help.  Strike 4? The chef will not substitute any of the sides on specials.  I just don't like paying good money for a meal and not being able to swap out a simple thing such as the type of potato, when the other type is also on the menu.  I must add that the maitre de was conscious of the slow delivery of food and did right by us, but I still feel I would be doing a disservice to yelp by not talking about my experience.  This gracious maneuver likely retained me as a customer, and as mentioned, I do really like their food. Get it together Locale!  I really want to call you my favorite Astoria restaurant once again!

The tables are just so low it makes it difficult to eat (especially if you have a bun in the oven) and it is basically knee-height causing extra discomfort.Strike 2:  They really overpack the restaurant at peak times. I must add that the maitre de was conscious of the slow delivery of food and did right by us, but I still feel I would be doing a disservice to yelp by not talking about my experience. Get it together Locale

reviews: Not at all a 4 star place, not sure how they have such a good rating right now. I couldn't believe what a rip-off this place was.I went here for New Year's with a bunch of friends and seeing as how it was a pretty expensive pre-fixe menu we figured we'd be getting some good food and service. We got the FAT bill we were expecting but that was about it. The food was just plain awful. I have absolutely no cooking experience but I could have made food better than the food they served us.Everything was pre-made in bulk so that they wouldn't have to prepare anything later. We tried to order a dish without pork and they couldn't oblige seeing as how it had already been made and was just waiting to be served. I could have walked half a block down the street to McDonalds and ordered something without pork and it would have been made fresh to order. That's just pathetic. Not only was it already prepared and ready to just be dished out, but the food was just bad. This is the only place I've been to where the decided to serve some sort of beef bullion soup. You know why this is uncommon elsewhere? because it's disgusting. No one wants that for soup. Everyone in our party took maybe two bites and set it aside.The steak was just average and I finished it just for the sake of eating with everyone. The dessert was forgettable and unimpressive as well. At the end they wanted to rush us out of there. They kept hovering over us and trying to get us to go even when we stood up, had our coats on and just wanted to stop for an additional 10 seconds to get a group photo. Oh I'm sorry, did we not just pay 1,200 dollars for some of the worst food of our lives? I think we can sit for another minute alright? But no, they came by again and told us that there were more people waiting even though we had reservations. They cheapened the whole experience while not skimping on the bill one bit.Pushy service, ridiculous prices, absent minded waitress, and just GOD-AWFUL food. Not a single person in our group had anything positive to say about this place. Maybe this is a place that should just close on new year's eve instead of acting like they are a 5 star restaurant and charging outrageous prices.Two stars is a generous rating especially with all of the other places in Astoria that have awesome deals and good food on New Year's Eve. Perhaps Locale is better during regular hours on a normal day but after the way we were treated there, I'm not going to bother to find out.

Maybe this is a place that should just close on new year's eve instead of acting like they are a 5 star restaurant and charging outrageous prices.Two stars is a generous rating especially with all of the other places in Astoria that have awesome deals and good food on New Year's Eve.

reviews: Great food, great atmosphere. I've been to Locale several times, but never filled out a review. I'm a big fan of their brunch!I will say one thing... the waitress did not know what "grilled cheese" was.... don't recommend bringing the kids...

Nice neighborhood restaurant. Food was generally good. We were having a family dinner and ordered 4 appetizers and 4 entrees which was served family style as per our request. Appetizers included calamari, braise meatballs, duck confit, and Entrées included organic chicken, lamb ragu Pappardella, short rib risotto, and skirt steak.The lamb ragu Paparedella was the least favorite dish. The pasta seemed dry.The skirt steak was the best. The cocktail list comprise mostly of vodka based drinks. I definitely recommend a try.

The pasta seemed dry.The skirt steak was the best. I definitely recommend a try

reviews: Very mediocre.  For the prices they are charging I expected much better.  We started off with their specialty cocktails.  I found mine to be a mismatch of flavors which sounded good on paper but wasn't good in execution.  It was supposed to be a mix of mescal, muddled cucumber, ginger and jalapeño. All I could taste was the cucumber. We then had the crostini. They were relatively good. But one was literally a paltry shmear of goat cheese with a presumably jarred roasted red pepper on top. As for entrees my wife liked her crisp gnocchi. I had the Bronzino which violated my cardinal rule of "don't order fish at a place that doesn't specialize in fish".  Low and behold I got a piece of fish that managed to be wildly underdone in some spots while wildly overdone in others. Far more disturbing was the lack of salt and general low tide fishy smell that came from the dish.  Deserts were a high point of the meal but still not amazing. Many of the other reviews complain about service issues.  I found the service to be friendly and attentive yet suffering from timing issues. We made it clear that we intended to order a bottle of wine with dinner. However they didn't get us the wine list until we were basically done with our meal.  We were glad we didn't get a bottle of wine but from a business point of view they lost out on a good sale due to timing issues.Ultimately at the price point they are asking there are FAR better places to eat than this without spending more money.  If the entrees were priced in the 12-15 dollar range I would give them another star or two.

Low and behold I got a piece of fish that managed to be wildly underdone in some spots while wildly overdone in others Far more disturbing was the lack of salt and general low tide fishy smell that came from the dish. Deserts were a high point of the meal but still not amazing. If the entrees were priced in the 12-15 dollar range I would give them another star or two.

reviews: Only came for brunch but eggs benedict was well done.  The wife had nutella stuffed French toast which was also pleasantly tasty and not overly sweet.  Would go back for sure.
extracted: Only came for brunch but eggs benedict was well done Would go back for sure

reviews: Yummy! Their brunch (polenta and artichoke ravioli!) and drinks are especially yummy. Good options for vegetarians here. Romantic atmosphere. You may have to wait a while for your food though, so plan ahead and go before you're super starving.
extracted: Yum and drinks are especially yummy. Good options for vegetarians here You may have to wait a while for your food though, so plan ahead and go before you're super starving.

reviews: Great modern Italian restaurant - the inside decor and seating is simple but sophisticated. I love the use of natural light from the floor-to-ceiling windows. As for the food, everything was bursting with incredible combinations of flavours, and although portion sizes were small, (average for modern restaurants), I left enormously satisfied and will definitely come back. The service was friendly and helpful.
extracted: As for the food, everything was bursting with incredible combinations of flavours, and although portion sizes were small, (average for modern restaurants), I left enormously satisfied and will definitely come back.

reviews: This place is a gem on an unassuming street in Astoria. But, that's the great thing about Astoria, there are so many random little places that are just waiting to be found. The Locale staff is so friendly and warm, they're good with each other and good with the clientele as well. The brunch was good-- The waffles were crisp on the outside and fluffy on the inside, and there was the right amount of bananas and walnuts to top it off. My girlfriend's avocado and tomato benedict was delicious also-- I love how they have super vegetarian friendly, and many, versions of the benedict. There was a tad bit too much tabasco in my bloody mary, but that's not really a deal-breaker. For dinner, my friends and I just hung out for an hour nursing some Chardonnay, while waiting for my roommate to finish dying her hair. The one thing that irked me about this place was that they didn't put our bottle of white wine in an ice-bucket? Do they normally not put it on ice or was that because we looked brutish and like it didn't matter? The food, though, was good. I really appreciated how un-salty everything was, from the fried zucchini, to the portobello salad, to the artichoke ravioli...

The brunch was good-- The waffles were crisp on the outside and fluffy on the inside, and there was the right amount of bananas and walnuts to top it off. My girlfriend's avocado and tomato benedict was delicious also-- I love how they have super vegetarian friendly, and many, versions of the benedict.

reviews: I came here on Saturday for brunch with three friends.  I ordered the California eggs Benedict (with avocado and tomatoes), my one friend got waffles and the other two got something with eggs.  We all loved the food and the drinks (mango mimosa was amazing).  The Locale had lots of variety and it took us a while to decide so I'm definitely looking forward to coming back and trying something new.The atmosphere at Locale was probably the best thing about this place.  It was beautiful outside that day so I was bummed to be sitting inside, but the place was so wide open that I felt like we were sitting outside the whole time.  The decor is also really cute - there are couches in the corner that I sat in a couple of months ago for another brunch.The service was great - the man who greeted us at the door (I assume he was the owner) was really sweet and our waitress was also great, very attentive.  We ordered dessert at the end (vanilla creme brulee, banana caramel napoleon and gelato) and were all very satisfied.  We even got dessert wine on the house at the end!Overall, a great experience - I will definitely come back.

We even got dessert wine on the house at the end!Overall, a great experience - I will definitely come back.

reviews: My very first brunch spot in Astoria! Delicious mushroom benedict, friendly staff, and chill ambiance. Def returning back on a hot summer weekend afternoon :)
extracted: Delicious My very first brunch spot in Astoria!

reviews: After reading all the great reviews about this place, my friends and I decided to give it a try for one of my friends birthday. Let me start off by saying, the place looks cute. And I am a sucker for cute places. The staff seemed decent. It was our waitress' first day on the job, so we understood why she was a bit awkward.We ordered the Chardonnay and the Lolita for drinks. The Lolita was pretty good. Next we ordered the braise meatballs and the regular salad as our appetizers. The braised meatballs were pretty good and the salad was well, a salad. For our entrees we ordered the Paparedella, Short rib Rissoto, Organic Chicken and the Rigotoni, All of the pasta dishes were very heavy. The Paparedella was OK, the short rib rissoto was good at first, but after a while you get bored of the taste, the Rigotoni was quite hard and was not worth it and the organic chicken was so dry. It is pretty hard to mess up a simple chicken dish, but Locale sure did. For dessert we got the chocolate cake and it was good.Overall it is an OK restaurant. The prices are pretty good for a cute place, but the food is not worth it. Most of the reviews seem to be for brunch and maybe I'll try their brunch and see how that goes.

reviews: Really great place in Astoria. I have not yet been there for Brunch but my husband and I go often for dinner and its always delicious food and great service. There menu recently changed but many new favorites.

reviews: A beautiful little spot on an unassuming street in Astoria. A nice location great for the locals and any visitors from "out of town." The food is delicious and consistent. There's not really unique or special or "must order" about their menu. It's just good! The atmosphere and staff is friendly and unobtrusive. I'll definitely be going back if I ever find myself stranded in Astoria and at a loss for where to go. But with all the other options in the area, I may try something else...

reviews: I've enjoyed myself every time I've come to Locale. The restaurant is attractive, service has always been great, and the food is tasty. I've had brunch, dinner, and cocktails at the bar and all of it has been good. What I really like about Locale is their fairly extensive list of daily specials. We had an amazing lemon-garlic shrimp appetizer special one night that had us both raving. Locale is one of my go-to's in the neighborhood when I want simple, yet elegant fare.
extracted: enjoy The restaurant is attractive, service has always been great, and the food is tasty. What I really like about Locale is their fairly extensive list of daily specials.

reviews: Sidewalk seating, great! Sangria, yum! Brunch, 'eh'...Let me start by saying there is a woman who lives nearby who drags her dog on a skateboard back and forth in front of the restaurant while you're eating. If that's not entertainment, I don't know what is.The service was okay, a little distant but efficient. The drinks were good. The food though, I dunno. I ordered the Eggs Benedict and I feel like it was just kind of missing some energy. It could have been hotter and the English muffin didn't have much crispiness to it. Believe me, you'll see the words Cheddar Polenta on the sides and you will think, "omg, I must have that.". But do not be misled, it is not good. I wish it were and wish I  could praise its deliciousness but it really was just a bowl of orange colored cornmeal with some cheese melted on top. So disappointed.Maybe I should have ordered something different, but with so many other brunch options nearby, I don't think I'll give them a second chance.  If you check in with the Yelp app, you get 10% off the bill! And attitude from the server you show said discount to. Lame.

reviews: Living nearby, I've been to Locale many times for brunch. The brunch menu is a great combo of breakfast and lunch fare, and I have always found the service to be quick and friendly but never rushed. But of course, there is an exception to every rule, and I have recently found myself less inclined to visit Locale. Recently I went with my boyfriend and his mom, and it was a bit crowded. The hostess told us to take a seat at the bar for coffee and drinks and we would be seated at a table as soon as it was available - perfect! However, once we sat down and had our coffee poured, we were forgotten. Parties that came in after us were seated, even though we said we did not want to stay at the bar. When we approached the hostess, it was obvious that she had forgotten to re-seat us.And the last time I tried to brunch here, I made reservations for 2pm on Saturday, as my mom was visiting from out of town. At 11:30am THAT MORNING, I received a call that they needed to cancel my reservation. A large party had bought out the entire restaurant. Yes, they were apologetic, but come on - I find it hard to believe that they found out less than 3 hours ahead of time.So, hit or miss on service/reservations, but I always enjoy my meal! And relatively cheap to boot!

The hostess told us to take a seat at the bar for coffee and drinks and we would be seated at a table as soon as it was available - perfect! And relatively cheap to boot

reviews: I've lived in Astoria for 6 years now and this is by and far my favorite restaurant in the area.  Their pasta dishes and fish specials are always fantastic.  I don't eat meat aside from fish, but my wife had the roasted chicken dish the last time we were there and was floored with the quality.The wait staff has always been very friendly and the bar is fully stocked and the bar tenders know what they're doing.I saw some negative posts about the owner, which I can't speak to, but I will say that every interaction I've had with him has been very positive.  He has always come over to make sure we were enjoying our meal.

reviews: Came here on a Friday night w/ the BF. We were looking to stay local and have a nice dinner with out out having to drive or take the subway back into the city. After reading many reviews, I decided on Locale. Used my opentable account here, which is a huge plus because I like planning ahead and racking up points. The place itself it pretty small and easy to miss, we actually walked right by it. There are like 5-6 dinner tables inside, a full bar, a back lounge area with couches and some tables, and also outside seating.  We sat inside near the window. Very comfy.Had a few drinks, my Dirty Kettle One Martini was made perfectly..Thank you. For my Entree, I had the Black Linguini- with squid ink, sausages, calamari and other goodness. Absolutely delicious. I killed the entire plate. I would definitely come back here just for this carb overload. The BF had the pappardelle & lamb ragu...which he wasn't crazy about. I think it was the whipped goat cheese that came on top that made it taste kinda funky. They should put the whipped goat cheese off to the side, where you have the option of mixing it in. Just a suggestion.Of course I had a sweet tooth at the end of my amazing and very filling linguini dish, so we shared the Flourless Dark Chocolate Cake w/ Espresso Gelato on top. Drool. I have nothing more to say about that. Divine.Dinner here wasn't cheap, the prices are moderate..slightly  expensive...more expensive than most  places in the  neighborhood. I  will definitely be back and would like to try brunch. Perfect place for a date or with friends for a classy simple dinner without traveling out of Astoria.
