reviews: My girlfriend and I went the first time for brunch which was nice so we came back yesterday for dinner and how disappointing!!we ordered 2 cocktails and some crostini before the appetizers ,the cocktails were very small (12$each) and we did not finish yet the crostini that they bring the appetizers on the very small table makes you feel uncomfortable and a little bit in a hurry.the portion were smaller than expected at the end it s too much expansive for the service and the cuisine provided

Again, a dinner that was shockingly good, and a great value!  Appetizer of softshell crab came with 2 of the delectable crustaceans and an all day happy hour is reason enough to stay for a full dinner. #bestculinaryreinvention2015

The new menu  is not as interesting as the old one. More importantly, the food was just plain lousy: mussels fra diavolo cold, and the lasagna Bolognese both burnt and needed a ton of salt. I've never been disappointed before here...but this meal stunk. Not sure I'm coming back.

Don't eat here. Just don't. My wife and I came in on a Friday night to a half-empty house. Initially the service was good. Our waiter, identified on the check as Robert, was fairly knowledgable about Italian food and wine. He made a solid wine recommendation for pairing with the food I ordered, and was fairly  attentive, although he seemed inordinately harried for a less-than-crowded restaurant. The food, when it arrived, was okay. The portion of fried calamari my wife and I shared was generous, but slightly underseasoned. In addition to the standard marinara sauce and lemon wedge, the plate was topped with a fried long green pepper, whose spiciness paired well with the lightly battered squid. The entrees, though, were less than impressive. My wife's gemelli aqua pazza with shrimp had way too few shrimp--I understand that shrimp is both singular and plural, but still--and had no fennel and little tomato broth, two key ingredients in an aqua pazza dish. I ordered the polenta bolognese with a fried egg. Unfortunately, the egg was the best part. The ragu bolognese was dry, and the polenta was incredibly underseasoned and lacking in richness. Polenta, even when made with water or broth, should be generously finished with butter and cheese for flavor, body and mouthfeel. This was just flat. Still, I understand that I'm eating in Astoria, and I can't expect too much from the restaurants here. So I  would have given Gastroteca at least one more star, had it not been for the miserably poor service we experienced after our entree plates had been cleared. Our waiter brought us dessert menus promptly, took our dessert and digestif order (chocolate cake and a glass of port), and then vanished. The rest of the floor staff in a by now empty restaurant were congregating by the bar, chatting with each other, ignoring us completely. Eventually, the manager wandered over to let us know that our dessert would be coming out soon. It didn't. When it finally arrived, the vanilla ice cream that was supposed to be on the plate had been accidentally replaced by apricot sorbet. By the time we were able to flag down a server to get the mistake corrected, the sorbet was half melted. Instead of removing and replacing the dessert, they just dropped off a side dish of the correct ice cream without an apology. Again, it took forever to get the check, and I was surprised to find the botched dessert on my bill. I asked to speak to the manager, and when I pointed out the problem, he interrupted me with, "Okay okay okay! I'll take care of it!" He took the dessert off the bill without an apology, I paid the bill, and my wife and I left. My wife and I have a combined two decades of experience in the restaurant industry, her in the front of house, and me as a cook and chef. So we're both pretty generous when it comes to mistakes in restaurants. But the general ineptitude of the service and inability to make up for it on a slow night is absolutely inexcusable. If you can't be good at your job, you should at least be kind. Gastroteca's service was neither. Don't eat here. Just don't.

reviews: I went here for brunch and was really expecting great things bc the decor was so nice and the food looked so good. I ordered a coffee and the french toast and my boyfriend had a burger. The food was great until we each found hair in our food!! Explained it to our server and she was very sorry but still, there was hair in each of our meals. Never coming back here again.

reviews: Love this place! Favorite brunch spot--have been here several times and love the food. I've also been here for birthdays and they are great at accommodating a large group. Great service and friendly staff. You can't go wrong with any of the eggs Benedicts--the food here is AMAZING!!

reviews: Went for Queens Restaurant Week menu. The service and ambiance were lovely and the reviews from Yelp so positive that the meal itself was a let-down for me. The zucchini fries appetizer was enjoyable, I enjoyed the unique presentation of the vegetable. The main dish, however, a lemon chicken, left much to be desired. The chicken was dry, not lemony, and had very little sauce to accompany it. The highlight of the meal was the dessert - both the lemon pana cotta and chocolate mousse were flavorful and delicious. I may come back to try the pastas off their regular menu and some more dessert but with all the great restaurants to visit in Astoria it won't be anytime soon.

Ambience is great but kitchen inconsistency is unfortunate.  I had the special pasta with lemon zest, garlic, and cured mullet roe. No roe to be found and very spicy even for someone who enjoys spicy food (was not mentioned in the description).

reviews: This place is absolutely stunning. I always passed by it but it looked like any other cafe. Little did I know, Locale knocked my socks off. My boyfriend had the calamari and pasta and I had the polenta with chicken. His pasta was delicious and everything was HOT (temperature) which was a great! My chicken was a little salty and it could've used another component but overall I did enjoy it. Okay, so lets talk about the drinks now. My boyfriend had a coffee, very good nothing spectacular. On the other hand, I indulged a delicious Antioxitini, BEST DRINK EVERRR!!!

reviews: I don't frequent Locale as often as I'd like. In fact, the last time I went there this last weekend it was so epic, I had to write this review. First off...it was during the hour they were crossing over to dinner food. (for which they close the kitchen for one hour)....so, we got there just in time to have breakfast and lunch on the brunch menu. We were preparing for Hurricane Irene and perhaps our last meal(s) out.  We were gonna try to wait it out to eat dinner but that just got to be too much;)I don't remember what I ordered, it must have been penne la vodka which was very good. But, everything is hazy before  trying my friends Belguim waffles with almond whip cream. (heavenly music and rays of light beaming through the parting clouds). It was A-MAZING! I finally found my fav brunch spot in Astoria. I usually like eating salty foods for brunch. However, I will say that even in the midst of trying to stick to a low-carb diet, this is one sinful pleasure I cannot pass by. I will be back for you!

reviews: Loved loved loved this place!!  Chef made a mistake with my order but it was fixed in seconds and it was delicious.. Portion sizes are spot on!  Cant wait to go back here and take more friends!

reviews: It has been several days since the usual horror that is parking in Astoria guided me into Locale. I must say for once in my life I can thank the nightmarishly scarce parking condition for helping me find this Astoria gem.If you were to only try one thing at Locale it would have to be the Crispy Zucchini. Days later the heavenly taste of these lightly fried wonders still linger on my taste buds. I enjoyed one of the evening specials, Chicken Rolatini, while my friend savored the Pappardelle & Lamb Ragu. After one bite of her entree I was trying to think of ways to overtake her meal and have it as my own.With a tastefully appointed interior, a well stocked bar and some outdoor seating Locale provides a great spot for a workday lunch, Sunday brunch or an intimate date night.

reviews: This place is GREAT!!!We had a bridal shower for one of my very close friends this past Saturday and everything was just wonderful. The staff was very friendly, helpful and accommodating. The decor is just so pretty and elegant. Loved the open and airy feeling of the windows.We had a prix-fixe menu and everything tasted sooo good!Overall, the bridal shower came out great and it was an amazing experience.Thanks to everyone at Locale!

reviews: I wish I had discovered this place sooner! I stopped here the other night with a friend and enjoyed the nice weather in their outdoor seating. The food was phenomenal! I highly recommend the lamb ragu. Just thinking about the fresh pasta, lamb ragu, and cheese makes my mouth water. The crispy zucchini is addictive. I could probably live on the crispy zucchini for months. The food is fresh and hormone free. Not to sound cliché, but I could taste the freshness with every bite.The interior is beautifully decorated. It's modern with a rustic twist. Service was friendly and attentive. Our waitress gave good recommendations on what to order. This is a great date spot and a good spot for a night out with a few friends. I enjoyed lingering and just chatting here. I shall return.

The food is fresh and hormone free. Not to sound cliché, but I could taste the freshness with every bite.The interior is beautifully decorated. Our waitress gave good recommendations on what to order.

reviews: **OVERALL**  Ambiance is casual and quiet most nights.  Food has always been hot, flavorful, and creative enough to warrant the price.  Specials are worth trying.  Clean, simple, inviting.  Brunch is great too.--THE STORY--  I have been here and back a couple of times.  Some for brunch, 1 lunch, and the rest dinners.  I have never had a bad experience and I have had different servers each time.  Never felt that I had to flag down anyone since out table was visited numerous times and sometimes by more than just our server.  Very attentive in my opinion.  The food has been moderate to great.  It was always just as advertised and the last visit, we ordered apps, entree, and desserts off the specials menu.  Some of the best bistro style food I've had in Astoria.  You will probably have to ask for descriptions of the drinks at brunch since they just have a name, but so far, all the drinks we tried were better then good.    Atmosphere was calm, relatively quiet, and simple.  Nothing flashy.    Prices were normal for a nice night out, but not steak house prices.  Drinks were about the same and most local restaurants.    Don't forget to check-in using your phone's Yelp app to get a discount on your bill.  Always a nice perk.

Prices were normal for a nice night out, but not steak house prices. Drinks were about the same and most local restaurants. Always a nice perk

But i didn't like the food...I ordered crabcake as a appetizer, nothing outstanding and also it was very spicy for me. Then I tried the tiramisu, but I was disappointed, I didn't like the taste.Although my friend tried other dishes and she liked everything....so its really very individual. I want to give one more try, I want to go  there for a brunch, I heard its good, so lets see...)

reviews: Went to Locale tonight on a whim after visiting the Museum of the Moving Image. It was quiet for a Saturday night, we sat at the bar and had a delicious peppermint hot chocolate, papardelle lamb ragu and pistachio-crusted fried cod. Locale has a great decor and the bartender was so helpful. Only qualm: though it was convenient for today, it's kind of a hike from Manhattan.

reviews: I went to Locale with a friend on a Saturday night and we had a rather enjoyable experience. First the staff was absolutely awesome: helpful, friendly with a sense of humor. For drinks, we ordered a bottle of Nero D'Avola (mi favorito!) and it did not disappoint.  For our main courses,  I ordered the special: grilled swordfish with asparagus on a thin bed of mashed potatoes. It was very tasty and the portion was just right. My friend ordered the pasta bolognese and really liked it. Finally, we decided to indulge in a dessert so we shared a chocolate bread pudding, topped with glazed bananas and served with vanilla ice cream.AMAZING. It was warm, not too sweet and  you could feel the quality of the ingredients, my taste buds were in heaven!!Overall great staff, delicious food and casual yet trendy ambiance. I will definitely go back.

I will definitely go back. will definitely go back

reviews: Came here for Easter and it was the best Easter brunch! I was a little late and they still accommodated my party of 4 perfectly. My mom and I go out to brunch a lot and she said this was the best place I ever taken her. We all loved the food, the service, and the atmosphere. Even the drinks! Omg delish! I cannot wait to go back. Thank you Locale!
extracted: Even the drinks I cannot wait to go back. Thank you Locale

reviews: This is my third review of Locale and comes after working with the owner of this Astoria hotspot, Johnny, to throw a surprise engagement party for two of my best friends.  With  that said (and after eating here 15+ times), I highly recommend it for a special occasion.  First, it took about a week to finally talk to the right person (the owner).  This included multiple calls and physically going to the restaurant twice.  The deal was 18 people, it needed to be a surprise, and we had a budget of $15 per person (this included food, gratuity, but no drinks).  Originally I figured I would order an assortment of appetizers to stay within budget and have them brought out in increments.  Johnny offered to do menu items that weren't on the menu and were also much more fitting to the occasion (and within my budget).  Locale allowed us to reserve the entire back area (space for 20, comfortable benches, small tables, and set higher than the main seating area).  They also assigned us our own server who took everyone's individual drink orders.  He was great.  Helpful, quick, professional, not in our business too much.  One time he did bring me a second of a drink without me ordering it.  I'm not a fan of this move (I'm sure it's great in some circumstances).  The food was great and impressed everyone (most importantly the bride and groom).  Beef sliders (aged angus), stuffed mushrooms (vegetarian) and bruschetta.  The sliders stole the show and were perfect two-bite (for some, three) morsels of beef, cheese, brioche and teeny crunchy pickle.  The atmosphere was perfect.  The service was also top-notch.  The drinks, as always, top notch.  I used to think poorly of that fact that they don't have a tap, but with the chancing selection of specialty bottled beers, I'm a happy man.  Blue Moon is $5 or you can spring for a *perfect* $10 passion martini. Again, five stars to Locale.  I highly recommend this Astoria hotspot in general, but also for a special occasion.
extracted: I highly recommend it Originally I figured I would order an assortment of appetizers to stay within budget and have them brought out in increments. The food was great and impressed everyone (most importantly the bride and groom). The sliders stole the show and were perfect two-bite (for some, three) morsels of beef, cheese, brioche and teeny crunchy pickle. The atmosphere was perfect. The service was also top-notch. Blue Moon is $5 or you can spring for a *perfect* $10 passion martini.

reviews: The food was delicious. Eggs Benedict is a must. The vibe of the restaurant is nonchalant and chill. There is always a line for brunch on Sunday so be aware of a wait. The food came out really late. Or maybe it seemed longer than usual since we were starving. Basically, go if you're in the area but not worth a trip out to Astoria.

Our waiter seemed pretty stressed out, forgot our app, and the entrees took over 45 minutes. Food was OK, nothing to write home about. Not sure if the chef is Italian or not, but definitely better Italian in Astoria. Servings are small too.

reviews: Anything you order is amazing!black linguine is amazing! the portions are just right and the service is out of this world!!

Very nice place for dinner. We had a lovely evening last night at Locale. The ambiance is great, and the friendly staff really adds to a relaxed atmosphere. We had the mussels, which were fresh and delicious, and the pasta Amitriciana. The pasta was perfectly prepared in a smoky, spicy sauce. For mains we ordered the crispy branzino and the Tuscan sirloin. The branzino dish was flavorful and cooked to perfection. The sirloin however was a little tough, and under seasoned. The specially cocktails are a nice touch, but both were incredibly sweet. Overall, we had a great time, and a nice meal.

reviews: The shrimp were great.Bruschetta Trio need something more.The salad was just ok.Good service and friendly staff.Steak, eh, it was ok. Maybe I should have ordered dessert.I really wanted to like this place, it's quite nice and beautiful. I'd like to try their brunch menu.

reviews: Solid experience. Food was pretty good- good taste (pesto with lamb sausage was stellar), served at the right temperature, with a decent beverage list.  Prices were reasonable and inline with portion sizes.  Very laid back atmosphere which was nice.  Great place to dine al fresco (or all'aperto for you purists).  Would definitely come back.
extracted: Food was pretty good- good taste (pesto with lamb sausage was stellar), served at the right temperature, with a decent beverage list. Prices were reasonable and inline with portion sizes. Would definitely come back

reviews: What the flub?!  This place rocks.  I never ventured onto this part off of Broadway unless I'm looking for parking.My Astoria Food Junkie, God Bless her soul, dragged my hungry, tired body here and it was nice.  Located on a nice corner, we opted to sit outside to dine w/nature.  Sangria is their top drink, but unfortunately we came from boozing in the city, so I couldn't bear more alcohol intake.  This appetizer special: a scallop salad.  The scallop was a little sweet and had a wonderful texture.Since I wasn't that hungry, I ordered the grilled portabello with pistachios and parmesan on arugula.  The porta was juicy and marinated in what I think is a balsamic vinegar sauce.  Plate clean!Always leave room for dessert.  Especially here.  We had the tiramisu and it was heavenly.  I think my eyes rolled so far back in my head i had to ask for assistance to whack them back to the correct position.  The Strawberry Neopolitan was a surprise delight to w/it's philo and creme goodness.  HEA-VEN!!Great date night location or just an all around food enjoying spot.

reviews: Came back for dinner and have to give props to the cornish hen...so juicy and delish.  yummo! The blood orange and passion martini's were also good with just enough kick.Bartenders and waiters were very friendly and checked in at the right moments.

reviews: The food was Fantastic, tasty, and all around worth every cent! Only reason this place gets a 4 from me is the time it took to be seated. We were showed where our table is and that it needed to be cleaned. Still took about several minutes to be seated after it was cleaned. That's minor, but a bit annoying. Then our food took a while to come and that added to my annoyance. Everything was great after the food arrived. I would definitely go back for brunch, but perhaps on a weekday instead of weekend.

reviews: After walking by Locale dozens of times, I stopped in for a late dinner. I think it's more of a brunch spot. The decor is lovely. It's modern, but elegant. The service was also very good. The waitress was friendly and checked in on us a few times, but without being annoying or overbearing. However, there was 90s music blaring the entire time. it distracted from the ambiance. The food wasn't really good. We started out with a cheese plate. I though the selections were odd. There was a spicy and rock hard asiago, a truffle fontina, and a some type of blue. They didn't match up with one another very well  and the bread they served with it was slightly burnt. I ordered the chicken with roasted veggies and we also had the artichoke ravioli, which was drowning in a bland cream sauce. The chicken was a little dry, but it was edible. It came with a carrot puree that was good.The menu could have been a bit more innovative. Maybe had more seasonal choices. Not sure if the brunch menu is better, but I don't think I'd go back for dinner.

reviews: Finding organic, delicious, and truly fulfilling restaurants in Astoria is hard. But, finding Locale has been a truly REFRESHING experience for me and my partner. To start, the service here is friendly, attentive, and focused on the menu. The feeling of this place is relaxed and extremely enjoyable. I recommend starting with the mussels and meatballs as an APP. The sauce and quality of the mussels are truly delicious, as is all of the food. Our Entree favorites are typically found in the 'specials' which the wait staff will happily and naturally describe to you during your stay. On the regular menu, try the short ribs or salmon...yummy!! Lastly, for drinks during your meal DEFINITELY try the Writers Block or The Cider... Seriously amazing!! A GREAT place in Astoria... A MUST try for all!!!

reviews: We went for brunch, and were blown away by their menu. Every item sounded appetizing, from cheese polenta to the poached eggs with avocado and tomato. I decided on the eggs Benedict with portobello and arugula. It was delicious, but the hollandaise was a bit sharp. The rosemary potatoes were to die for and the coffee was solid. Hubby had the hanger steak with fries, cooked to perfection. Portions were average and we were too full for dessert. The dark wood tables, and the couches facing vintage brocade wall paper along the back wall looked chic. This place has a hipster vibe and service is breezy and cool, to be expected. Will definitely be back.

Great music playing, impressive menu, and to think that you can resist passing up the delicious desserts here is a joke! I had such a phenomenal experience at Locale I could not just keep it to myself. Even my boyfriend, who is VERY picky with his restaurants, was terribly impressed by this place!!!

reviews: We absolutely LOVE locale - It's one of our favorite restaurant in Astoria. Perfect for Brunch and Dinner.  The wait staff is very attentive, the decor is stunning, and the food is fabulous. Although we have not tried everything yet, our favorite dishes are: 1)  The Fagotini beet pasta - I'm a huge pasta fan, and this dish was so unique and delicious 2) Veal Scallopini - perfectly done with tasty greens on the side. 3) The artichoke truffle Ravioli - Again, so unique and such a creative and perfect mix of flavors. The ingredients are always fresh, and the atmosphere is perfect for a date or a night out with some friends.

reviews: I was looking for an organic restaurant to go with my boyfriend on Friday night and Locale exceeded my expectations! I was very impressed with the service and the food was ABSOLUTELY AMAZING! I had the "Tropical Salad" and the cod special, I cannot stop talking about how delicious and healthy both dishes were. My boyfriend ate every last bite of the hanger steak special and wanted more. The antioxitini drink is refreshing and perfect for a hot summer night. Not only was the food great, but the atmosphere was beautiful and very now! The restaurant is not very big which I love. It is warm and welcoming with a rustic chic decor. The owner stopped by our table to ask how everything was. We got to talking and he was so kind and down to earth he ended up treating us to a drink at the bar. LOVE LOVE LOVE LOCALE and I cannot wait to go back!

reviews: Came down here on a nice mid-week evening during restaurant week w/my eatin' buddy. I parked myself and my journal at the bar earlier than our reservation. Even tho the place was kinda quiet for 7p, there were a few tables and a couple other seats at the bar taken. Once my buddy arrived, we moved ourselves and our beers to the table.I did the restaurant week menu special and he did the regular menu. We both had steak. Mine was way yummier. As were my sides. And my dessert. We sampled each others and both agreed mine was the winner, although his was also very good. Fries were WAY salty though(for both of us.) Hope those restaurant week items are now regularly on the menu. Servers were nice and smiley and bus boy service was sharp.After we stuffed our faces, we returned to the bar for a round of drinks. Their signature cocktail the "Lolita" was mighty tasty. My bud had some dirty martinis (if I recall) and he had no complaints. Bartender was super sweet.

reviews: I took my girlfriend to this restaurant because I drive by it everyday I'm at work. It looks quaint and I was right. The decor and ambience was welcoming with various types of seating depending on how you want to dine- bar, couches, tables, and bench seating. My girlfriend's passion fruit martini was tasty and strong. I ordered the locale burger which was ginormous! And my girlfriend chose the hanger steak over the duck. I loved my burger and she liked the steak though it was charred outside and rare but still good. Service was friendly.
extracted: My girlfriend's passion fruit martini was tasty and strong.

reviews: It was the first real Spring night of the season and my boyfriend and I decided we wanted to eat outside. We'd been to Locale for a drink before and figured, why not try it out again!We were glad we did. I got the Skirt Steak Special which was served over oven roasted potatoes and spinach which a very good reduction over it. My boyfriend had the Pepperdelle and Lamb Ragu which was equally as tasty. He didn't have any leftovers for lunch the next day :) We paired our entrees with a Montepulciano and it was a great fit! The friendly professional waitstaff and great food may have made Locale a new neighborhood spot for us!

I'll def be coming back, hopefully their other dishes are good as well!

If it gets too chilly outside you can move right into their lounge. The gnocchi is supberb! I actually came here last night with my cousin and he ordered the Organic Lemon chicken which i tasted and i had the Mahi Mahi which was a little over cooked but i still ate the whole thing. Their cheese plates are yummy. Their grilled calamari is delicious, we always have 2 orders of it. reviews: The owner here is bad. Not only are his people skills ridiculous and he seems to enjoy treating this restaurant as a personal buffet for his family more than a 4 star. I saw him manhandle his waitress to make sure his son had plenty of organic juice, while the waitress was clearly swamped and in the weeds, we had been waiting 50 minutes for our order of fish, and this guy's kid gets three servings of juice as soon as his glass is empty. (Meanwhile, the guy eating at the bar's had an empty glass as long as I could stare at it!) Then after I had one complaint he had to get involved, and the man actually came over to argue with me. Told me if I didn't want mushrooms with my order that I should've ordered it that way - which I didn't! Then he switched gears and told me I should've ordered something without mushrooms if I hate them so much.  (Fine point! But coming from a restaurant background I know that's the worst way to handle a customer.)Now I've been going to the locale for a couple years, and service was fine way back when, but even since the new lady's taken over the bar staff's been making more mistakes/arguing with each other/underpouring customers. (noticed that two visits ago.) That's not a big deal since table service is still alright - especially during brunch - but if you want good Italian especially during peak hours, I'd suggest going a little deeper into queens. Even woodhaven has a couple very nicer, more private spots for the same price with better service.

Fine point noticed that two visits ago That's not a big deal since table service is still alright - especially during brunch - but if you want good Italian especially during peak hours, I'd suggest going a little deeper into queens. Even woodhaven has a couple very nicer, more private spots for the same price with better service.

reviews: Yes,  I am definitely a fan of Locale. I recently discovered this place and when there for brunch with some friends. The decor is hip and unique and it seems to draw in a sophisticated crowd, even for brunch on Sunday when most are hungover. The service was good- the waiter was very friendly and attentive. The food was DELISH- we ordered the nutella french toast for the table and it was devoured in seconds. Prices were fine for typical Astoria brunch and the decor and ambiance of the place was a pleasant surprise.I havent been there in the evening yet but will surely try it out soon. And I will be back for a few more meals- everyone was more than satisfied with their meals.

Prices were fine for typical Astoria brunch and the decor and ambiance of the place was a pleasant surprise.I havent been there in the evening yet but will surely try it out soon. And I will be back for a few more meals- everyone was more than satisfied with their meals.

reviews: My sister and I took my mom here for a Saturday birthday brunch. Made a 2pm reservation via Open Table before the restaurant opened - but we weren't seated until almost 2:30pm because "other customers were lingering." I get not wanting to kick people out, but then block off a table an hour early when you have a reservation. (You don't ask an 80-year-old woman to have a drink at the bar.) The food however was amazing and once we were seated at our table we had a lovely time. I had the Belgian waffle with bananas and walnuts and a side of applewood-smoked bacon, my sister had the classic eggs Benedict, and my mom had the eggplant and burrata sandwich with fries. We all loved our food and shared. We got coffee and one chocolate gelato and one vanilla creme brulee for dessert to share. These were great though the creme brulee was a little too luke warm and runny. My sister had pinot grigio and I had 2 bloody marys which were delicious - just the right amount of spice and alcohol. Their brunch menu is all a la carte however and does not include sides or drinks. the decor is cute and I like how they project movies on the wall behind the bar. It is also not so loud that you can't hear the conversation at your own table - I hate that but here we had no problem at all. It was a lovely time and all was delicious and I will go there again - just not until I have a whole afternoon or evening to blow because the service is so slow as well as the wait, even with a reservation.

It is also not so loud that you can't hear the conversation at your own table - I hate that but here we had no problem at all. It was a lovely time and all was delicious and I will go there again - just not until I have a whole afternoon or evening to blow because the service is so slow as well as the wait, even with a reservation.

reviews: Was going through my checked-in places on yelp.. and saw Locale. For the life of me, I could NOT remember what place this was! And I was just there 5 days ago!Then it finally hit me. Sunday brunch!! I think that says a lot about this place..Now for the actual review..Service is REALLY REALLY REALLY slow. I believe we waited about an hour for the food to come out. Now the food is pretty good. But it shouldn't have taken that long to prepare! I had the southern omelet. The eggs were so light and fluffy. I love that. The bf had the burger.. very juicy. Another ordered the gnocchi and the 4th ordered the portebello benedict. All were very good. After eating, we forgot how bad the service was because our food was so good so we decided to have dessert there. Another 20-30min passed before our desserts finally came. Bf and I shared the tiramisu. YUMMY!! The other couple shared the warm apple cobbler. That was disappointing.This place is definitely a one time try.. and I'm glad I got to try it once. But never again.

The eggs were so light and fluffy. All were very good. After eating, we forgot how bad the service was because our food was so good so we decided to have dessert there. But never again

reviews: On my way to see Cowboys And Aliens, so I decided to stop by Locale for a meal. The hostess asked if I wanted to sit inside or out, and given the sour smell of the interior [not always the case] I opted for the outside. I wasn't given the specials, just a menu shoved on my table. I know there were specials, because another waiter recited them to a couple sitting in his station after I had already ordered. The waitress did the same to a group sitting next to me. So 25 minutes later I get the hen, which was forgettable, plain, bland. I've had more excitement proctoring the State Regents Exam. The meal was a solid "C". Although I really just wanted to get the experience over with, I ordered the creme brulee as a last ditch effort to like this place. It was like getting a scoop of your favorite ice creme to make up for a day at the amusement park being rained out.
extracted: The waitress did the same to a group sitting next to me. I've had more excitement proctoring the State Regents Exam. The meal was a solid "C".

reviews: After a good friend's reco, we came here for brunch, and we really got what we expected, because my friend knows what she's talking about.  The menu is incredible, I had the hardest time choosing what i wanted and finally decided on the cheddar polenta, which for an eastern-european girl like me, was heaven.  my husband had the omelet, which didn't disappoint, and the freddy krugers are just extra spicy bloody mary's, right up our alley.  Can't wait to go back, and dying to try the dinner menu, the only shortcoming was the service.

reviews: Came back for brunch and had their quesadilla which was Ok. In the past I had the the popular belgian waffles. Service was pretty good, we got our orders relatively quick. Location is good, always easy to find street parking.
extracted: Service was pretty good, we got our orders relatively quick. Location is good, always easy to find street parking.

reviews: Very confused.I was told this was an okay place. My fiancee and I, whom are both quite familiar with the neighborhood as well as  picky/ knowledgeable patrons at that. We decided to give it a go. Upon arrival the atmosphere was cute, a little "hipster esque" we ordered a bottle of their mid-range champagne and opened menu. After learning three menue options were no longer available at 8:00 pm, we settled and ordered. After great conversation and one hour  out-came our plates. Mine being Hanger steak, a dish on special as well as regular menu were ice cold. My fiancee had some type of lamb ragu.I must say  that I have never in my life seen him complain to a waiter about food, this was a first. Waiters tried to rectify the situation by telling me the cook was "to busy to care". Completely disappointing, Should have stuck to my Trattoria l'contro or Vesta. Can you say overrated?

reviews: Came here with a big group. Initially I made reservations for 10 but it turned out to be 12 and they easily accommodated us. We all had a lovely dinner due to the great service and yummy food. Next time I want to come back for brunch.
extracted: Came here with a big group

reviews: First time here was last night (3/10/12). Made reservations for a 730 on a Saturday night and I'm glad we did because it got crowded quick.Service was very good. Quick and amicable as well as helpful when you had questions on the menu or specials. We both split the mussels as an appetizer and they were HUGE! We've had mussels at other restaurant in the neighborhood and these were by far the best.While the menu looked amazing, we both decided to order from the nightly specials. My date has the long island duck that was served with chorizo sausage pieces, white sweet potatoes and a plumb sauce. The presentation was amazing and all the tastes ran together so nice. I would usually not opt for duck when eating out, but after tasting some of hers, i would absolutely come back and order this.I went with the short ribs special. This was incredible. Anytime short ribs is on a menu or a special, 9 times out of 10 its going to be great. But this dish was so different and exploding with taste. It was short ribs, served over cheddar cheese polenta in a mush room reduction, topped with fried onions. so freakin good.Over all, the dishes were amazing and the service was super friendly. We've been living in the neighborhood for three years and this was our first time here, def not our last.

The presentation was amazing and all the tastes ran together so nice I would usually not opt for duck when eating out, but after tasting some of hers, i would absolutely come back and order this.I went with the short ribs special. Anytime short ribs is on a menu or a special, 9 times out of 10 its going to be great. But this dish was so different and exploding with taste. so freakin good.Over all, the dishes were amazing and the service was super friendly.

reviews: The food is generally very good and the cocktails are outstanding.I know their whole deal is "locally grown," but the service is soooooooo slow (and it's not just the kitchen), it usually gives me pause about going back. That's the main reason I'm only giving 3 stars.But if you have all the time in the world, definitely give them a try!

reviews: Love it!  Locale is dimly lit and the atmosphere is intimate.  Not a huge place but they have outdoor seating as well.  Nice for a date. The service is here is one of the best I've had.  We had Locale's faggotini which is beggar's purse shaped pasta stuffed with gorgonzola and walnuts in red beet sauce and the artichoke ravioli with asparagus and white truffle sauce.  The faggotini was my favorite of the two.  The truffle in the artichoke ravioli was a bit overpowering for my taste. For drinks I had Rosemary's Garden which is rosemary-dill infused vodka, sauvignon blanc and a blue cheese stuffed queen olive.  The blue cheese adds an interesting but good kick to the drink.  My friend had the Smooch with absolut mandarin, fresh strawberry, white peach puree, and mint. Sweet and tropical.  Will definitely be back again.

For drinks I had Rosemary's Garden which is rosemary-dill infused vodka, sauvignon blanc and a blue cheese stuffed queen olive. The blue cheese adds an interesting but good kick to the drink. Sweet and tropical Will definitely be back again Will definitely be back Will definitely be back

reviews: The french toast was good. The mimosas weren't water downed. My friend's omelette was good as well. We had to wait for a bit since we were five people for brunch and most seating is for smaller groups. Nice interior. The waitress was super nice. Can't ask for much better.
extracted: The french toast was good. The mimosas weren't water downed. My friend's omelette was good as well. The waitress was super nice.

reviews: I've been here for brunch a few times with my wife and children and none of us have ever been disappointed. I've also stopped in for dinner a couple of times and they do not disappoint.The waitstaff is always friendly, warm and knowledgeable about the menu, and the food is top notch.Locale is always on the top of my list of restaurants I recommend to friends new to the area.
extracted: I've also stopped in for dinner a couple of times and they do not disappoint.The waitstaff is always friendly, warm and knowledgeable about the menu, and the food is top notch.Locale is always on the top of my list of restaurants I recommend to friends new to the area.

reviews: Absolutely amazing restaurant, and I'm picky.I had the salmon, which is Scottish, so much more flavorful than Atlantic or Alaskan salmon. Tasted the gnocchi and the rigatoni bolognese, as well, both were delicious. Had one of the best wines I've ever had by the glass in a restaurant, C'est La Vie, as well as a light, not-too-sweet peach martini that was heavenly.Staff was very knowledgeable and helpful. Without question, they made special arrangements for me because of my allergies. We had a reservation and our table was ready when we arrived, but we wanted to sit at the bar for a drink first, and they had no problem with it. Beautiful decor. I'd go back in a heartbeat.
extracted: Had one of the best wines I've ever had by the glass in a restaurant, C'est La Vie, as well as a light, not-too-sweet peach martini that was heavenly.Staff was very knowledgeable and helpful. I'd go back in a heartbeat.

reviews: Very unfriendly manager. We arrived with 2 kids and while there were empty tables, they made us wait for 45 mins. We arrived 1:20 and they had to hold 6 empty seats for a 2:30 reservation, while we had to stand. Nice.... We left when he even increased our wait to1 hr... Til 2:30.
extracted: Very unfriendly manager

reviews: Favorite neighborhood spot in Astoria. Try the short rib risotto, very rich but worth every penny. Small intimate tables, great mood lighting, low key enough for a first date but also nice with friends (not particularly great for large parties id imagine because of the small space). The service is always friendly and for the price you're getting a great dinner.
extracted: Favorite neighborhood spot in Astoria Small intimate tables, great mood lighting, low key enough for a first date but also nice with friends (not particularly great for large parties id imagine because of the small space).

reviews: Wonderful service, delicious food, lovely ambience. Went with the girl for our six month anniversary.The portabello and goat cheese crustini salad was beautiful and tasty; just enough to start us off. The Goat Cheese was just perfectly toasted, and was my favorite part of the meal. We shared the Black Linguini with Calamari and Sausage for our main. Also well presented and succulent. A little on the buttery side, which I am always cool with. Calamari was just fine. (The girl ate the sausage, so I can't comment on that.) (You liked that double entendre, did you?)The service was excellent. From the moment we entered the premises (barely even through the doors) we were greeted and invited to choose whatever table we'd like. Our servers and runners were just lovely - interested in making small talk to show their personalities and understanding when it was appropriate to leave us to our meal. Dishes, food, and all were handled and set quickly and gracefully. The owner of the restaurant even came around after we'd finished up to ask how we'd enjoyed his place. He gave us each a bit of moscato as thanks for our feedback. How often do you find that in NYC?Will certainly be back.

Also well presented and succulent A little on the buttery side, which I am always cool with. (The girl ate the sausage, so I can't comment on that.) )The service was excellent. From the moment we entered the premises (barely even through the doors) we were greeted and invited to choose whatever table we'd like. The owner of the restaurant even came around after we'd finished up to ask how we'd enjoyed his place.

reviews: Ate brunch there on New Years Day....the Iced coffee didn't have any ice and was warm....still got charged for iced coffee prices though.  Also the service wasnt very good...it took them awhile to give us menus, no refills were offered (we had to ask) and servers never followed up once meals were served.  They werent that busy either.  They also changed their name from Locale to Gastroteca...which sounds like some digestive problem, but whatever...overall good food and nice atmosphere.

Have you ever walked by one of those restaurants that look trendy and have a ton of people hanging out outside. A place to be seen, all about the scene. That's the vibe you get when you stroll by this restaurant. I've walked by this joint a few times since moving back to Astoria. This last weekend I finally tried it out.Walked up and was greeted straight away and sat promptly. Menus dispersed and specials described. We were left to browse the menu and take in the surroundings. As a restaurant goes it does have a great feel to it. The atmosphere here is one that is relaxed and pretty hip with out trying to be. But I guess that's where the good ended. The brunch menu was small, and the food was OK. Not bad by any means just not something that would blow your mind away. The part of the puzzle that let me down the most, that prevented getting that extra star I would have to say is the service. Slow and inattentive is what we got. Not even a check up to see how we were doing. No ketchup, and no condiments brought to the table. Just wish the service was better. So if you find yourself with in walking distance of this place go ahead and give it a shot. I just hope that you have a better wait staff than I did.

So if you find yourself with in walking distance of this place go ahead and give it a shot I just hope that you have a better wait staff than I did

reviews: Went to Locale for an early dinner last night. As usual, great food and relaxed atmosphere. I started with the meatballs appetizer. Delicious! Savory meatballs in a delicate tomato sauce. For our main course I had the pasta and lamb sauce. Great! My husband had the chicken and polenta, as recommended by our very friendly waiter Alex. He loved it! I was happy to see the owner there as I wanted to compliment him on another great meal at Locale!  Highly recommend this restaurant! Enjoy!
extracted: Delicious Went to Locale for an early dinner last night Savory meatballs in a delicate tomato sauce My husband had the chicken and polenta, as recommended by our very friendly waiter Alex. Highly recommend this restaurant

reviews: My favorite place to eat in Astoria!  No question!  The food is delicious.  I think I've tried everything on the menu (brunch and dinner) and I was satisfied with it all.  The drinks are great, too! And the prices are well within my budget.  You get the perfect amount of food that leaves you satisfied without being overstuffed. The staff is friendly and efficient.  Since I go in there all the time, the owner always gives me a drink on the house...so generous!  I love the decor, as well!  It's just an awesome place, all around.  I
extracted: My favorite place to eat in Astoria The food is delicious. The drinks are great, too!

reviews: I am moving to the area and decided to check this place out. The food was good, drinks perfectly awesome, and service was fantastic. My server Cristina, was friendly, helpful and absolutely makes me want to come back and try out other items on the menu. Very good first impression!
extracted: The food was good, drinks perfectly awesome, and service was fantastic. Very good first impression!

reviews: As a huge fan of brunch living 2 blocks away from Locale, I was excited to have a highly rated brunch place so close to me.  When I got the chance to try it last summer, I was really surprised that it was so subpar.   The restaurant was empty and service was attentive, but I cannot really get around the strangeness of the food.  I got the portobello mushroom benedict, which was fine but nothing memorable.  My friend got the spinach and goat cheese omelet, and this was very strange.  The texture was very smooth and kind of spongey.. it didn't seem like real eggs.  And it was cold.  Spinach and goat cheese omelet is pretty hard to mess up but we were both taken back by how  un-omelet like it was.   I've had many omelets,  I don't expect them to be amazing all the time.  It is, after all, just an omelet - something you can make at home easily.   In this case, we both wished we had just gone to my apartment and made our own omelets.   Or several avenues over to DiWine.  My friend also got a side of polish sausage, which was alright - reminded me of a hot dog.  I enjoy a hot dog now and then (okay, only at baseball games, really) but it wasn't what I was expecting.  I do like the feel of the place.  It seems chic and popular in the evening, and it was nice to sit outside. To summarize:  Strangely textured omelet, odd tasting water, an okay portobello mushroom benedict, somewhat sweet mango mojito, and hotdog-like sausage amounts to a mediocre brunch in terms of food.  However, the pleasant fall Sunday weather and outdoor dining experience made it a charming brunch experience.
extracted: enjoy When I got the chance to try it last summer, I was really surprised that it was so subpar. The restaurant was empty and service was attentive, but I cannot really get around the strangeness of the food. My friend got the spinach and goat cheese omelet, and this was very strange. The texture was very smooth and kind of spongey.. it didn't seem like real eggs. It is, after all, just an omelet - something you can make at home easily. Or several avenues over to DiWine I do like the feel of the place

reviews: The boy brought me here after I suggested something upscale but not stuffy for a Monday night outing.  I'm a foodie - both cooking and eating - so I appreciate a place that has a thoughtfully planned menu as well as knowledgeable staff. We shared a bunch of stuff: a perfectly medium cooked skirt steak with "fries" (really, just slices of baked potato) and baby arugula salad, blue crab stuffed ravioli (seriously, it was insane) as well as a flour less chocolate cake with gelato and fresh whipped cream. We had several cocktails as well that were unique as well as strong. Not only was our server super attentive and well versed in menu options, the owner Johnny checked in to make sure everything was satisfactory and appreciated our patronage so much that he offered is a complimentary glass of port as a parting gift. That's service!!! We'll definitely be back.

reviews: This place is amazing. The food is fantastic and well portioned, drinks are amazing (especially the Rosemary's Garden) and the staff and managers are always so friendly and welcoming. This is definitely one of my top dinner/ brunch spots in Astoria.
extracted: This place is amazing The food is fantastic and well portioned, drinks are amazing (especially the Rosemary's Garden) and the staff and managers are always so friendly and welcoming.

reviews: very cute place...has a Cityish vibe to it, minus the City price. Great place for brunch.
extracted: very cute place...has a Cityish vibe to it, minus the City price. Great place for brunch

reviews: My husband and I picked Locale for our first post-baby date.  Given that we hadn't been out as just the two of us in over eight months, we were really hoping for a nice meal.  Locale didn't disappoint, but it didn't completely wow us either.We had the fried artichokes and meatballs as our appetizer course, both of which were nice.  Then we had the pappardelle with lamb ragout and the veal medallions with mushrooms for our entrees, which were, again, nice.  They offered a fried banana with ice cream and caramel sauce for dessert--it, too, was nice.  Nice, nice, nice.The physical space is nice, cozy, and feels like a slice of Brooklyn in Queens.  Some of the ironwork reminded me of Dressler.  We'll be back sometime, I think, but it's not my very first priority the next time we hire a babysitter.
extracted: My husband and I picked Locale for our first post-baby date. Nice, nice, nice.The physical space is nice, cozy, and feels like a slice of Brooklyn in Queens. We'll be back sometime, I think, but it's not my very first priority the next time we hire a babysitter.

reviews: Awesome music.  Radiohead, Daft Punk, Janet Jackson.  Each employee is allowed to add songs to the playlist each night, so they must have some cool people working here, or at least some okay people who listen to good music.  Our waitress recited the specials without error, and gave great food recommendations.The special tomato-red pepper soup was delicious, but too big of a helping for an appetizer.  I enjoyed both of the pasta choices that my table ordered, but probably wouldn't get them again.  The rabbit ragu and pea prosciutto dishes were well executed, but just didn't mesh with my palette enough.Next time I go back I'm just going to do drinks and dessert, since I missed both of them the first time.  Chocolate souffle, here I come.

Our waitress recited the specials without error, and gave great food recommendations.The special tomato-red pepper soup was delicious, but too big of a helping for an appetizer.

reviews: Truly awesome dinner.  From start to finish we loved it.  I will for sure go here again, and maybe even become a regular.  The "Southern Belle" Buffalo Trace cocktail was exceptional.  Ordered 2 and probably should have ordered 3.  So awesome!Food is very flavorful.  We ordered specials and loved them.  I hope to go back and try some regular menu items!
extracted: Truly awesome dinner The "Southern Belle" Buffalo Trace cocktail was exceptional. Ordered 2 and probably should have ordered 3 So awesome!Food is very flavorful.

reviews: I went to Locale for brunch this saturday...and I loved it!  I had the Portabello Benedict- poached eggs, spinach, and portabello mushrooms with a truffled hollandaise!  Amazing!  The home fries were great as well.  My friend had 2 eggs your way (she had them over-medium, but they weren't quite there, I think).  She commented how great it was to get any-style eggs in this neighborhood... She's had a hard time with that.  The service was great.  Very attentive, and very quick.  I never had an empty coffee cup!This is definitely our new brunch spot.  Next time I want to get a table in the VIP section...ours by the window was a little bit small, and a little drafty on a cold day. (that's why I took off a star...)Really cute decor as well...  I'd love to bring a date here for a romantic dinner... it looks like a great date spot!  It's like a soho hotspot here in Astoria!  Love it!
extracted: The home fries were great as well. The service was great. (that's why I took off a star...)Really cute decor as well... I'd love to bring a date here for a romantic dinner... it looks like a great date spot!

reviews: ive been meaning to write a review of this place but always skip over it.i tried this place one summer weekend so we sat outside, the place was pretty full but we didnt have to wait to get a seat with out any type of reservation.thankfully we only ordered salads and a few drinks.it took almost 20 min for someone to take our order, but the girl who did wasnt bad she was pretty friendly and told us all about the fun drinks. which were pretty good.but i like to review food, i got a simple salad with walnuts and grilled pears. sounds delish right? it was ok until you tasted the pear, because it tasted of chicken. someone didnt brush that grill off did they mmmmmmm. but i had to wait another 30 min just for that so i ate it and asked for the check which took about the same time.i pass this place almost everyday, and never see anyone there anymore so hopefully everyone realized how lame this place is.

reviews: Wait... I haven't reviewed Locale? I've only been here 5 times in the last few months..I have been to the bar for drinks a handful of times, the martinis are delicious and sweet.Pollo Al Lemone - Intense! This is one of the best meals I've had in NYC and THE best meal I've had in Queens. That chicken was so divine and fell right off the bone. Eggs Florentine - Yum! Did not disappoint. This is my favorite restaurant in LIC.

reviews: Pretty sure that this is my new favorite brunch place.  I ordered eggs benedict with corned beef hash and my friend had french toast filled with Nutella.  Both were delicious.  The only thing that I didn't really love was the consistency of the corned beef hash - I thought it was going to be crispy but it was mushy because it was in between the egg and the bread.  They would have received 5 stars had it not been for the tiny mimosa.  If you're going to charge that much for a drink, please make sure that it is more than 4 sips.  The food alone is worth it though!

Both were delicious They would have received 5 stars had it not been for the tiny mimosa. If you're going to charge that much for a drink, please make sure that it is more than 4 sips. The food alone is worth it though! Both were delicious

reviews: Creative and scrumptious, Locale is so delicious, I am longing to return for the brusel sprout salad, tender crisp lamb ribs and spicy chicken on a large medley of seasonal vegetables. Cooked to perfection, common poultry is redefined. I have had dinner five times since the restaurant has new owners. Each time I have come with different friends and the response has been the same gutteral groans of dining pleasure. mmmmnnnn!!! ...and again MMMMNNN!    Oozing with charm,Locale looks like a 19th century European cafe frequented by Emile Zola and Cezanne. A great date place, it's romantic and edgy, and if there is a lull in the conversation, you can talk about the silent movies projected on the wall, a nod to Kaufamn Movie Studios down the block. Dracula and Vampires for Halloween, Fred Astair and Ginger Rogers for Valentine's day.      Brunch and dinner outside during the Indian summer was a joy,  sitting under the tall trees in the fresh air with the waitstaff graciously and patiently attending to our every culinary need. A great respite from the hectic Manhattan scene, and five minutes over the 59th street bridge. It cost more in a taxi to go downtown.

reviews: Good service, but food is pricey and the portions are ridiculously small.  Don't get the steak - it says it comes with a vegetable but it's really a fried onion, and the steak is definitely not worth it.
extracted: Good service, but food is pricey and the portions are ridiculously small.

reviews: love the atmosphere here. tables on the front bottom level, and couch style seating on the upper back level, although the tables are still high so you're not bending over your food. it's very comfortable and cozy. the wall to wall floor to ceiling windows reflecting all the table candles make it really pretty in there.wait staff is super friendly, service is fast, food is delicious! less than impressed (actually very disappointed) with our two appetizers we chose... meatballs and bruschetta trio. meatballs were bland, spreads weren't very tasty and bread small and sparse, but our entrees were fantastic! steaks for the husbands (can't remember the cut, but i remember them liking them), which were cooked to perfection (rare and medium rare, both men were impressed with how they were done), beet and gorgonzola pasta for me, which was SUPERB, and crab cakes for my friend which she loved and was a great size. will definitely go back.

reviews: Went to Locale last night with my girlfriend and her 8 year old son. Other than the kid being a bit bored (big surprise) the whole experience was great! Nice ambience, friendly helpful staff, hip vibe...... But the real win of the evening was the cuisine. Man, I tell you each treat they brought out was more tasty than the last. Appetizer of fried zucchini strips (like veggie fries) was so good, we had to slow down for the entree. I had the rigatoni, which was great, the lil guy had the gnocchi, delish...... And my lady had the beef rib risotto which was the best of the night. The brownie with caramelized marshmallow was perfect desert finisher! We will def be back! (the brunch next time for us!)

reviews: Went here for a Sunday brunch in the rain.Nice interior very loungy and comfortable for a relaxing brunch.  Come hungry!  Brunch portions are substantial.Had a hot tea to counteract the rain.  It was just a tea bag in water, nothing else to say about that.My friend got the corned beef hash and it was every bit indulgent and mildly repulsive as she was expecting.  I guess ordering that is more of a southern thing and her bf doesn't know 1, how she can eat it and 2, how come she likes it so much.I got the portobello benedict.  Nothing to write home about, but Definitely get the sauce on the side!  It's tangy and potent and i wasn't really a fan.  If you don't get it on the side it will take over your plate and attack any kind of food flavors that are out in the open.  We actually had very attentive service and the host made sure we didn't forget our umbrellas as were were heading out into the mugginess that followed.

reviews: I live nearby but have never ventured into LOCALE. Until yesterday. And thank god I did! I had the best piece of Striped Bass I've ever eaten. The Chef Jessie should be highly revered. The fish skin was salty & crispy and perfectly cooked. The chipotle masked potatoes were the bomb! I was actually groaning while I ate these. LOL Top it all off with wild greens and a fruit salsa and call me a happy girl. My waiter was wonderful, the food was stellar and I will DEFINATELY be back to Locale.

reviews: I'm basing my rating purely on their Brunch, since I've never had dinner here.But man, what a brunch menu.  All of the omelettes and eggs benedict are amazing.  My favorite though, is the texas toast.  It's basically french toast with a cornflake coating.  It's crispy on the outside and soft on the inside, served with fresh fruit and just the right amount of syrup.If anyone brings up brunch, I bring them to Locale.
extracted: All of the omelettes and eggs benedict are amazing It's basically french toast with a cornflake coating.

reviews: Purdy Fantastic Brunch!Been living around the corner for over a year and just ate here yesterday, I've got to say I was quite impressed on a number of levels.We stopped in for brunch and I did the Southern Omelet (substituted some awesome Polish sausage for the grilled chicken) and the thing was enormous and was a real winner in the flavor department! The homefries will leave you agape. My g/f got the tuna & avocado club with some pretty bomb bacon and fries that were very very tasty and crisp. Additionally to all the tastiness the service was quite special. The waitress was quite funny and very attentive. The owner (or manager or whatever the hell he was) came over to see how our experience was. It was touching. . . I was expecting to pay a small fortune for all this deliciousness but we got out of there for less than $30 (without booze, we were quite hungover). Overall this place really won a soft spot in my heart and we will definitely be back.

reviews: My go-to Saturday brunch spot. The best eggs benedict I've found in Astoria! I've always been seated quickly and service is always friendly. They trimmed back their brunch menu however and I'm pretty bummed that they took the steak off.

Wow! The  staff were really excited about their new fall menu and now I know why. The salmon with lobster gnocchi was out of this world! One of those dishes that will make you want to slowly savor the experience. It's worth the splurge $ wise, trust me. Only thing to avoid - cocktails with ice in it. They over-ice the drinks so you pay too much for about 5 sips. Go for the wine options. So good!

reviews: This place is my favorite restaurant in the city.  I have been to lots of great restaurants in manhattan and nothing compares to Locale.  They have a great selection of foods and daily specials.  The wait staff is very attentive and considerate.  We are always greeted personally by the host. Our only complaint is the small tables.  You have to be very careful where you placing anything because any moment something might spill.  I suggest this place to all my friends and go eat there at least biweekly.

reviews: Locale makes GREAT pasta. I have been here a few times, and every pasta dish I have tried has been amazing. Unfortunately, everything else I've had there has been somewhere between mediocre and bad.The meat they use there is organic. If you know anything about organic meat, you know that the cows are not as fat as regular cows. While this is great for the cows, it is not as great for merciless carnivores like me. This is not a failing of the preparation, but there's a reason Peter Luger does not serve organic meat.The fish is usually salty and over sauced. In Astoria, there are a slew of Greek places that will give you a simply grilled fish covered in olive oil, lemon, and thyme. I find that preferable to the fish dishes I've tried at Locale.I've had a few of their appetizers too, which range from forgettable (I can't remember which ones, ha ha), to pretty horrible (fried artichokes tasted like fried nothing).But really, the pasta there is GREAT. The faggotini is really worth popping in for if you live nearby, as is the garganelli. This place is two different restaurants: a great pasta place, and a pretty crappy everything else place.

The faggotini is really worth popping in for if you live nearby, as is the garganelli. This place is two different restaurants: a great pasta place, and a pretty crappy everything else place.

reviews: I went to dinner at Locale yesterday. I have never heard of Locale and I live in the area.  I like where Locale is located and the ambiance and lighting was nice. They seated us in the front close to the window and I sat on the bench by the window with the pretty pillows. We ordered the house salad, calamari for appetizers. I ordered the risotto and my boyfriend ordered the gnocchi.  I wished I had read the reviews. This place is apparently good for pasta. My risotto was bland and the calamari was overcooked. I enjoyed the house salad and my boyfriend's gnocchi was phenomenal. If I come here next time, I will order the house special pasta, faggotini.

reviews: We like Locale a great deal....one of the nicer places on that northern NJ Piermont Rd corridor. One note to consider if you dine al fresco.....most of the chairs are terribly uncomfortable. Something I would urge management to consider for a hi-end place like theirs.
extracted: One note to consider if you dine al fresco.....most of the chairs are terribly uncomfortable. Something I would urge management to consider for a hi-end place like theirs.

reviews: Extremely disappointed with Locale.  It caught my eye as a cool spot that I wanted to try, but the food and service was sub par.We ordered drinks at the bar while we waited for a table.  While we were drinking our cocktails a waitress came by and grabbed the glass of water that was served to me and brought it to someone else.  Eww!  Luckily I didn't drink it, but that was gross.  Maybe an honest mistake, but don't know how that could have happened.We were seated at a table outside on the sidewalk.  Shared the fried zucchini which was ok and crab cakes which were good.  For an entree I had the gnocchi.  Possibly the worst I've ever had.  The sauce was sooooo nasty.  I don't know if I will ever be back.  I will refrain from ripping them further as there is more I could add.  My sister-in-law warned me it was only good for drinks, but I was hoping she was wrong.  Safe to say she was right.  It makes me think twice about possibly trying their other business venture, Lucas Steakhouse.

reviews: I've been here a few times for both brunch and dinner and I have to say, this place is solidly good.There usually isn't a wait for this place so no need to make a reservation, but you can if you want to.  The service is friendly and quick to respond.  The restaurant is actually on a great corner with outdoor seating (if the weather is nice) and huge windows in the front that they'll open up sometimes.  It's a semi romantic setting at night with dim lights.The food is good.  Their french toast for brunch is delicious.  All their pastas are also really solid and tasty.  The food comes out at a good pace.  They do have good drinks, but in my opinion, they are kind of pricey.  They have a great space in the back of the restaurant that would probably be be great for a  little party or shower.As a note though, if you have a restaurant.com certificate for here, they won't honor it...a little unfortunate that they only comp'ed one dessert...but people have to make a living I guess.

reviews: I recently moved to the neighborhood with my family and have lived in Manhattan for over 20yrs but knew only little about Astoria's food scene. This past week my wife and I, along with two Astoria natives decided to check out some of the local places. I was really disappointed with this one. Food was borderline o.k. and WAY over priced for the quality, but service was descent. The place looks charming but did not deliver in the food and beverage department. NY Strip was over cooked and simply boring; as if my kids had made one for the first time without supervision. The Locale Mojito seemed like a safe bet, but was overpowered by the st Germain and not very cold. I suspect it was sitting there for a while. We did not finish our plates and decided to head elsewhere for a night cap. I decided to write my first review today and saw that all of my complaints were mirrored on yelp by previous guests. Then I read a very interesting review by a local couple on their blog (see: Elizabeth S. 7/15/2012) and saw the response it got from Locale's owner. I will not return.
extracted: and WAY over priced for the quality, but service was descent. Then I read a very interesting review by a local couple on their blog (see: Elizabeth S. 7/15/2012) and saw the response it got from Locale's owner. I will not return.

reviews: Service is crap. Wait staff took an hour to arrive with our food after taking 20 minutes to take order. Manager was rude and horrible to staff AND customers, (looked to me like she was over her head and couldn't handle the hubbub of a busy din.) Food was alright, but drinks are overpriced, and taste different each time. Not really intending on coming back unless it's early day and I want something simple.

reviews: I absolutely love this place.  I've been there 5+ times now, and every time the food has been outstanding.  It's fresh, creative yet simple, and has a nice mix of items.  Their fish specials are always spectacular and the preparations are really original.  Their staples are equally as good - the chicken and gnocchi are solid go-to's.The owner is especially attentive.  He's usually there when we're dining, and always stops by to saw hi and check in on our experience, which I definitely appreciate.I'm getting hungry just writing this...

reviews: I've been here several times over the past 5 years of living in the area. I would have rated this much higher if not for my most recent experience. I was here with a friend last week, and the food as always is excellent. The service was not though. My friend ordered from the pre-fixe menu for restaurant week, I ordered off the regular menu yet they charged the mandatory 18.75% gratuity on the whole bill. The waitress's service was AWFUL. I think mandatory tipping is BS because it opens up to being ignored like we were. She didn't check how our food was, ask us if we wanted more drinks and my friend had wanted ketchup for her meal, yet it took over 10 minutes to get the waitress to even notice we needed something.Some other lady started coming by and we continued to try and enjoy each other's company and ignore the poor service. Finally AFTER we paid the bill, the second lady who was coming around asked if everything was okay and we said it was fine, and tried to continue talking amongst ourselves. She then pointed out that she is the manager and we seem dissatisfied because we aren't making eye contact. I didn't realize we were here to be your friend! This woman was very abrasive. Then we told her we felt our waitress was a bit aloof. "Aloof?" she asks. I didn't realize that word was too big for a high class manager such as yourself. She continued to barrage us, why didn't you say something, why aren't you looking at us when we come over etc etc. Listen lady, we weren't there to be your friends. You people are called servers for a reason, you're there to serve us our food, make sure we have what we need then get lost. Try it sometimes. Don't come to our table after we ate, and paid to make sure everything is alright then act like a superior b*tch because you're the oh-so-important manager. If she noticed we didn't seem happy, she should have addressed it right when she noticed by introducing herself as the manager and asking if everything was alright, like they do IN EVERY OTHER RESTAURANT in the world. Sorry, you now lost me forever as a customer.

reviews: My friends and I had brunch here just yesterday for my birthday and it was so phenomenal! I was surprised that there was no wait on a Sunday while the  soccer game was on. We were seated right away ( outside on a beautiful day) and then our waitress came over and introduced herself - Anna! If you want excellent and quick customer service, she's your girl! She helped us out with what we should get since it was our first time, she was honest, friendly and way too sweet! We all ended up getting different things and all tried something new, I had the baby spinach and goat cheese omelet with their potato wedges (fries). It was so amazing, it was hot and it had the right amount of cheese and spinach, not too overwhelming. My friend got the avocado turkey club which was also so delicious! My other friend got the chicken omelet and she honestly scarfed it down in 5 minutes! We had a round of mimosas, and those were gone before we finished making the toast. They have mango, passion and regular mimosas. Then we had a round of sangria, which was also, so great. It wasn't too sweet or bitter (just wish the fruit was a little fresher). We ordered creme brûlée for dessert and Anna came out with a candle on it since she over heard it was my birthday! & it was on the house! The only negative thing is that the portions are kind of small, but we were very satisfied with our meals. The food was hot and fresh and the service was out of this world! We will definitely be coming back here soon!

The food was hot and fresh and the service was out of this world! We will definitely be coming back here soon!

reviews: I re-visited locale for dinner last month and was pleasantly surprised at the comeback they had made with their service and food. We were seated and served promptly and all our dishes were exquisite. If they keep up this level locale will be around for years to come.
extracted: We were seated and served promptly and all our dishes were exquisite.

reviews: Came here for some delicious brunch - I was told that it may be the second best place for brunch in Astoria. I've yet to be some place better, so it's number one to me!Typical brunch fare, ran until 4pm the day we were there. Drinks are either a little weak or I'm a closet alcoholic or something. Portion sizes were perfect for breakfast - I do not need a monster omelet bringing terror to my stomach in the mornings, thank you. The home fries were the most unusual I've ever encountered - potato chunks with onion and other veggies, all nicely baked and not greasy. Service was good and on top of things. Always a pleasant addition to brunching fare.

We all had the caramel apple pancakes and they were delicious!  We also ordered the polish sausage, apple wood bacon and scrambled eggs as sides, which we all shared. Everything was delicious. I also liked the decor and ambience. Definitely recommend this place and the next time we are in LIC visiting my sister, we definitely want to try their dinner options.

Great place for brunch! I had the salmon omelet which was great but the latte was actually really tasty, almost creamy.  The service was great too.  The atmosphere was full of light and a good vibe all around.  I will be back to check out dinner!

reviews: This place sucks. They kicked us out after being there for 20 minutes because they had NYE reservations at 445pm. The best thing was the company I was with. Worst $60 I ever spent!!!!!!

I used to come here often since my girlfriend lived on the same block. The sandwiches for Sunday brunch are amazing, and the fries are some of the tastiest I've ever had.Dinner is another story. None of the seating is comfortable, but if you're stuck in the lounge area, prepare to feel awkward. The pasta was mediocre, with odd peas. The waiters are inconsistent, too. reviews: This is one of my regular stops in Astoria, and I've never been disappointed. Brunch has all your standard offerings plus some pretty amazing paninis, but dinner is the real winner. Great selections, all made fresh, and the menu changes seasonally. Always happy I went.

The place itself is very cool. The menu offered interesting brunch cocktails, but we didn't order any. I'll come back.

reviews: My husband and I came to this place for brunch 2 weeks ago. I ordered a Locale Mojito which was ok. My husband ordered a latte which was not bad. I got rigatoni bolognese and it was a little too salty, but the texture of the pasta wasn't quite chewy which I liked it! The belgian waffles that my husband ordered wasn't that special either. The service is not bad! My conclusion for this restaurant is so so!

reviews: I've experienced way better brunch! This place has such hype going for it but what was in it for me? First off, my boyfriend and I sat at the bar while we waited to be seated (great). The girl at the bar NEVER looked up at us to ask us if we wanted anything to drink. I eventually had to ask her if she could get us something. She was RUDE. Not once making eye contact. Not a great first impression. We ordered the chicken? omelet and crepe special. The crepe special for the price was extremely tiny and filled with almost nothing. As for the omelet, I like my eggs fluffy but this batch tasted fake. Like air; no taste, no substance, no filling, so weird. The home fries were good but the portion was small. Anyway, I would give it another try but I'm not going for brunch again.

reviews: This is one of my favorite places in Astoria. I have been here several times and the food has been consistently good. Friendly, attentive staff and cozy, intimate ambience. Highly recommended!

Their Tuscan french fries are delicious!!!!!We also had their beet salad which is Ok, nothing special.And numerous times we went there for dinner and I always have fish. And i must say, their fish (bronzino) is delicious. My fiancee had their steak special and he enjoyed it very much. We love this place, we go like 2-3 times a month or so, but its kinda pricey.

The drinks are no longer specials per season (miss the pear nectar martini) BUT all the new drinks we tried were GREAT. Drinks: We tried & loved: Trios Amigos, Ginger Berry, & the Strawberry/Mint drinks: GREAT.BUT Writer's Block: was a bit strong for my hubby & I's taste. Dessert: Chocolate molten cake tasted better this time; although the souffle at Lucas's around the corner can't be beat..Food is good as well although as a vegetarian there's not much to offer me. It's a bit pricey so we tend just to go for a quick drink on a special night.

reviews: We came here for a friends birthday and it was such a blast! The cocktails we ON POINT (the SkinnyGirl was fantastic) and our salads and apps were fantastic. Louis, our server, was there exactly when we needed him and was so awesome. We will DEFINITELY be back soon!
