Get the faggiotini.  It's the house special and it's incredible.  little wonton shaped pastas filled with gorgonzola with a creamy beet sauce.  I know, the beet sauce sounds weird but it's sooo good.Really cute little place, but if you go during prime dinner time, be prepared to wait.  Oh yea, chocolate soufle cake served with ice cream- get that, too.

reviews: I was really pleasantly surprised by my visit to Locale last night! I don't live in Astoria but have some friends in the area, so when we went out to check out the new chef's work and new cocktail menu, I didn't know what to expect, but everything I had was great! The cocktails are inventive and mysterious--even the manager wouldn't tell us what was in the de-lish-usss "Lolita," which was light, refreshing, and garnished with an orchid. The "Smooch" was heavier but the peach, strawberry, and mint complimented each other beautifully.Others at the table tried the "Writer's Block" which was a bit heavy but oh-so-literary, and the "Class" which was exactly what they should be drinking on Mad-Men.The calamari were a little rubbery, but everything else I tried was excellent. My faggatoni was heavily cheesy, but so delicious I still ate almost the whole plate! The outdoor seating area was nice, on a perfect night, and inside the ambience and music seemed perfect for a date or a small gathering. All around, I had a very nice evening. Definitely recommend it!

reviews: I've been here twice for brunch. The food is very good and they have a variety of drinks. However, service is hit or miss, which is why I knocked off a star. I love the Belgian waffles with bananas. The decor is really nice but it can get pretty loud during brunch.

reviews: Came here for an early Sunday dinner. The location is fantastic; the wide sidewalk, trees, and relative quiet allows for pleasant sidewalk seating. The Blood Mary was great, and my Manhattan stiff.The food, however, was a 2-star affair. Overall the dishes were passable, but clumpy noodles, and too-salty salad greens (sides, fillet carpaccio) ruined the meal.Service was well-meaning but our waiter lost track of us at the end of the meal. I think he also forgot to tell us the specials.I'd come here again for drinks though!

The restaurant itself is so inviting.  We had a waitress the other night on Tuesday night, and she was so sweet and knew the answers to all my roommates questions.

reviews: I really enjoyed this place. I came for lunch this past Sunday. My date & I arrived about 10 minutes before the kitchen closed, so we were OK with the waitresses' request to order quickly. The atmosphere was lovely, low-key & warm. It wasn't crowded, but we were there at almost 4PM. I would imagine that this is an excellent place for brunch. My date ordered a salad. It was fine. The problem came once she tasted my grass-fed beef burger. It was one of the best burgers I've had a restaurant EVER! Perfectly cooked & seasoned with love. The fries & dipping sauce were also stand-out. The waitresses were very nice & helpful and the food was delicious & reasonably priced. I am a fan and I will return!

reviews: its.... not cheap for the area however the food is great! Although I selected three stars, it really ought to be three point five. Why couldn't I give it four stars? Sadly, it is just far too pricey for its neighborhood and food! Yes, the food is delicious and offers creativity and thought into its dishes... however, it sometimes feels as if the ingredients are trying too hard to impress! It seems as if thats where the bulk of my $$$ is going when I eat here! The money is going to ingredients that although add to the dish... they aren't necessary to make taste buds sing with joy!theres a pretty long wine list, which was shocking to me because I dont associate wine with QueensIts not very spacious and the place can get pretty loudBut you really ought to go for the food and try this place out-- its this secret gem in Astoria because its got pretty much nothing else fun to do/see/go to in its immediate area

reviews: I have been in Astoria for a few years now and have been to Locale on a few different occasions. First let me say that the quality is really second to none. I have never had a bad meal at Locale and the interior and vibe are really spot on. But if I was to offer a critique on the menu itself I have noticed a lack of diversity on the menu. I think that the menu is a little bogged down with pastas and though I have enjoyed the risotto, I traditionally think of it as a special or seasonal dish. Also, I'm not a big fan of drinks that  you have to point to because they are trying to be funny (i.e.thepantydropper) though the beverage itself is pretty tasty.But all in all, Locale is a great restaurant and a must visit if you are in the Astoria food scene. The environment is modern but comfortable and the staff is really pleasant and attentive.

reviews: I had Locale for the first time a little over a year ago and been back there about 6 times. Had I been writing this review last year, it'd be 5 stars hands down, but no lie this place has gone DOWNNNN, wayyy dowwnnn!!!!!Dinner is ok.  A little over priced and over the top in heaviness.  We all got pasta dishes- faggotini, ravioli, and papardelle. papardelle with rabbit was good, the others first bite was great and was so heavy it was just overwhelming to eat and enjoy. their soups are great- it's a damn shame they no longer serve soup at brunch. the black bean soup and corn chowder was amazing...but it's a moot point since it's not on the regular menu...speaking of brunch....first time i was here i thought the eggs benedict were the best i ever had- mainly because of their hollandaise, but it's never been very good since- either served cold, yolk cooked through, the english muffin tasting old and stale, or the overall portion being ridiculously small. i went back over this weekend, and noticed a new menu. Offhand the prices are wildly out of whack ($2 coffee and $2.50 tea? its a bag and hot water people! and a chicken cali club $10 but cali benedict $12? in what world are 2 eggs more costly than a serving of chicken???). I ordered the poached eggs with biscuits and gravy. Sucked. portion was extremely small, food not hot, gravy bland, biscuits dense and flavorless. Only thing enjoyable about my meal was the homefries. my sister got the cali benedict, for $12 a SMALL english muffin with weak slices of avocado, non-ripe tomato slices, and some weird watery sauce. not appetizing at all.Lastly the service is terrible. It's never that crowded yet you can never find a server and the food always takes forever. I've had cold food served to me on more than 1 occasion which is unacceptable when you're one of 5 or 6 tables. What pisses me off more so is you see a lot of the staff just standing around bs'ing with each other.I hate writing such long review but i feel this story needs to be shared.In summary:The bad: service, quality of food (flavor and freshness), value for your moneyThe good: ambiance, location (which IMO are both a waste considering the above) and i must say, they have GREAT coffee! lol. weird. and the drinks look good. if i came back here at all it would be for drinks only.

reviews: Yumm. The nice decore drew us in and the food solidified the experience, My boyfriend and I went here to celebrate our 3 year anniversary and left very satisfied. We started with the mussels in garlic sauce - generous portion at only $10. Moved on to the specials - boyfriend got the bass, I got the duck. Incredible. The end bill (including 2 glasses of wine and two desserts) was a reasonable $80. Wonderful dining experience and plan to go back very soon.

reviews: Cute little spot in Astoria. Order the meatball for appetizer, ravioli and steak for  the meal. Everything is pretty decent, the meatballs were mouthwatering. Mojito was a little weak. Pretty good service. Will visit again for brunch )

reviews: My girlfriends and I came here for brunch a few months ago and loved it! I love the ambience at Locale. It's not really loud and has awesome outdoor lighting because of their glass windows. I ordered the California Benedict, which was good but my friend ordered something from the lunch menu, which was really good (I can't remember what it was though). I would definitely want to come back for brunch or dinner again!

reviews: Excellent, less-is-more style food, like one finds in Italy.After reading much about Locale and raising my expectations for the quality of its food, I was still impressed. The interior is unexpectedly stylish and modern. Hearing the specials du jour left my mouth watering. But my appetite wasn't gaping that night, so I ordered a simple papparadelle with mushrooms in a pink sauce ($13.50), and it took me back to a meal I had had in Florence. My boyfriend had the chicken arribiata ($15), mildly spicy and flavored with peppers. Would definitely return
extracted: The interior is unexpectedly stylish and modern.

I went for the Queens Restaurant Week special, so options were a little limited but everything I had was very good. Really nice setting as well. Prices are a little high even with the prix fixe, was somewhat surprised when bill came, but will definitely return at some point in the future.

reviews: I loveeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeee Locale. So cute, our waiter was great (he even gave us a free dessert), and so close to my apartment! Perfect. I had the Faggotini Alla Barbabietola, which was absolutely great. The beggar's purse shaped pasta was unique to me and the sauce was not too intense. The prices are a bit steep for Queens standards, but I don't think you will regret it.  Go here.  Now!

reviews: I go to this place quite often, and have for over 2 years since moving to Astoria. It's "off the beaten path" so to speak, very neighborhoodie, which makes it all that more appealing to me. The dinners and pastas are fine, sumptuous, and varied (great stuff for people who don't want to over do it). But it's the brunch on the weekends that I want to talk about. Not only is the environment, depending on where you sit, comfortable and elegant at the same time, but frankly, the quality of the food has improved over time, particularly the omelets and egg benedicts. It's especially nice when it's warm out. They mostly have the usual breakfast and brunch fare plus somewhat unique additions (polenta with sausage and fried egg), but it is a slim menu. The servers and bartenders are super sweet! My only wish is that a) the menu would expand in the sides (more veggies and salads!) and breakfast items, and/or b) they would bring back their omelet and breakfast specials!

reviews: I eat here often, as it's right in the hood.  My experiences have been great with the exception of the occasional order mixup or serious delay in getting something done. The food is very tasty, not too impressed with their egg dishes.  Stick with a sandwich for brunch, they're great.  Their coffee is also surprisingly good.

reviews: This restaurant has a nice physical space, and the staff were all cheerful, but the food disappointed. We came for a late brunch.I ordered eggs benedict with smoked salmon. The eggs had the outward appearance of having been poached, but they had been fully boiled. Instead of a stack of long, thin slices of salmon, I got a pile of minced bits, like you might find bacon on a salad.My companion ordered the spinach omelette. It came out looking like something from the frozen food aisle, with a too-perfect shape. It was not warm, and the spinach tasted raw.Both orders were barely seasoned, and so lacking in flavor. Not what we had hoped for.

The Peanut Butter Bomba was the best guilty treat I ever had! I highly recommend this place to have a martini with friends or to go on a romantic date. I've also heard good things about their brunch. The location of this place is in a very unusual spot in the middle of bodegas and whatnot, but I think business does just fine.

Their food (and cake cutting fee...) may be somewhat on the more expensive side (except brunch) but for the most part, it is worth it. Thanks Locale - your manager is great

reviews: One star is based on atmosphere and service only. I did not eat here.I made a reservation on a Friday night for two to eat outside at 8:30. When I got there, they did not have my reservation, and happened to have one table available outside with only one chair. I waited for them to bring another chair, and someone walked by and asked if we wanted tap or bottled water. When they brought the second chair, we waited without menus or table settings for about three minutes, and someone else walked by and asked if we wanted tap or bottled water. I again replied "tap," and we waited another five minutes. While we waited, we noticed how incredibly loud it was. My boyfriend couldn't even hear me at a normal voice level even though we were outside. Servers walked by repeatedly, and no one else stopped at our table to greet us, give us menus or to tell us how long it would be until our server would be there. Ten minutes after we arrived, we were already regretting our restaurant choice at this point so we left.
extracted: Servers walked by repeatedly, and no one else stopped at our table to greet us, give us menus or to tell us how long it would be until our server would be there.

reviews: i love the decor of this restaurant. we had the black linguini and it was the best ive ever had. the hanger steak was also good but we both felt that nobody  beats peter lugers when it comes to steaks
Solid brunch.  Good variety of inventive omelets, cool space, reasonable prices.  And their rosemary home fries are fantastic.

reviews: Delish! I enjoyed some shoestring zuccini bites and an espresso martini to die for tonight at Locale. I've lived in the neighborhood for 2.5 years and I just discovered this place through a friend. I will definitely be coming back for drinks - the beer selection is excellent!

reviews: This is more of a 3 1/2 to 4 star review. I feel like 3 little stars isn't very fair, but anyway..Decided to try Locale for dinner the other night, since I was pretty optimistic about it after I had looked up their menu online.I made a reservation for a Friday night at 8:30- we were running 10 mins late so I called ahead to notify the restaurant, and they gracefully accommodated us. Instead of our usual beer, my husband and I opted for wine this time around- he had the Chardonnay and I had the Pino Grigio...he complained that the Chardonnay tasted as if it was "watered down" and it did lack alot of flavor. He got the Sauvignon Blanc in place of it, which was a little bit better, but nothing really that great. The Pino was kinda along the same lines. Our server suggested the Calamari as an excellent starter, and although I wanted to try something different for a change, we decided to go with it since she said it was really good. It was good, but it was also just like any other calamari I've had at any other place. I've also had calamari that was alot better than that too. Not a huge disappointment, but not exactly exciting either...We followed that with pasta, my husband getting the Lamb Paperdelle, and I got the artichoke/asparagus stuffed Ravioli with a cream sauce. The pastas were great, and I appreciate the "proper" portions that were served, but for the prices of $16 and $19, I would expect a bit more for my money, or for the prices to be a bit lower. Service was very attentive and the restaurant has a warm and cozy atmosphere. Overall, it wasn't a bad experience, it just wasn't anything very exciting.
extracted: I feel like 3 little stars isn't very fair, but anyway..Decided to try Locale for dinner the other night, since I was pretty optimistic about it after I had looked up their menu online.I made a reservation for a Friday night at 8:30- we were running 10 mins late so I called ahead to notify the restaurant, and they gracefully accommodated us. Our server suggested the Calamari as an excellent starter, and although I wanted to try something different for a change, we decided to go with it since she said it was really good. The pastas were great, and I appreciate the "proper" portions that were served, but for the prices of $16 and $19, I would expect a bit more for my money, or for the prices to be a bit lower. Service was very attentive and the restaurant has a warm and cozy atmosphere.

reviews: I've since been here for brunch, multiple times for dinner and twice for a night cap. I am DEFINITELY hooked! When you go, you must save room for the peanut butter bomba. Its basically a chocolate shell filled with peanut cream, quartered and then drizzled with chocolate sauce and caramel. Words cannot describe...

I definitely will go back. . .   Lots of inventive daily specials which I like. I had the baby lamb chops with this potatoe/vegetable mash which was perfect. The steak frites were delicious as well. Great place for a date or with friends. Would like to try brunch one day.

reviews: I went to  Locale for brunch.  I had a delicious omelette, the  Texas toast with nutella, and a body Mary.  The Texas toast was amazing.  It had just the right amount of nutella for an indulgent brunch dessert without being overwhelming.  Too much sweetness in the morning makes me feel sick, but the toast was fantastic.  The bloody Mary had a LOT of kick.  It was a lot of spice initially, but it disappeared just as quickly as it hit. I liked it a  lot. The fact that there was no lingering  bite made it easier to handle.  Also the decor is awesome.  It's cozy and classy and I love it!

reviews: WOWWWWWWWWWmy family and I have been going to different Astoria spots for brunch the past month and this is by far the best one we've been to. I had the Lamb and Spinach hash with salad. So good!!!!!! See for yourself, the pictures are as great as the amazing taste. Bravo to the chef!!

reviews: My friend and I came here on a rainy week day for brunch. From the street, I think I walked past this place like 4x before I realized the restaurant on the corner with the red awning was Gastroteca..LOL I didn't see a sign or anything that said Gastroteca on it..OR perhaps I need to open my eyes more.. O_O Interior decor was simple and clean. I really liked the open layout and that the tables weren't so close together. For food, we ordered the California Benedict, Scampi & Grits, and we had the 3 for $10 Crostinos (Fig Jam, Ricotta, Prosciutto/Sicilian Pineapple, Mascarpone, Chili Flakes/Tallegio, Pistachio, Blackberry Jam), and I also ordered a side dish of cheddar polenta. My friend also ordered a Bold Fashioned from the cocktail menu. Food came out fairly quickly. First came out the apps, which were the crostinos. My favorite was the Sicilian Pineapple w/ Mascarpone & Chili flakes. Each bite was very flavorful and tasty. I didn't really care for the Tallegio, Pistachio & Blackberry jam though. I didn't think that flavor combination worked well. My California Benedict was delicious! 2 perfectly cooked eggs and coupled with the avocado and basil really worked! My friend's Scampi & Grits tasted good too. I didn't really care for the cheddar polenta. I thought the polenta was a bit clumpy and could have use just a little more cooking. Portions are good, and quality is definitely there. My friend did complain about her Bold Fashioned though. She felt that the crushed blackberries on the bottom of the glass made drinking out of a straw rather difficult. Otherwise, it tasted pretty good. Service was on point. Server was very knowledgeable about the menu and their food. Very patient as well. I can see Gastroteca being one of my go-to brunch spots! :D

O_O Interior decor was simple and clean. I really liked the open layout and that the tables weren't so close together. Each bite was very flavorful and tasty. My California Benedict was delicious! My friend's Scampi & Grits tasted good too. Portions are good, and quality is definitely there. Otherwise, it tasted pretty good. Server was very knowledgeable about the menu and their food. Very patient as well I can see Gastroteca being one of my go-to brunch spots!

reviews: Very nice place near Kaufman studios and The Museum of the Moving Image.  Inside was airy and very bright.  I had the chicken and waffles (as good as sweet chick) and will have to come back for the burrata.  Lexi was very friendly and very attentive.  I chose to eat outside in front and was pleasantly ensconced by the warm sun for most of my meal.  Cars can be a little noisy but it is New York.
extracted: Inside was airy and very bright.

reviews: Went on a whim on a Tuesday afternoon for brunch and really liked the food and atmosphere. A rustic decor with large windows to let in natural light and 80s rock playing in the background. I ordered the Brunch Lasagna. It was good. Not bad but I had better. But my girlfriend ordered the Bucatini Americano and it was delicious. A must have on the weekday brunch menu.We also ordered crostinos: the prosciutto/ricotta/fig jam, agrodolce bacon/scallion ricotta, and tallegio/pistachios/blackberry jam. My favorite was the bacon. It balanced sweet and savory very well with the smoky meat and a drizzle of balsamic. The girlfriend liked the tallegio because of the light but tasty blackberry jam. I would recommend this place to anyone looking for a quick brunch.

reviews: The food was good but they took more than half hr to serve the food, even there was few tables only. We ordered scampi & grits and Brunch lasagna. Scampi was really good to mix with the creamy cheese, the shrimp wasn't over cook, !! It was fantastic. But the brunch lasagna was so so, the lasagna layer had more to do with toughness and it served with warm temperature only, I believe it will taste much better if they serve it hot.

reviews: Ok, I ordered the California Benedict with a side salad and all I can say is that those egg Benedict's were really good! The side salad was just lettuce and vinaigrette dressing; refreshing but not satisfying or very tasty (next time I'll try the hash browns since they seemed to be the popular side that day). My husband ordered the gnocchi and I must admit that's probably the best gnocchi I've tasted! One downside is that the portion size is very small and I would recommend ordering one or two sides because the gnocchi by itself was not filling for my husband. We also had delicious mimosas and a friendly bar tender! We would definitely try this place again but not too often since it is expensive for us.

reviews: Nice little spot near Kaufman theater.  A bit nosier than I expected but nice music and vibe.We got the texan french toast with nutella and Atlantic salmon with runny eggs.  The crispy flakes of the french toast was really good with every sweet bite of nutella.  The powder sugar was just sweet enough, then to dip just a bit of the toast in the syrup to really change it.  The home fries we got with the salmon was a nice salty and sweet combo.  The runny eggs with salmon was really a nice pair the toast was a bit hard but the runny egg helps soften it up.  Small spot but some good lighting and atmosphere makes a good time.  Staff was friendly and attentive.  I would have to go try some of the other stuff another time =)As always check some of the photos that I always post =)

reviews: I really wanted to love Gastroteca. I've walked past it so many times and always thought it looked charming. Finally my fiance and I tried it today for brunch. Sadly there were a lot of low points during our meal.First impression: it's loud. Plenty of people chatting and on top of that loud music. I'm not a fan of loud music in restaurants that makes it hard to talk. After sitting down we waited almost ten minutes for anyone to notice us. My fiance ordered a cocktail that was delivered in a dirty glass. We had to wait over 20 minutes to have it changed, and the cocktail fell very short of its description. We barely saw our waiter and the other staff members seemed inexperienced. When my fiance's cocktail was changed a different waiter brought him a replacement. Since he whisked away the old one so fast we didn't get a chance to tell him what we ordered. When he came back with another cocktail we asked him if it was a WINter (the cocktail we originally ordered). He just shrugged. How do you now know what drink you brought us?We never saw a waiter other than to deliver food or to pick up empty glasses. No one came by to see how we were doing. Clearly, the waitstaff isn't used to circulating the room.The food itself was fine, but not spectacular. My mushroom omelet was a fine omelet but the fries on the side were greasy and limp. My fiance's brunch lasagna had underdone pasta and was rather dry (not surprising as there's no real sauce to speak of) and small. It needed something else, even something as simple as a side salad. The zeppoles were very tasty and quite dense/rich, probably the best part of our meal. All in all, I don't need to go back to Gastroteca. I can make myself an omelet (and frankly, a better french fry) and my home has a calmer atmosphere. I think if the staff were to get a better handle on service this place could be much better.

The zeppoles were very tasty and quite dense/rich, probably the best part of our meal. I can make myself an omelet (and frankly, a better french fry) and my home has a calmer atmosphere.

reviews: Ordered a California eggs benedict with home fries and a garlic-jalepeño bloody mary (it had some cute name but I forget). Service was good, food was very nicely prepared. Nothing to complain about but nothing remarkable either - pretty much what you would expect for the price point. The bloody Mary was disappointing. Lots of spice but not enough flavor & sort of watery. Served with pickled cauliflower, which was nice but really could have used some quality large green olives. It was not loud in there, definitely easy have a conversation and catch up with a friend. Atmosphere was spacious yet cozy and cute, not an easy combo to pull off. I would definitely go again. I would try a different drink.

reviews: The drinks here are STRONG. I came for brunch and had a shandy followed by two Moscow Mules and was definitely feeling the after effects, so don't let the cocktail prices set you off even though brunch drinks are typically a little cheaper.My friends got the fried chicken and waffles and the chicken sandwich, all of which were devoured. I got the fried eggplant and burrata sandwich, which was great. I think next time I'll ask for a little extra sauce. I felt there were a ton of greens on the sandwich, but not enough sauce and burrata to add to the mix. Something to consider if you like your eggplant extra sauce-y. Our server was really attentive, and I loved sitting next to the big front windows. Will definitely be back now that the sun is starting to come out, and they have some outdoor seating. I haven't been here for dinner yet, but looking forward to it!

reviews: This is my new favorite brunch place in all of Astoria. Authentic Italian perfection meets breakfast. Their Mmm mmm mimosa was perfect, their homemade Bloody Mary even passed my boyfriend's standards, and the food was incredible. It had some nice outdoor seating and I appreciated the 90s/00s pop music that brought me back to childhood. I very much appreciated that they were screening The Magic School Bus inside behind the bar. Our server Lexi was a stand out, she didn't forget a thing and impressed us with her chill, friendliness that we get so infrequently in NYC. This place made me want to move in on that block.

reviews: We stopped in before catching a movie on a chilly Saturday afternoon and were kinda surprised to see the place nearly full at 3pm. (Based on the Yelp reviews and our experience here, Gastroteca is a popular spot for events with large groups. On our day, it was somebody's 30th birthday and there was cake with sparklers.) We were seated right away, but grabbed the last spot in the house so otherwise we would've waited. Once we were seated, though, the experience was lightning fast. Our server was impressively speedy, which worked well for us because we were in a hurry, but I do wonder if this is a good place for a languid brunch.I decided to try the scampi & grits (shrimp, sausage, tomato, peppers, polenta, eggs). A note about the scampi: the sauce on this dish is not the garlicky butter sauce common to shrimp scampi dishes in the U.S. Instead, it has a meaty red sauce. Regardless, this is a great dish in terms of quality: the ingredients were quite fresh, the poached eggs oozed nicely onto the scampi, and the flavors mixed together well. It wasn't the most exciting thing in the world, however, and I found myself somewhat envying my boyfriend's brunch lasagna (béchamel, bacon, sausage, spinach, mozzarella, fried egg), which is really a unique concoction. I only had one bite, but the uncommon béchamel as a substitute for lasagna's red sauce was memorable. I also had a coffee cocktail, since I wanted both coffee and a cocktail. Unfortunately this isn't on the online menu, so I can't relay the exact ingredients. It was a tasty, if fairly standard, cold coffee liqueur drink. 3.5 stars.

I only had one bite, but the uncommon béchamel as a substitute for lasagna's red sauce was memorable. Unfortunately this isn't on the online menu, so I can't relay the exact ingredients.

reviews: Went for dinner last night. Pretty empty around 630-730pm on a Thursday, but with the Holidays and the bad weather it's understandable. Loved the music playing, 50s-60s music kept me singing softly at our table. HahaFor our appetizers I got the combination crostini. 2 orders of the Agrodolce Bacon with scallion ricotta and 1 order of the prosciutto with ricotta and fig jam. Both were delicious, but the bacon crostini was amazing!! Boyfriend ordered the crispy agrodolce pork belly which he loved. For the main course my boyfriend ordered the "Anatra", duck breast with vegetables and garlic mustard crema. He said the sauce was amazing. I ordered the Salmon with clam sauce which came with a few clams, crispy gnocchi and I substituted broccoli rabe with asparagus. Dinner was just delicious!! For dessert I ordered the Nutella bread pudding (yum) and boyfriend got the cheese board which was definitely enough for two people. All in all, great meal, great atmosphere, great waitstaff. Excited to come here for Brunch!! Go visit this place!!

reviews: Great service very attentive but the food ... the lasagna didn't have any flavor at all and the cavelli was mostly sauce

I'm embarrassed to say I have lived in Astoria for 3 years and just FINALLY went to Locale for dinner. It was Valentine's Day so they had a prix frixe menu for $60. Now, I normally wouldn't want to spend that much for my dinner (it is a recession, after all and I AM unemployed currently) however, I loved being forced to get an appetizer, entree, dessert and coffee. All the food was really good. I started with beef tartare which came with some delicious spicy mustard and got a fruit tart for dessert. I had fresh red linguini with jumbo shrimp as my main course (YUM) and got a pineapple mojito to drink (also YUM). The coffee at the end was a HUGE cup for the end of the night but I wasn't complaining. The one downside, food-wise, was my boyfriend's steak wasn't rare at all despite ordering it medium rare and them apparently being kind of a "steak place." That was a bummer but it did seem like the steak would have been delicious if it were actually rare. The restaurant itself is very cute and definitely highlighted for me how young Astoria as a neighborhood really is (or is getting). It's pretty small but we had a seat by the window so didn't have to sit in tables right next to each other. I can't wait to go back in summer to sit outside and try the margaritas that a friend has always recommended to me.

reviews: I must say, as a resident of Astoria, Locale is the greatest restaurant I've tried.  Not only is the decor charming and the service pleasant, but the food is absolutely incredible.  One bite and it speaks for itself.  I'd suggest starting out with a cocktail (or two!) because they are just incredible (the blood orange martini and the mojito are both amazing).  As for the food, the gnocchi is incredibly delightful and the antipasti appetizer is top notch -- I just can't get enough of this place!  The best entree I've eaten was the snapper special with red pepper coulis sauce over a bed of vegetable risotto (it was love at first bite).  I could go on and on about each dish I've eaten there, but alas, I'll spare you the details.  5 stars all the way.  I was referred here by my roommate and have since referred Locale to others.. needless to say, everyone is raving about it.

I could go on and on about each dish I've eaten there, but alas, I'll spare you the details. 5 stars all the way

Our waiter was very nice. We resisted the temptation to get appetizers. But we did get bread... and I seriously loved the bread. I love bread in general, but those breadsticks... ghakejrhg. Anyway... just bread, but I loved it. I ordered the gnocchi and my boyfrend ordered the lemon chicken. Both dishes were awesome. Just the right portions too. Whenever I order gnocchi I get this enormous portion that ends up just making me sick because I can't stop eating it. But this was perfect :D covered in lots of mozzarella. Overall, I enjoyed the food, and I saw other items on the menu I wanted to try, so I will definitely be going back!

reviews: I am a big fan of Locale and have been there many times.  I've taken a number of different friends over the last year and the reviews are all great.  Locale has a unique (without being pretentious) menu.  The food is fresh and tasty.  Their pasta dishes are very generous - the fagottini dish is a personal favorite.  Also for dessert, the peanut butter bomba is a must try!  The staff is also very friendly and attentive and there is great ambiance and a nice wine list.

reviews: This is our go-to Special Occasion place. The food is always outstanding, the drinks are wonderful, and they have excellent service. They are a little pricey, but completely well worth it. They cook everything to perfection, whether it be a special or a regular item. Delicious!
extracted: Delicious This is our go-to Special Occasion place. The food is always outstanding, the drinks are wonderful, and they have excellent service.

reviews: One of the best Italian restaurants in Astoria!  I absolutely love this place and so does my fiance.  We have had everything on the mebu and it is fantastic.  Great atmosphere, great food, great place!

reviews: i love locale, great place to eat and get drinks!!

This place never fails to let me down.  I have gone there many times for many different occasions ... casual Sunday brunch, dinner dates, Saturday night cocktails, and the atmosphere is flexible for all. The food is amazing and the portions are the perfect size, not too small and "foofy" and not so abundant where it is wasteful.  The steak special is to die for, artichoke ravioli is fantastic, a blueberry martini was superb. I also recommend the beet and goat cheese salad. One time I was there and the food took way too long and they made up for it with complimentary wine which was awesome.

reviews: Had dinner with a friend here on Saturday evening. The location and the ambiance of the restaurant is fantastic. Perfect for outdoor dining. For appetizer, we ordered fried long stemmed artichoke hearts. They were delicious! The artichokes were lightly friend and still juicy on the inside. It came on a bed of arugula and this delicious white sauce. My entree, i chose organic lemon chicken. Once again, it was delicious. The chicken was perfectly seared and cooked. I normally don't order chicken at restaurants b/c it can be bland, but the salt and flavor was just right. My friend wasn't too happy with her dish however. She ordered the squid ink pasta dish. She was happy with the taste of her dish, however the portions were too small for her liking. My only complaint was the pricing. I felt like the bill came out a little too high considering it's a neighborhood restaurant in Astoria. I would still come back though, especially to try their brunch!

She was happy with the taste of her dish, however the portions were too small for her liking. I felt like the bill came out a little too high considering it's a neighborhood restaurant in Astoria. I would still come back though, especially to try their brunch!

reviews: Meh, indeed. Mediocre all around. For brunch, at least. The eggs Benedict was served with a soft-boiled rather than poached egg. Wrong! Lazy, at best.There's little variety on the menu. This is not a problem if you do a select few dishes extremely well, but that's not the case at Locale. It's an interesting space if not entirely comfortable and the service was not bad. I really liked the music selection, but that should not be the main draw of a brunch place.
extracted: Mediocre all around It's an interesting space if not entirely comfortable and the service was not bad.

reviews: After living in the area for nearly 5 years this was hands down my favorite place to eat in the neighborhood. I've never encountered a bad experience. Always a jaw dropping selection of specials, great food, friendly service, reasonable prices given the quality, and nice atmosphere. A few people commented on the brunch, I've had the brunch once or twice and its definitely not as strong as their dinner menu, but I don't think of Local as a brunch place so its not really considered in my 5 starer.

Woke up to have brunch this morning in a group of 8 with no reservations. Yes, silly - I know.. however, we dropped by Locale and they were able to seat us within 20 mins. We started with Mimosas and Cappuccinos all around and within 15 - 20 mins our orders were coming out. I order the eggs benedict and my husband had the corned beef hash benedict. Yummy! Around the table, were orders of pancakes and burgers. Everyone loved the fresh food and it was a great atmosphere. It wasn't' too loud where we had to shout, but there was a little hustle and bustle, which I didn't mind at all. I saw groups of 4-6 all around and loved the cozy decor. I think this place is still a hidden and quaint local spot in Astoria and hope that we can still drop by, with no reservations, on any given morning with the same greeting and amazing food/service. Can't wait to come back in a bit when it's warmer to enjoy the outside seating! :)

I think this place is still a hidden and quaint local spot in Astoria and hope that we can still drop by, with no reservations, on any given morning with the same greeting and amazing food/service.

reviews: AMAZING!  My boyfriend and I love to come here for a treat date night.  The service is always great and the food is incredible.Have the specials...they are out of this world.  Not to mention a lot of their food is organic, free range or grass fed.  Love love love this place!!!

reviews: This place is the best in the neighborhood (south astoria).We've been for both romantic dinner and casual late brunch with friends several times and have always enjoyed the food & service.

reviews: I've never been disappointed with Locale. I've been wowed a few times and safisfied the rest with my meal and the service. As a rule and somewhat habit I always get their fish specials- the fish is always cooked perfectly and has a sauce that always compliments the natural flavor instead of masking it. The portions are always just perfect, and the presentation is always very stunning. If you're in the neighborhood and want a nice meal, definitely stop by!

Locale is a beautifully decorated corner  haunt, just for the "locals"...don't expect quick service, or consistency, but there is a "homey-ness" about the place that makes it a comfortable go to bar in the middle of Astoria. Everyone is as pleasant as pie... and the wine list isn't that bad either...
One additional thing i noticed about this place is that there's a huge mirror above the bar, tilted downwards, perfect for spying down your date's shirt. Yeah, I'm like 12... deal with it.

As Astoria begins to gentrify due to the onslaught of hipsters, ex-Wallstreet employees and the rest move out of the increasingly expensive city places like the trendy Locale being to pop up. With that being said this place does like up to the hype and the higher than normal prices are justified by the food. Last time I came here it was early summer and I ordered a glass of red wine with some black linguini in squid sauce tossed with seafood. The meal was exceptional, tasty and hot on arrival. The waiter service was sub-par and for that I can't give this place a 5 star rating. As the neighborhood continues to evolve as a second LIC I believe that Locale with become a hot spot so come down before it's over-run or played out.
extracted: As Astoria begins to gentrify due to the onslaught of hipsters, ex-Wallstreet employees and the rest move out of the increasingly expensive city places like the trendy Locale being to pop up. The meal was exceptional, tasty and hot on arrival. The waiter service was sub-par and for that I can't give this place a 5 star rating.

reviews: i'm so thrilled that this place is in my (old) neighborhood!  first things first- it's super cute...  sexy decor, an impressive bar and a nice raised loungey-area.  as for food, i've eaten here twice and i've not been disappointed.  their salads are creatively delicious (yay, i said it)  and they've always got host of features.  service is attentive and speedy, especially if you opt for an early dinner.  oh, and as for prices- totally reasonable... gotta love dining in an outer borough!all in all i highly recommend this place!

reviews: The food was delicious and the ambiance was incredible. I took a date there on a Saturday and we both loved everything about the place.

reviews: i came here for sunday brunch with the fam... and we were fans, all around!! atmosphere is great, wait staff is very attentive, and the food is delish!  3 of us had a different variation on eggs benedict... love their creativity!! i will be back!
extracted: atmosphere is great, wait staff is very attentive, and the food is delish! i will be back!

reviews: I'll admit the brunch can be hit or miss. The first time I went it was great. The second time not so much although it was mothers day and they were slammed and their credit card machine was down. The only thing that miffed me that trip was that it clearly says at the top of the brunch menu that a mimosa or bloody mary was included in the prix fixe brunch. Apparently not because the waitress charged us anyway and refused to take them off after we pointed out what was printed in black and white, her response was merely, "We don't do that anymore."Dinner is a different story though. Everything on the menu is delicious!  The first time we went my boyfriend had the fagottini alla barbabietole and he didn't shut up for a week about how amazing it was and now orders it every time we go. It's quickly become a neighborhood favorite
extracted: I'll admit the brunch can be hit or miss. "Dinner is a different story though. Everything on the menu is delicious!

reviews: I'd been to Locale before I even moved to the city, but this weekend was my first time back. The small restaurant is a few blocks off the subway line, tucked away in a residential part of Astoria. It has a great atmosphere that's a combination of restaurant and lounge, with a couches on an elevated area in the corner and floor-to-ceiling windows around the dining room. The restaurant was crowded, though I'd say it is a little pricey for the neighborhood, but the cuisine is definitely above average.We ordered the fried zucchini as an appetizer. It wasn't even on the menu, but our server suggested it, and we were pleased with the choice. The strips were lightly breaded and crispy, and not too greasy. There was a saucer of marinara sauce for dipping, but it was too chunky and the zucchini strips too thin to make it easy to dip into and get good 'coverage'. We also tried the crab cake, which was served with a dill sauce that I found to be a little overpowering, V liked it though. It wasn't that 'lumpy' but didn't seem to be loaded with much bread either.I ordered the seafood pasta which was served with a whole assortment of seafood: scallops, shrimp, clams, mussels, calamari and crab. There was a good amount of everything but some of it, like the scallops, was grainy. The pasta itself wasn't anything special, and the sauce wasn't quite what I expected, as it was rather thin. I had ordered the dish with a white sauce which was flavorful but thin, and didn't really stick to anything.Other times we've eaten at Locale the food was very good, and we tried tonight to keep the price down. I can imagine that at a restaurant like this you really get what you pay for, and there are some chef's specialties like the Mozzarella Olivata which is homemade cheese served hot with olives and tomatoes. It is distinctive and delicious. The restaurant has a great atmosphere, good crowd, good service and a unique take on the cuisine, I'll try it again sometime when my pocketbook can better take the hit.

It is distinctive and delicious The restaurant has a great atmosphere, good crowd, good service and a unique take on the cuisine, I'll try it again sometime when my pocketbook can better take the hit.

reviews: Went for brunch, had the special - omelet with broccoli Rabe and sweet sausage. Nothing spectacular but it was definitely good. The missus had the Benedict - again very good , but shy of something I would rave about and say you HAD to go and try. Nice atmosphere, prices I'd say average for the area. Should note we only went because cafe bar is closed for renovations. Glad I tried here finally and i would go back if someone wanted to go, but was happier at Fattys, flo and ovelia. Also note a bloody Mary was $7 so that wasn't gonna happen. Wish places lumped em in brunch price like Fattys (even if they're not "loaded" with vodka or celery and such - it's just nice to go with the meal).

reviews: I've been here a couple times for brunch and dinner. At no point did this place ever  blow me away.  They season everything way to salty here.  Once I ordered an eggs benedict and the yolk was almost cook through.  I think this place wants to take food the second level but the entrees are always lacking in a certain something making the meal unmemorable.  If you don't have a palate and want to eat whatever this is the place to go.

reviews: you have to be careful bc I've either had amazing food here or terrible food.  I had the lobster ravioli last time I went and it was so good.  My roommate got tomato soup for her appetizer and it was not good.  I also wish they had a better beer selection.  But I like the ambiance and the service.  It's definitely a nice spot!

reviews: No pun intended, but this place has become our local.  Whenever we want a drink on the way home or a late-night snack (kitchen open 'til 11:30), this is where we go.  The staff is hip and the food is good.  The appetizers are the best, with the braised meatballs and the fried artichoke hearts being my favorites.  If you're alone or don't want a big sit-down production, sit at the bar.  The bartenders are cool and are willing to experiment on any drink combination that you care to dream up.  If it's not busy, the waitstaff will join you at the bar.  It's kind of like hanging out at a friend's house.

reviews: the "Meh. I've experienced better." is exactly what applies to Locale. Who cuts a steak in half and serves it, seriously!! I can understand that it is upscale for the neighborhood, but I don't think it has anything that special, not for the price they charge. The wine is mediocre for the price and the service is very MEH.

reviews: I ordered the beets sauce purse pasta dish. I thought the dish was delicious and creative. Only draw back is that there should be a perk for eating in Astoria...yet the price is just like Manhattan. They should adjust their prices a bit because they are across from a bodega not in the middle of Chelsea.

reviews: I love this romantic little restaurant.  It's bare brick walls and dimly lit interior makes it a great date spot but without feeling stuffy or uptight.  It's a nice place to bring a friend to though, as it's not too loud or crowded to have a conversation and catch up with someone.  The food is good and the prices are reasonable.  There is outdoor seating, a big selling point for me in the summer!  They also have a cute little couch/lounging area that is great for a small group of friends to chill out, have a drink and an appetizer together before starting the night.

( Never really liked them until I started coming here.)    =)Had dinner a couple of times and was happy then too!  Drink specials are delicious.Go find out for yourself and enjoy!!!

We ordered a bottle of wine (very good by the way) and a cheese plate for 2.  The cheese plate was a bit of a disappointment, 3 tiny pieces of cheese doesn't constitute a cheese plate.  We made a comment to the hostess, and she graciously offered to give us a few more pieces.  Other than this, we had a nice experience at this place.
extracted: enjoy

reviews: Locale is another addition into the growing list of bistro type places in Astoria. Their menu runs the gamut from the classic continental cuisine, to french staples, to Mediterranean items.  Unfortunately, the lack of focus on the menu kinda translates into the food. I've eaten there several times and all the food I've had qualify as being "tasty" but nothing more. I've never had any PARTICULARLY really GOOD version of anything there. So why 4 stars? The atmosphere is really quite nice and it's on a quiet street in Astoria and I've always had a great time there. The drinks are good and strong; service is always excellent.
extracted: I've never had any PARTICULARLY really GOOD version of anything there. So why 4 stars The drinks are good and strong; service is always excellent.

reviews: I live around the corner from here, so have been here a few times before writing this review, so this isn't a one off bad experience. I don't think i'll be going here again. The waitstaff has been very unfriendly even though we said we live around the corner and have been here a couple of times. About the food--its just OK, I frankly don't understand what the hype is for. Yeah, the menu is more creative than a lot of the other places in Astoria, but that's not enough to make the food really top quality--taste-wise...I've had most things on the menu and nothing stood out especially. They usually have a long list of specials (almost too many specials if there's such a thing, not so special when there are more specials than what's on the menu, no?). the last time I went, I got duck something and the duck was rubbery and chewy (i've had duck before plenty of times, I know what it should taste like, so i'm not just making up stuff) and my boyfriend got some kind of sea bass which was on the specials and it was completely over salted and greasy.Not to mention, the food always takes a very very long time to come out--in fact this might be my biggest issue with Locale.The drinks are delicious. Brunch is good, however I recommend Stove over Locale for brunch. Sorry Locale, I gave you many many chances, we were so excited to have moved to your neighborhood, but very sorely disappointed with the service and quality of food. Their sister restaurant is Lucas Steakhouse which is about a thousand times better, but in a totally different restaurant category so one can't really compare.

reviews: Delicious Brunch menu. Fluffy, well cooked omelets, crispy bacon and of course mimosas. The mimosas/bellinis/bloody Marys are not included and are rather pricey in terms of drink per dollar. The mimosas were a bit small and light on the non-orange juice components. But overall, that was the most disappointing aspect of the meal. The southwestern omelet with jalapeno relish was quite good. Not too spicy, but adds just enough. The hash browns are intriguing. They come with peas and red peppers mixed in. Well seasoned though, so they earn points there.The atmosphere is nice. It feels like an upscale-ish sort of place, big glass windows, a separate eating area with more coffee-shop style cushions and low tables. A vaguely classical Greece/Rome motif adorns the walls, but overall, it's what you would expect from restaurant brunch, and non diner/Denny's brunch.The staff was friendly, and helpful. Can't complain there.Overall a positive brunching experience.

reviews: Disappointing brunch and overall experience. They had several parties going on and our food took over 40 minutes to arrive. When it did arrive one plate of egg Benedict's and waffles arrived cold. I had a breakfast burrito and it was small and stuffed entirely with rice. Keep in mind the waitress recommended the burrito, therefore I recommend the opposite of what the wait staff recommends. Some hack carrying himself as either an owner or manager said he would comp the craptastic waffles and then sent us a round of mimosas. Don't trust him either.   For brunch plates run about $12-15 and are not worth it. Better options in the area. Or for that fact stay home and cook yourself breakfast and understand that what you just made is comparably bad to the food at Locale. There is nothing local about this place and if you want maple syrup bring your own because you will get Aunt Jemima and a dumb look.

reviews: I ate here the other night with my boyfriend and it was awesome! The ambiance and service was good, but the food was by far the best part.  I had the salmon and it was absolutely delicious. It was cooked to perfection and super tasty!  This was my first time visiting this place and definitely will not be my last.  Food this well done is hard to find.  I'd recommend this restaurant to anyone that can appreciate good food, and a nice warm and cozy ambiance!

reviews: My friend who lives nearby told me how great this place was so we decided to eat here together.  I had a good feeling about Locale when I entered the restaurant.  Its open, modern decor exuded a bit of elegance mixed in with coziness which combined, made you feel welcome.  I ordered the calamari and the soup of the day, split pea while my friend orderd the tagliateIle with vegetables.  The split pea was incredible--having had split pea soups in the past, I felt this one was no ordinary soup. Let's say it had a rustic kick on top of that good ol' homecooked taste.  The calamari, though it was not that warm, was delicious due to its perfect crispiness and non greasy texture. My friend enjoyed her pasta thoroughly and continued to dabble on the sauce even though she finished her food.  We paired our food with the bottle of "Katurna", Croatian white wine and savored every sip until we were done. I plan on coming by to try their pasta dishes and soup again.  Its versatile furnishing and ambience are well suited for meals with a friend, group of friends/family, or a date and offers food for everyone-- foodies, meat lovers, vegetarians, pesceterians...well, you get the picture. However, don't expect huge portions of pasta here.

Suffice it to say, the meal was delish and I was thoroughly impressed! After being a brunch regular and a huge fan of their nutella french toast, it was nice to see their evening fare make such a strong showing.

reviews: Reliably good food, nice quiet atmosphere, love the decor.

i've been to locale twice for dinner, and it's been really good experiences both times.  it's a nice space, and is decorated well, although they only have a few dining tables in the front.  there's a full bar on the left side of the restaurant, and then a lounge area in the back that you can also eat in.  overall, it has a nice bar/lounge/candlelight ambiance - i'm definitely one for moods when dining.the food i had was pretty good, although i guess the prices are a bit high for queens.  they don't have an extensive menu, but i think you can definitely find something you'd like.  their tri colore salad is the best i've ever had.  but, it attracts a younger, hipper manhattan-like crowd, and the waiters are all pretty cute :-)another great 'night out in astoria' option.

My babes had the Organic Lemon Chicken and it was Divine!!...best sauce, very tender chicken, yummy skin (just a little)...awesome chicken dish and this is coming from a chicken-non lover. I loved his dish. Good wine. Good service, pricey but they are on restaurant.com now. I noticed some people were just having drinks...so maybe I would recommend this as a spot for a drink and a dessert, not necessarily dinner.

An excellent value and always a lovely experience.

Their basil pesto and the garlic flavor is exceptional and don't forget to try it with the mash potato in the middle :)

reviews: Good food, nice atmosphere, great service.  If you are going to get anything from the daily specials you might want to ask the price, otherwise you might end up with a $40 steak, but it was well worth it in my case. They have really good deserts too.

reviews: This is absolutely a neighborhood favorite!  Whether it's dinner, drinks or brunch, Locale is consistently superb.  The service is always kind and attentive and, above all, the food is really tasty - simply, but well done!  Astoria has a ton of restaurants, but they're not all sure bets like Locale!  I come here with my younger sister and mom, and our three varying palates are always satisfied here.  I totally recommend the Cheddar Polenta on the Brunch Menu along with a Passion Fruit Mimosa!  If you're around for dinner, the fish entrees are always spot on, and the steaks are perfectly done!

reviews: My friends and I seem to gravitate to this charming bar/restaurant situated on the corner of a quiet street in Astoria. We always order from the specials. Excellent appetizers, fish, lamb and filet mignon. Flavored Martini's sweeten things up. The ambience is just right to savor your dish and the company you're with. We've dined here since 2005 and the waitstaff have always been courteous and accommodating.

This is my favorite spot in Astoria. Dates, Birthdays, Visitors from Out of Town, or even just a casual drink, there's nothing quite like this place in the neighborhood. The servers are all so friendly, knowledgeable, and can actually be really funny. I came here with a big group for a birthday a few weeks, and our server really made our night. The food is delicious and beautifully presented. Our favorites included the Steamed Mussels, Duck Breast, and Fagotini pasta. The music and atmosphere are really great, super chic, and a lot more original than most places in the neighborhood. At night, it's got a pretty sexy feel, so if you're aiming to impress, this needs to be your new date place. Have not been for brunch yet, but I've heard it's amazing. If you haven't checked this place out, you should definitely give it a try. I'll probably be there sipping one of their Specialty Cocktails with my girlfriends!

I would go there again but avoid the blonde waitress with the possibly fake European accent.

I would definitely come back for drinks and to check out the brunch, but i don't think this is the spot for dinner.

reviews: Just a joint ---best for weekend brunch on the food end. If you want to hang out for drinks in the evening fine, but dinner elsewhere is a much better idea. More for the scene than serious gourmet.

reviews: One of the gems (along with Brick Cafe and Cafe Mundo) of the venturing beyond 30th Ave and Broadway. Great food, both at brunch and dinner - we're huge fans

My husband and I went for dinner on Wed for a date, since it had been months since we were alone for dinner (we have a 7 month old baby) and we chose Locale. I regret this choice.     I order the fried calamari, and my husband ordered the special app, sweet bread. The calamari was chewy, and not crispy, so I returned. The waitress was really nice, and she apologized and asked if I wanted to change it for something else, but I didn't. My husband's app was tasteless, it had no salt!   For the main course I ordered the garganelli with peas and prosciutto,  which was dry, and also tasteless. My husband had the special, the duck. which also had no flavor and wasn't properly cooked. For dessert we ordered the chocolate souffle. The waitress told us that it would take 10 minutes since it was made to order. It actually took them 20 minutes!....and when it finally arrived it was completely dry! No melted chocolate inside. I was looking forward to this night, and was dissapointed with my experience in this restaurant.Although the service was excellent we would never go back.

reviews: My first experience with the restaurant family was at the Lucas where I was floored by the prices (same as manhattan) but floored again by the service (best in astoria).  Our server Ryan was perfect with every nuance.  Needless to say I was excited to explore it's sister restaurant, Locale but much to my disappointment, the did not deliver.  We started  with the beet salad with the goat cheese puck(which we had at Lucas).  The difference was execution;  it was bland, the colors ran to the point that it looked like it was shaken to toss, and the worst part was the goat cheese pad was obviously microwaved in saran wrap (everyone knows the smell and how it dries out cheese) and not toasted.  the entrees were mediocre and very over priced (you pay for ambience, nice space) and the bartender (male) was somewhat snobby and unwilling to socialize.  I will only return for a glass of wine at the bar, will never spend another dime on that over showcased, overpriced food.

reviews: I went to Locale last night, Saturday May 9, for dinner.  We have been here many times before.  It is one of our favorite spots in Astoria.  Last night we went in around 10:30 p.m.  and the place was packed.  The manager/hostess told us it would be a few minutes and suggested we grab a drink at the bar.  We found two seats at the end of the bar, next to the service station.  There were two bartenders, both clearly saw us sit down, and both clearly ignored us.  We waited about 10 minutes before I politely asked the girl-bartender if we order drinks from her?  She responded, "Just give me a minute."  I know restaurants/bars get busy, but one of them could have said, "Hi, I'll be right with you."  Or "Hey, just give us a minute were busy."  Clearly, putting away glasses doesn't need to be done before helping a customer.  When we were about to order our drinks the manager/bartender came over and told us our table was ready.  So, we opted to order our drinks with our server because the bartenders were SO RUDE.  A breath of fresh air!  The server was such a sweet girl!  She was attentive and friendly.  We almost left, but I'm glad we didn't because we love Locale.  Sam, another server there, is great, too.  The manager came over and apologized at the end of our dinner.  I highly recommend this place, BUT DON'T  SIT AT THE BAR!  At least I know I will never again.

The place has way too many tables and gets extremely full on certain nights! We were seated in a corner by the window and could barely make it by all the other people without disturbing them. The food was OKAY but way too overpriced. It seems that they need to hire more servers since we had to ask about our meal and the check more than twice. Overall the place is trendy but they want to charge Manhattan prices for a place in Queens. I say they are overrated. Drinks were good.

reviews: Beautiful and impressive interior  on this ever changing avenue...The sidewalk in the summertime has a tendency of being packed and there is usually a waiting list...it can be quite a scene ( but not in the obnoxious 30th avenue type of the way - all you Astorians know what I mean).The food is delicious and the pineapple mojitos are a must...don't have too many...the morning after is a b$%@h.

For the most part the service appears to be attentive but is really quite a mess.  They try to give the illusion that they care but for the most part they could be bothered.  They have had one or two good waiters/waitress' but they have gone down hill since.  Avoid the waiter with the woverine sideburns at all costs.  The tables are ridiculously small for the amount of things they want to put on them.  If you order a bottle of wine and bottle of water prepare to balance your main course on your nose.  You would think they would have wine stands by now since they fancy themselves as a more sophisticated restaurant.  Recently they have added glass bowls the size of a small goldfish bowl to house one lone floating rose (not a great use of space to say the least).  The ambiance is wonderful once you get past the cramped quarters and the food is ok, not great.  Don't break your back trying to have dinner in the "lounge".  The seats are great for having a cocktail but deadly when trying to have a meal.  The better choice for this place is going for drinks not dinner...

The decor is very cute like the white brick wall and a Lady and the Tramp drawing by the full stocked bar. Andrea G. got a Decaf Coffee with her California Benedict and I glanced quickly at the menu but my eyes were fixated on the Scampi & Grits. When our food finally came out of the kitchen, my friend checked on her poached eggs just to make sure that the yoke oozes out but it didn't so we waved at a bunch of people cornering by the bathroom to sent it back. Seriously how do you mess up on poached eggs but the second time was perfection as the delicious yoke flows out onto the plate...that's what I am talking about. OMG my dish was superbly del-ic-iousssssss you know. I couldn't tell the difference from grits and polenta unless its the same thing but mmmmmmmm love the shrimps and sausage combination and there was definitely some heat from the peppers and tomato sauce! The Event Coordinator, Jordan, and GM were so patient and helpful as we planned every detail. Jordan met with us twice to confirm the layout, menu and special touches (nudge,nudge: they can project  movies or slideshows that match your event). The day of, everything was set up before we got there. The servers were super attentive to us and our guests. We had 3 guests with gluten allergies, so the GM personally spoke with each guest to make sure they received the appropriate meal. Overall, had a lovely and relaxed time! I would highly recommend Gastroteca for a private event oe dinner. Would likely do it again myself in the future!

Jordan met with us twice to confirm the layout, menu and special touches (nudge,nudge: they can project  movies or slideshows that match your event). The servers were super attentive to us and our guests. I would highly recommend Gastroteca for a private event oe dinner. Would likely do it again myself in the future

reviews: My husband and I went to Gastroteca for the first time tonight. Our food was excellent. He said the little neck clams with sausage may have been one of the best seafood dishes he ever had. The lasagna bolognese was also delicious. The entire staff, including our server Kristen, were super nice and attentive. We met the owner, who was very kind and took good care of us. Will return again with friends.

reviews: Don't get me wrong, the food was good! BUT I ordered the gnocchi for brunch and it was $16, no problem at all, but when it came, it was so small compared to the other plates my family ordered, and it was the most expensive out of all of them. I ordered a hot latte, it was good at first but it started tasting like acetone after a while. Service was pretty slow for a small place. We waited 10-15 minutes just for the waitress to come after our meal was over, and she didn't bring the check until asked. Don't know if I'd come again.

Service was pretty slow for a small place. Don't know if I'd come again.

reviews: Checked this place out for Sunday brunch and it was just okay. Their menu was decent - nothing too crazy. I thought the mimosa was very bland which was disappointing. We ordered the following:Italian fried chicken & buttermilk waffle - my first time having "chicken and waffles" combo and thought it was pretty good. The waffle itself was chewy and soft and the fried chicken was flavorful. It wasn't overwhelming in any way.                                                                                 Smoked Atlantic Salmon Crostino - ordered this after reading many reviews and scrolling through pictures. I highly recommend ordering this! I love smoked salmon and it went really well with the dill ricotta and bread. Definitely pair this with their home fries!

The waffle itself was chewy and soft and the fried chicken was flavorful. I highly recommend ordering this Definitely pair this with their home fries

reviews: Excellent service! Delicious food and cocktails! cant wait to go back again with my fiancé! highly recommend if you look delicious Italian food!
extracted: Delicious Delicious food and cocktails cant wait to go back again with my fiancé highly recommend if you look delicious Italian food!

reviews: Was so pleasantly surprised by how good the food was. We got the lasagna and the maltagliati with pork ragu. At first glance it looks like it's in tomato paste but it wasn't, it was lighter than it looked in a mild flavored sauce. I ate the whole dish. We also had the straciatella with poached pear. It was delish. Could have used a bit more pear as the slice of bread was sizable but overall the crunch of the crostini was a nice surprise as at first it didn't look toasted. Yes, crostini should be but didn't look it. We also had the chocolate cake which had three great textures and flavors going for it minus the vanilla gelato. Very good! The waiter was terrific from the moment we sat till we left, just outstanding. Would give five stars but the food wasn't hot.

reviews: Came in for brunch Sunday early afternoon. We made a reservation which I highly recommend as the place got really packed. I couldn't decide what to order because everything on the menu sounded amazing. Went with the brunch lasagna and WOW! Split the Texas toast as a dessert and that was so delicious. Couldn't imagine eating the entire dish so splitting that was perfect!Service was okay.I'll have to be back to try the rest of the menu!

reviews: Meal was good. Brunch meal cost with tip for 2 - less than $40. Salmon crostino - bread was a bit too toasty and hard but good ingredients. California benedict also tasty but bread was difficult to cut through (too spongy).
extracted: California benedict also tasty but bread was difficult to cut through (too spongy).

reviews: Went here for brunch on a Saturday. Got a seat right away which was really nice. Good menu with a variety of choices. Note they only have whole milk when ordering lattes which deterred me from ordering one but my brother got a mocha latte and enjoyed it.The spinach and goat cheese omelette was pretty good. The piece of toast and the home fries it came with were delicious. My brother said that his dish, the smoked salmon crostino, was spicy and ok. Not sure he would get it again but he agreed that the bread and home fries were great and he would come again to try something new.

reviews: Me and my fiancée went here for dinner and drinks and we both were very impressed. It's a great little Italian  restaurant in the heart of astoria. We started the night off with a few drinks. She had a lambrusco red wine and i had a Bold Fashion.(very strong lol)We ordered the fried calamari and you get a good portion for your money. The taste was very good and you can tell that the calamari was fresh. Our main course consisted of Cavatelli and Fruit De Mare Siciliano. My meal was very good with a good mixture of seafood and sauces. My fiancée meal was a good portion as well with a good blend of taste. The atmosphere was nice and low key- We happend to go and they were playing Back to the future on the projector screen lol which made my day. We also heard that every Thursday  is all night happy hour.  Definitely need to check that out. Overall-If your looking for a nice Italian restaurant with a great bar attentive staff and good prices then this is place to go.

reviews: My parents and I were in town last week to go to the U.S. Open so I did a little yelping and decided to give this place a try.  We were all extremely pleased! We made a reservation for 7:30 on a Sunday night although when we got there we probably wouldn't have even needed it.  They were able to seat us outside which was just lovely.  The ambiance of the inside was very comfortable looking as well so I think we would have been happy no matter where we sat.  My dad ordered the Kale Caesar Salad and my mom and I ordered the shaved brussels sprout salad.  Both were delicious! The Brussels Sprout Salad was a good size to split to save room for dinner.  For dinner I ordered the Crispy Gnocci which was DELICIOUS. It was also such a great portion size, so I was able to finish it and still have room for dessert! My mom and dad were also very pleased with their Cavatelli and Spaghetti Stracchino.  For dessert we ordered the angels food cake and nutella french toast bread pudding, not a crumb left of either.  Between all that, a bottle of wine, and two beers our total was only $140 so we were pleasantly surprised by that! The staff were all very nice and our waiter was very helpful offering opinions on dishes when we asked so it was a very enjoyable evening! I highly recommend trying this place if you're in the neighborhood looking for a casual dinner spot for a reasonable price!

Both were delicious For dinner I ordered the Crispy Gnocci which was DELICIOUS It was also such a great portion size, so I was able to finish it and still have room for dessert! The staff were all very nice and our waiter was very helpful offering opinions on dishes when we asked so it was a very enjoyable evening!

reviews: A bit of a disappointment after reading so many great things about Gastroteca. Came here one night for dinner, and the meal started off great with well crafted cocktails. However, the dishes we ordered were ok, but nothing to write home about. The "crispy" gnocchi seemed more like an excuse to describe the pasta as "overdone." The pistachio pesto served with it was tasty, but in this foodie era of trying to be different, "crispy" fell short of any worthy accolades. The crostini had good flavor combinations but again, read more like burnt toast. The decor was nice, and the staff charming, but I don't think we will be returning for dinner. From what I've read, I believe brunch is moreso in this restaurant's wheel house, so I will be back to give it another try!

reviews: We stumbled on Gastroteca on a whim due to other Yelp reviews! And we don't regret it. The exterior of the restaurant needs a sign for newcomers though. Upon arriving, we were seated at a table for two right away. The waiter came by asking for water preferences and drinks. We had tap water with a glass of orange juice. The juice was so fresh.Our entrees consisted of steaks and eggs and the crispy gnocchi. The steak was medium and the eggs were well done sprinkled with Italian seasoning Which was an interesting mix up! The fries were crispy on the outside and soft on the inside, absolutely perfect. As for the spinach salad it was dressed lightly. No complaints.The crispy gnocchi was not as crispy as I wished. They were a little soft and mushy. The gnocchi was dressed in a pesto cheese sauce that was great and topped with more cheese. Who doesn't love cheese? But delicious nonetheless. If the portion was smaller it would serve as a great appetizer. Overall, I would recommend this restaurant to my friends and I will definitely be back to try the grits and carbonara.

As for the spinach salad it was dressed lightly No complaints.The crispy gnocchi was not as crispy as I wished. But delicious nonetheless If the portion was smaller it would serve as a great appetizer. Overall, I would recommend this restaurant to my friends and I will definitely be back to try the grits and carbonara.

reviews: One of my favorite places for brunch. The Belgian waffles ($12) are amazing and the Lamb & Spinach Hash ($14) are good too. Orange juice ($3) is a perfect side. The ambience inside the restaurant has a nice vibe.
extracted: One of my favorite places for brunch The ambience inside the restaurant has a nice vibe.

reviews: There are so many reviews here for brunch but their dinner menu was fantastic. Gastroteca is probably a great place to bring dates or friends - the restaurant itself is beautiful with walls of glass facing the street on two sides, simple chandeliers, and cosy seating. When I went there was no wait, and they were screening old movies (no sound) on the wall over the bar. Let's just start by saying that the service was definitely 5 star worthy - everyone was so nice and helpful. We ordered the housemade baked mozzarella, the Atlantic salmon (with clam sauce), and also ravioli de zucca and spicy cavatelli with clams. The salmon was a p.e.r.f.e.c.tly cooked medium like we asked with a crackly crust, and my friend wouldn't share her ravioli because it was apparently that good. Next time we'll definitely try the crispy gnocchi appetizer. It was used as a garnish on the salmon and it was really good!

Next time we'll definitely try the crispy gnocchi appetizer. It was used as a garnish on the salmon and it was really good!

reviews: I came here for brunch for Mother's Day. There were a lot of empty tables that were supposedly reserved, but no one ever got seated the entire hour that we were around. We ended up sitting at the bar because we were short on time and it ended up being great because the bartender was super attentive and friendly, offering us coffee right away and refills constantlyWe started with the meatballs; they were super moist and just over all delicious. The only thing was that no one ever gave us plates, so we had to use our hands and some sauce got on the bar. My mom got the vegetarian benedict, while my brother got the lamb hash benedict and both thought each one was really yummy. They especially liked the home fries that came with the dish. I got the brunch lasagna, which was also delicious, but the bottom lasagna layer was very tough... Not sure why, but the inside was the important part and who's complaining with losing a layer of carbs? TLDR; Great brunch place; might want to make reservations.

Not sure why, but the inside was the important part and who's complaining with losing a layer of carbs?

reviews: I came here for brunch one afternoon with my sister. The place was empty. The server seated us in one section and hung out, out of sight which made it difficult for us to wave him down when we needed water refills or napkins or our check. The food overall was beautifully presented but the flavors were lacking. The eggs benedict tasted like "a big egg mcmuffin" in the words of my sister. I ordered the salmon dish which I thought was very good. The salad that came on the side was SUPER SALTY. DO NOT EAT. it was so salty my tongue was all shriveled up I wasn't sure if I could continue on.
