reviews: Food it's okish but waiter service really sucks. Price expensive comparing to other restaurants like this.
extracted: Price expensive comparing to other restaurants like this

reviews: Thank you Gastroteca and waiter for making me enjoy such a wonderful brunch meal with my love. Im really grateful that a delicious and classy brunch place like this is open on weekdays as well! I had a great meal! I ordered a Atlantic salmon crostino and a side of home fries: the ricotta matches the salmon real well topped with a runny eggs. Loves the home fries because they were a perfect side.3 for $10 Crostino mix: prosciutto kind, salumi with brie and roasted red pepper fontina. LOVED IT! Depending on your taste the salumi was super flavorful while the red pepper was a delight and hearty.Lastly ordered the rigatoni carbonara! Carbonara is really hard to find in the US made correctly. Love the guanciale and the pasta noodles were so fresh you could taste it! I have no complaints for this restaurant! I would recommend the restaurant any day! Wonderful service and delightful food!* There was a fly in the restaurant. But it didnt bother me during my time there!

Love the guanciale and the pasta noodles were so fresh you could taste it! I would recommend the restaurant any day! Wonderful service and delightful food  There was a fly in the restaurant

reviews: What I liked about this place was that it was cute. But other than that I would not go back. I went here after work one day with my two coworkers to get an early dinner & drinks. We were the only ones inside at about 3:30 in the afternoon. Upon entering I smelled mop cleaner throughout the place. That bothered me. We were told we could sit anywhere. I liked the set up of the place. It's very comfortable and quaint.I didn't care for the menu at all. It is very sparse. They have two sandwiches and one burger choice. A few brunch items and several pasta dishes that they claim all pasta is in house made. No bread basket brought out, no sangria on their menu.I ordered a chicken club sandwich. The bread was too hard. They had melted cheese on top of the top bread then places a wet pickle spear on top which wet the bread. There was supposed to be a garlic aioli on the sandwich but there was barely any. The avocado was turning brown. And there was maybe one or two very thin slices of chicken breast on the bottom. The prosciutto that it was supposed to have on it didn't taste good at all. It came with fries. Those were crispy and seasoned well. But not worth $12 at all. The waiter took out order and never came back. We had to all the host for more napkins.
extracted: But other than that I would not go back. We were told we could sit anywhere. It's very comfortable and quaint.I didn't care for the menu at all. It is very sparse. There was supposed to be a garlic aioli on the sandwich but there was barely any And there was maybe one or two very thin slices of chicken breast on the bottom. Those were crispy and seasoned well

reviews: A fun brunch spot, with a broad menu. Good food and hard working service. Come for the chicken and waffles! Stay for the cocktails.
extracted: Good food and hard working service Come for the chicken and waffles Stay for the cocktails

reviews: This review is solely on the service and not the food, as that was great.You would think that the service would be great, if not wonderful especially on a Sunday Afternoon, with no crowds and a call was placed in advance just incase we weren't able to get a seat, as it was a group of 6 people. The service was horrible! Which was funny because the week prior a friend and I went to Gastroteca and had a wonderful experience. This week thinking that the service would be just as great, we decided to bring friends/family...it was not. Our reservation was for 5:30pm and our group had arrived around 5:10pm. Thinking we would be able to sit down earlier than expected as we were a little early on time, but we were very wrong. None of the staff members, who were either on their phones, or eating, decided to assist in any way. Even after 2 individuals from the group approached the restaurant employee (on separate occasions) asking in regards to our table, both times we received an answer not suggesting that they would seat us. I am not sure what it was..maybe it was because we were a culturally different group of people or maybe because we had a child amongst us, but it wasn't until we noticed that other people were being seated other than us that we decided to go to another restaurant down the block. I thought the wonderful experience that I originally had going to Gastroteca would be a similar one today, I was truly disappointed that it was not. In all honesty, because of this experience, I would probably never go back here or recommend this establishment to any friend or family member that I know.

reviews: Food was rather satisfying, and paired well. BUT, the service was absolutely horrendous. - Check out below for my reviews of various aspects of our brunch venture.FOOD (4/5): - It was hit or miss for my family, but I enjoyed 3/4 dishes we had. I had the chicken and waffles, my mom the Shrimp and Grits, sister had the Nutella French Toast, and my grandmother the Lamb Hash. The name of the game here is simplicity. The chef paired flavors very well together, and executed. There were some issues though. A glaring one was that there was virtually no grits in the Shrimp & GRITS dish. They seemed to serve polenta instead, and it was the one under-executed aspect. The grits, sorry, polenta was so soft it could have been mistaken for a sauce. Besides the polenta mixup, I believe the food was notable overall.SERVICE - Terrible. Perhaps it was the server we had, but I felt like such a stranger. Our server wasn't rude by any means, and our food was brought out on time. The issue wasn't with what happened, but rather what did not happen.First off, I never felt or server was pleasant. I think he smiled once, maybe. But, whatever no need to smile, that's cool. My issue is that once he took our orders he never came back. Our waters were never refilled, we were never checked up on, etc. As a matter of fact, he never looked our way; I know b/c I was trying to get his attention to ask for some hot sauce. The only time I got his attention was when I had to say "excuse me, may we have the check".Now please don't take me for being pretentious or stuck up. I would like to think that I'm very down to Earth, and try to be as forgiving as possible. I, however, really felt neglected in this restaurant as if we did something wrong. Apologies if we did something wrong, but I honestly don't believe we did (I noticed this server treating others the same way). DECOR- Pretty trendy. It was a quaint environment... sort of felt like we were in a nice loft. It was fun to watch the movies being played on the wall near the bar. The music was fun as well, but I some may not like it (I liked it a lot).OVERALL- Food was good, and I can't really complain. Hopefully the service issue was a one time thing b/c I'm definitely interested in revisiting this joint. I feel it has a lot of potential (compliments to the chef), and am interested in seeing what a dinner menu has to offer!** Apologies for the lack of pictures. Idk what happened to me, but I totally forgot to take them =/

Besides the polenta mixup, I believe the food was notable overall.SERVICE - Terrible. The issue wasn't with what happened, but rather what did not happen.First off, I never felt or server was pleasant. I would like to think that I'm very down to Earth, and try to be as forgiving as possible. The music was fun as well, but I some may not like it (I liked it a lot).OVERALL- Food was good, and I can't really complain. reviews: When it's a holiday you should brunch the day away. The brunch lasagna from @gastroteca_astoria is nothing short of #presidential . Bechamel sauce, bacon, sausage, spinach and mozzarella all baked together in breakfast matrimony and topped with a fried egg.  #baked #lasagna #brunch #holiday #eggs #yolkporn #bacon #sausage #breakfast #idreamofqueens #pasta #wakeandbake #astoria #qtgm

I'm so bad. I've only been to brunch in Astoria a few times. Slowly making my way around the area and that's when I stumbled upon Gastroteca. Seeing very positive reviews for both brunch and dinner, I figured I'd check it out! What first caught my eye were the prices - super reasonable. They have a decent amount of options for brunch (no boozy specials, sorry) so it was definitely hard to pick. Luckily I went with Winnie and she graciously agreed to splitting entrees. We ordered their usual on the menu item, the Shrimp Scampi and Grits. It had sausage, tomato, pepper over polenta and a fried egg. The sauce was a tad bit tangy and went perfectly with the smooth creamy polenta base. I really enjoyed the dish, it was rich but not too filling. Also, the shrimp were cooked well.We also ordered the special: the Chicken and Waffles - they were crusted with a cornmeal coating and topped with a maple honey butter. DAMN, this was good. The chicken was crispy yet tender and the maple butter was an especially nice touch. I would definitely order this again. It was a nice portion too.Aside the food, I really enjoyed the atmosphere as well. Although Gastroteca emits more of a gothic vibe with the black and red decorations - the place is airy, spacious and I love those big bright floor-to-ceiling windows. Can't wait to come back for dinner time. Looking forward to it.
extracted: enjoy Seeing very positive reviews for both brunch and dinner, I figured I'd check it out! Also, the shrimp were cooked well.We also ordered the special: the Chicken and Waffles - they were crusted with a cornmeal coating and topped with a maple honey butter. The chicken was crispy yet tender and the maple butter was an especially nice touch. I would definitely order this again. Looking forward to it

reviews: This is an amazing gem of a place in Astoria. Love the vibe, the food is delicious yet not pretentious. Mark the bar tender is personable, friendly, and made us feel so relaxed. Extensive selection of drinks from cocktails to wines to aperitifs. For all the high quality they are not above a good happy hour. We had the arancini, calamari, pear salad, and banana zeppoli for dessert.  All were delicious but the zeppoli were off the charts phenomenal. The vintage movies being projected on the white washed brick walls are an added charm to the place. Can't you tell we love this place?

Extensive selection of drinks from cocktails to wines to aperitifs All were delicious but the zeppoli were off the charts phenomenal The vintage movies being projected on the white washed brick walls are an added charm to the place.

reviews: Pleasant service, but i think a bit understaffed. There was only 1 waitress during the busiest part of dinner and i think she did her best. Ambience: intimate, warm. Love the look of the bar. Really liked the old film projected in the brick wall behind the bar.Food: veal meatballs were tender and tasty but sauce was underseasoned. Bread to go with sauce was garlicky but i didn't like that one end of it was already dipped into the sauce plate because it got a little soggy. Complimentary bread basket and olive oil was really good! I don't know why it came out after our appetizers were brought to us since it was cold bread anyway... not like it was being newly prepared in the back. Entrees were spaghetti carbonara and gnocchi with gorgonzola sauce. Carbonara was good, but tasted a little like chicken bullion powder. Pasta was cooked well. Less fatty and creamy than other versions i've had but i actually liked that. The gnocchi was dense and gluey, sauce was good for first few bites but since it was very creamy, i had trouble finishing portion even though it was not that big. Dessert was warm chocolate cake and gelato. Pretty standard but tasted good. Pricing was very reasonable and a big reason why i would return.

Complimentary bread basket and olive oil was really good! Carbonara was good, but tasted a little like chicken bullion powder. Pasta was cooked well The gnocchi was dense and gluey, sauce was good for first few bites but since it was very creamy, i had trouble finishing portion even though it was not that big. Pretty standard but tasted good Pricing was very reasonable and a big reason why i would return.

reviews: I'm in love with Eggs Benedict so when we arrived, that was all that was on my mind.  When I cut into my eggs, immediately water spilled out of it all over my plate then followed the yolk.  My entire meal became wet and soggy including my home fries .  Everything was also flavorless (most likely from all that water).  Staff is friendly and courteous but I probably won't return.
I went for the first time for Sunday Brunch and had a really good time. I had the California Benedict, which was an amazing option instead of the Eggs florentine.
extracted: I went for the first time for Sunday Brunch and had a really good time.

reviews: Came on a Monday evening at 5:30 so it was relatively quiet.  Had our choice of sitting inside or out. The service was attentive.  My friend ordered an excellent cocktail that had "iced tea" in the name. The food was nice but not that memorable.  I ordered the seafood stew.  Most enjoyable thing  about this place is the relaxed ambiance and cocktails.
extracted: enjoy Came on a Monday evening at 5:30 so it was relatively quiet. Had our choice of sitting inside or out The service was attentive. The food was nice but not that memorable.

reviews: I was really looking forward to having brunch here this past weekend, but was a bit disappointed. The food was mediocre, as was our dessert - the sandwiches were skimpy on the inside with tons of bread on the outside, and the french toast bread pudding w/ nutella was tough and chewy... On the plus side, the waitress was friendly and good, and the coctails were tasty, especially the bourbon bloody mary. It's a good thing I had great company. Maybe next time I'll just stick to a drink at the bar... or not. I doubt there will be a next time.

reviews: Fabulous little gem in the heart  of Astoria .If you are looking  for a selective brunch this is the place to be. I order the Italian  Benedict the hollandaise sauce  was exquisite and to top it all the banana Ricotta  Zeppole  are to die for.

reviews: Place is nice and airy but their brunch menu is so blend. It would be a good place to meet a friend for drinks

reviews: The Nutella French Toast Bread Pudding was too good, and so was the sea bass and rosemary chicken. Very cute interior with a film projected onto the wall behind the bar (while I was there Gentlemen Prefer Blondes was playing).

Gastroteca is a very airy gem in the residential areas of Long Island City, perhaps bordering on Astoria?  I love their high ceilings, tall windows, outdoor seating, and decor. Our waitress was very enthusiastic and knowledgable of the menu.  My friends and I all had their smoked salmon crostino, which is an Italian variation of the classic brunch Norwegian Benedict. While the salmon was fresh, the egg perfectly half runny, crostino toasted to excellence, I still prefer the classic on English muffins. I also highly recommend their mango juice. Drink it before the ice melts because it has the perfect consistency right when it's prepared. I didn't like their iced coffee so don't come here for good coffee. Dessert, we tried Panna cotta and tiramisu. I would skip the former and dig in the latter, yum!  Best tiramisu I have had in Queens!Bonus 10% off bill when you check in on Yelp!  It was honored no problem.
extracted: Gastroteca is a very airy gem in the residential areas of Long Island City, perhaps bordering on Astoria? Our waitress was very enthusiastic and knowledgable of the menu. While the salmon was fresh, the egg perfectly half runny, crostino toasted to excellence, I still prefer the classic on English muffins. I also highly recommend their mango juice I would skip the former and dig in the latter, yum! It was honored no problem

reviews: Very sad to write this review but the service was TERRIBLE. Took about an hour from when we sat down to get our "table food". Thankfully the food was good so the wait for the next 25 minutes for our entrees was worth it. Sitting outside and having to go inside because we are weren't offered a refill of our water is not the way to go. And to say that there were large parties inside yes I do see that. I also saw a "large party" of two who sat down 30-35 minutes after us. Sit. Eat. Get their check before we even got our entree. All and all I can't imagine the service to be that bad on a daily basis especially after lookin at at other reviews however very disappointing to say the least.

reviews: I great spot to have Friday brunch. Its corner location provides plenty of natural lighting that makes the place stand out. Although we had one waitress when our party was there, she was very attentive to everyone. The brunch menu was priced moderately. In addition, they had a very excellent brunch cocktail menu. I highly recommend the Freddy Kruger bloody Mary; it is a blood Mary with the addition of jalapeno infused vodka which gives it an extra kick and will wake you up right away. Great place to bring a date or a small group of friends!

reviews: I'll take my parents here when they visit NYC.My reservations were happily greeted despite arriving a few minutes late.Talk about finding a golden egg, here's my experience.My date and I opened with Kale Caesar Salad. It was perfectly dressed in homemade mediterranean caesar; it shined well on the ripe kale. The oils, seasonings, and cheese, blending perfectly with white anchovie paste. The salad was on par to what I've had in $$$$ steak houses.It was topped with sugar-cube-sized croutons and bacon lardons. A dish to remember that prepared us for the entree.The entree was presented open faced to my date with thumb out of the plate- something you see at a 5 star restaurant.Again, the service and style was impeccable.Entrée being roasted rosemary chicken on a bed of potatoes mash surrounded by a lovely moat of gravy. Topped with a duo of de-skined roast plum tomatos.Each bite was worth every chew.If I had one request as a chicken going to slaughter, I would ask for this to be my fate.Desert was presented in the same method, respecting my girlfriend.A coconut panna cotta spired with a golf ball mango sorbet and pineapple chutney, sitting in a shallow layer of guava soup.If Gilligan and his crew had this coconut dish, the whole squad wouldn't have left the island.After our meal, Chef John the owner himself, came out to greet us and thank us for our patronage. Did they think we were critics from michilen, NY times...?This was a very special service that I will not forget. Unbelievably awesome in pretty much everyway.An unforgettable meal, excellent service, and adorable atmosphere. I really hope this place is as good on super busy nights.I was sad it was over, but happy that it happened.

Unbelievably awesome in pretty much everyway.An unforgettable meal, excellent service, and adorable atmosphere. I really hope this place is as good on super busy nights.I was sad it was over, but happy that it happened.

reviews: My boyfriend and I came here for dinner to celebrate our anniversary since our first date was brunch here a year ago. How disappointing! I don't blame the servers, who kept apologizing. But the food was SO slow to come out. We sat there for almost 30 minutes before being offered bread for the table. We ordered the fig jam, ricotta, and prosciutto crostini, the Brussels sprouts as an appetizer, the risotto with sweet sausage and kale, and the salmon. The server described the Brussels sprouts as "sautéed with bacon and garlic" but when they came out they were limp, tasteless, and late! No sign of any bacon or garlic -- it tasted like they were just steamed with some salt and olive oil. The crostini was delicious but maybe we were just ravenous. Finally! The entrees! The portions were way smaller than expected. My risotto was more watery than creamy, and the beans dominated the taste. The salmon was kind of bland, but the sauce and corn did spice it up a little. We  definitely left here hungry. All in all, 100% not worth it. I won't be coming back here, for brunch or dinner. I recommend Cafe Bar down the street.

The salmon was kind of bland, but the sauce and corn did spice it up a little. We  definitely left here hungry. I won't be coming back here, for brunch or dinner. I recommend Cafe Bar down the street

reviews: One of the few brunch spots that I actually really enjoyed coming to. Gastroteca was one of the places I considered throwing my friend's Bridal Shower. It wasn't our final choice, but I was glad i was able to try out their brunch menu yesterday. All I have to say was...WOW...that Chicken and Waffle was amazing and it was definitely the best I've ever had! The waffle was fluffy, their maple syrup and butter was addictive, and the chicken was perfectly crispy. The scampi & grits was an interesting combo too. It had a mixture of shrimps, sausage, tomato, peppers, over a bed of polenta and a fried egg. The simplicity of the polenta really brought out the flavor of the meat sauce. Service was amazing and rumor has it that their coffee is amazing. Also, love the spacing and the serenity of the place.

Service was amazing and rumor has it that their coffee is amazing

reviews: Decor was so cute!! I love the bar. Next time I'll sit there and get wine poured by the cute guy. Promise. Went with two friends who both thoroughly enjoyed dining here as well. Waitress (two) were very attentive and never let our cups go dry. Plenty of water and wine. I ordered the branzino and swapped the sauce/pancetta for garlic mashed potatoes. Awesome choice. I didn't even pay attention to what my friends had (my dish was that good) but they really liked their pasta! Will def be back to try brunch here.

reviews: Cool place to go and meet friends. Very spacious. Has seating inside and out. The food is average, but expensive. I went with my friends for brunch. I ordered a spinach and goat cheese omelette with home fries and bacon on the side. The omelette and home fries was $11. The bacon on the side was $4. I did not enjoy the bacon, it was over cooked; it was like eating a hard potato chip.We also had a zeppole for the table which is a fried dough dessert. It tasted good.
extracted: enjoy Cool place to go and meet friends Has seating inside and out The food is average, but expensive.

reviews: This is probably among my top 5 brunch spots in astoria - and if you're from astoria, you know there are several brunch spots on every corner. Half of the restaurant is outdoor seating and even if you sit indoors, the ceilings are really high and the glass doors next to the area are always open, giving the entire restaurant a nice airy feel. Perfect for enjoying the breezy, sunny spring mornings. I know some people who go to Brunch to have an excuse for drinking before 3pm but the food here was really good! I got a chicken&waffles and my friend got a charles benedict - totally iconic brunch staples that Gastroteca did well on. I would have liked better customer service since it we pretty much seated ourselves and didn't get addressed until 15 minutes later, but ultimately the decor, customer service, environment comes second to the food - which was spot on.

My friend and I received our drinks and entrees pretty quickly. They have a decent spin on a classic chicken Caesar salad, but the chicken was so scarce. The price was alright. I probably wouldn't come back because everything was just OK.

reviews: Love this place. Great atmosphere, nice outdoor seating, off the main strip so it's not too crowded, fresh and delicious food, reasonably priced, and our waiter loved our dogs and even had treats for them. Definitely recommend eating here.

reviews: Came here on a Thursday afternoon for brunch. The waitress was really attentive and friendly. We ordered two orange juice to start off with. Maybe it was us but the orange juice tasted different.. couldn't put our finger on it, I think they mixed it with the San pellegrino soda... nevertheless, a good different though. We ordered the crispy gnocchi and brunch lasagna with a side of home fries. This was my first time seeing brunch lasagna on the menu so I had to order that and it did not disappoint. It had sausage, bacon, spinach and topped off with an egg. It was delicious. The crispy gnocchi was delicious as well, we really enjoyed the sauce it came in. However, this place was really pricey especially for the portion size. So even though everything tasted good, I felt like the portion size was not enough to fill me up...

reviews: Tried this place because I want to try new things and saw the reviews on Yelp. Came here with a friend for brunch 1 day and I ordered the Lasagna. It was interesting got it because it was a brunch item. Food was good, service was good. Would prob come back again.

reviews: 3.5 stars!!Cute place, rustic looking. Our waiter was great. Didn't catch his name but he was bald with a beard. We didn't have to wait to long for our food to come out. I order the chicken and waffles. It was really good. My girlfriend ordered eggs benedict and turkey bacon. She really enjoyed her meal as well. So here's why I took away some stars.....the dessert!!!! We ordered the zeppoles. They looked and smelled amazing. However, when I cut into the first one.....the inside was completely raw. We told our waiter and he was apologetic; he put in for a new batch. Our first order of zeppoles had sugar/cinnamon with powdered sugar. The second batch only had powdered sugar. They were so PLAIN, tasted like nothing! It was pretty unpleasant. The zeppoles came with a little chocolate dip on the side but that didn't even help give some flavor. Great place and food but so disappointed with the dessert.

AND the best bacon i have ever had!  Holy shit!  If i lived here, I'd be here all the time.   Improvement point to the staff... add some other hot sauce options besides tabasco.  No one likes tabasco!

reviews: Quality dining at this "gastroteca." I was at my friends' catered wedding reception here, so we got to navigate our way through much of the menu. Everything was good, from soup to nuts.We started with oysters and tuna crudo, a very tasty prelude to the main events. Competently mixed drinks were flowing.For me the standouts were creamy polenta, veal meatballs, balsamic glazed lamb ribs, and the arancini (mushroom, truffle, and stracchino). Wow.There was way more food than I could eat without bursting at the seams. Needless to say, worth a visit.

reviews: Came here for brunch while trying to put off the Sunday Scaries and this place was so excellent it had me thinking it was Saturday.Bloody Mary aficionados will love the Freddy Kreuger, Gastroteca's spicier take on the drink, made with jalapeno infused vodka. I had the fried oyster sandwich that was cooked perfectly, albeit it was the size of my face and I could barely get through it. The waitstaff is extremely friendly, and the place was busy enough that you felt like you were at a happening place without feeling claustrophobic.Sesame Street was being played on the projector, which is actually an amazing thing to watch when you're a few Bloody Mary's deep. We asked the bartender if they had put it in on purpose, and they confirmed that it was in fact intentional. How sweet. I'll definitely be back.

reviews: I don't think I have ever had a bad meal or drink here (although the red sangria was a bit too strong/brandy tasting). The MM MM mimosa is my fave! Been here for brunch on more than one occasion and was never disappointed. Sometimes it gets a little busy but I mean, it's a sweet spot so who cares? As long as the mimosas keep coming, you stop paying attention to something as pesky as time right? The zeppoles/donuts are a MUST- they're to die for. One cheat day won't hurt :) Also came here in the evening once and their cheese plates were heavenly, along with their fried eggplant. Super cute date spot- great ambiance, love the decor- with your SO or your gfs. Highly recommend.

Also can't forget to mention the fantastic service!I do wish they'd bring back the bone marrow and that brunch had more consistency, but overall I would recommend this spot to everyone!

reviews: This place is so adorable and obviously has potential. I came mid afternoon on a Monday so business was practically non existent and the service was therefore slow. I overlooked this factor since the server was nice and I've been in the industry for a long time so I understand how it is. Having said that, the one thing I cannot get over is the fact that various members of the staff including management openly commented about the bad tip that the recently vacated table had just left. Since I was the only guest left in the restaurant, I could clearly hear every word. The first thing that I was taught working in the service industry is to NEVER discuss other patrons in the earshot of guests. Besides this faux pas incident, the food was beautifully presented but needed more flavour. I'm willing to give this establishment a few more chances on different days and times but I'll never forget this first awkward experience...

reviews: The restaurant is spacious and beautiful. The server was nice and attentive. The only problem is that I got food poisoning. I ordered the salmon and the server recommended to have it served medium rare which is fine. The dish tasted fine even though the center was almost like a sashimi texture. A couple of hours later and I was alternating from full on sweats and bone chilling freezing. I will spare the details of the rest but I will never come back to this restaurant.

It's always touchy to send something back and it would've kept me in the restaurant longer than I wanted. My view is that steak should never have gotten to the table in the first place. Waste of money. Waitress was very good.

reviews: It's ok.Probably not to go back to though.Besides always being over booked for since there isn't many decent breakfast and brunch spots in Astoria anymore, the food is just not great.It's just ok.We ordered the classic eggs Benedict, the hollandaise sauce was pretty good but everything other than that was blah.The muffin on the bottom was black burned and you could very much taste it, the ham on top was pretty cheap ham that you could get in a deli. And it was served with hand cut fries, that were not done. I literally tried 5 of them and gave up, they were completely raw potatoes with only outside done. So not eatable. We also ordered a latte, they did a decent job with it since they don't have a coffee machine to make a real one.And we also ordered the Nutella stuffed French toast, which was pretty good. It would be great if they served it with some berries to contrast the heaviness of all that sugar, dough and Nutella.Cute, but not great, probably not coming back.
extracted: It's ok.Probably not to go back to though.Besides always being over booked for since there isn't many decent breakfast and brunch spots in Astoria anymore, the food is just not great.It's just ok.We ordered the classic eggs Benedict, the hollandaise sauce was pretty good but everything other than that was blah.The muffin on the bottom was black burned and you could very much taste it, the ham on top was pretty cheap ham that you could get in a deli. I literally tried 5 of them and gave up, they were completely raw potatoes with only outside done. So not eatable We also ordered a latte, they did a decent job with it since they don't have a coffee machine to make a real one.And we also ordered the Nutella stuffed French toast, which was pretty good. It would be great if they served it with some berries to contrast the heaviness of all that sugar, dough and Nutella.Cute, but not great, probably not coming back.

reviews: Came here around 11am for Saturday brunch. The place was pretty empty so we were given a choice between indoor seating or outdoor seating - we chose inside. The place looks like it was just renovated or they do a really good job at maintaining it. Our waitress did a great job with recommendations. I got the California Benedict with a side of home fries, both were simply delicious. One of my friends got the Polenta, which was very filling. My boyfriend and other friend got the Chicken Club, which they both liked. At the end, the waitress was kind and patient enough split the bill on three cards for us. My friends also surprised me with the nutella filled Sugar Dusted Texas Toast to celebrate the completion of my Master's. It cute cause they even put that sparkler thingy on it.This place is great, highly recommended.

reviews: Hot Dayum  I got the chicken and waffle and it's bitchin. The waitress was super accommodating and the restaurant was beautiful... Had outdoor seating, nice vibes... Definitely somewhere I would visit again for a few drinks.
extracted: The waitress was super accommodating and the restaurant was beautiful... Had outdoor seating, nice vibes... Definitely somewhere I would visit again for a few drinks.

reviews: I go there so much it's almost embarrassing. My favorite restaurant in queens!! The staff is as amazing as the food. You can't go wrong with anything on the menu but a few favorites are the kale salad, steak, and salmon. Now go!
extracted: I go there so much it's almost embarrassing. My favorite restaurant in queens The staff is as amazing as the food You can't go wrong with anything on the menu but a few favorites are the kale salad, steak, and salmon.

reviews: Nice pasta, but slow slow slow service on a not very busy nightI just have returned back from Gastroteca. While my lasagna bolognese was tasty, service was very slow and I thought my waiter had forgotten me. Admittedly I was sitting outside, but my waitress did not come out to check that I had been served. I also ordered a coke which tasted more like diet coke and then I had to remind the waitress that I needed some bread. So all in all not a great experience from a service perspective. So if it wasn't for the food I could well have given them 2 stars. Maybe I am just generous tonight?troteca Astoria

reviews: I'm here now having dinner with my fiance for our anniversary. Overall, the food has been good. We ordered the crostini  (3 for $10), our favorite was the prosciutto Scotto. We also ordered calamari, but I wasn't a huge fan of that. Could have been better. Service was quick up until we ordered dessert. We waited for 35 mins until dessert came out and our server didn't come once to check up on us. Our food though was excellent. However, one thing that kind of annoyed me was that every table got served bread with butter where our table didn't get bread. I thought it was odd when tables to our left and right were served and we felt singled out. Minor detail, but I pick up on everything. Also we got charged full price for our drinks even though they were part of the happy hour special?
extracted: Overall, the food has been good. Could have been better Service was quick up until we ordered dessert.

reviews: Came with a party of five for lunch during the week. Two of us loved our entree and the others were not crazy about it. I had the pesto cavatelli and my friend had the blue crab spaghettini. Ours came out al dente and amazing but for the folks who ordered the linguine with clams the consensus was it was super salty. When they told the waiter he took it back and didn't offer any apologies or offer to make them something else but only saw it taken off on the bill. Customer service goes a long way people!!!

reviews: Honestly this place was beyond mediocre. Which was especially disappointing because of its 4 star status and fairly good reviews. Definitely unworthy of four stars regarding their brunch. So let's start from the beginning. We had a reservation for 1:00pm on Memorial Day. We got caught in some traffic and called to let them know we were en route however would be a little late to our reservation. The person on the phone was extremely rude and said they couldn't hold our table for much longer bc they had a lot of people waiting to be seated. We arrive and there were several open tables and literally no one waiting. So ...? We were celebrating a friends birthday so obv we opted for the mmm mmm mimosa carafe which had little to no alcohol at all. 98% juice. Unacceptable. Everyone's food was unmemorable and unexciting. I ordered the California eggs Benedict and it was the worst Benedict I've ever had. So so plain and bland and don't even get me started on the hollandaise. No flavor whatsoever. My friend had the fried chicken and waffles and said the same thing. Bland. Under seasoned etc. It was beyond disappointing. Eggs Benedict is a brunch staple and if you can't execute that right maybe you shouldn't have it on your menu. Definitely won't be returning.

No flavor whatsoever Under seasoned etc Eggs Benedict is a brunch staple and if you can't execute that right maybe you shouldn't have it on your menu.

reviews: First, let me start by saying we loved this place when the new ownership took it  over from Locale. Most of the lovely servers from the old guard stayed on, and the ingredients and menu improved, the new owners were there often and attentive and friendly. And there weren't odd rules about reservations or waiting for a table. Lately this place is just ridiculous. We've lived in the neighborhood since before it opened and have always been satisfied regular patrons. But now ANY time we try to go, the extremely RUDE host/manager (guy with dark hair and glasses) is guarding the door and snarkily asks how many, then we tell him. Then he basically says something along the lines of "reservation, right?" (when more than half of the tables appear open) and if we say no he just tosses the menus away and shoots a glare as if we are peons that he can't help. If we ask how long it might be to wait otherwise he rolls his eyes and points at the bar as if it is a dentention center and tells us it's an option. Then turns on his heel and dismisses us. SERIOUSLY. It is SO disappointing. Everyone here was always so nice and there was never a reservations only policy. If we go now, we make a point to drop in when that guy isn't running the door because it feels like a kick in the gut every time. I've worked in bars and restaurants for many years. This table nazi stuff is such a turn off. Be gracious and sympathetic about it at least if you seriously are so piled up with reservations that there's no way in for a decade. Which come on, I highly doubt is always the case. This isn't the Four Seasons here. This new level of pretentiousness is truly befuddling at this point in the game. This is a neighborhood restaurant.Anyways, still lovers of the food and service otherwise, we went ahead and made a reservation this week. Greeted by the same rude as ever staffer (maybe manager? hard to tell...) again, we say yup, reservation this time (the place was packed as it was Saturday night, so made sense this time) and the only tables open are one right by the door in the middle of the room and two others up in the elevated section. He shows us the worst table (so much for the privilege of making a reservation) and when we ask if we can sit up in the other section he says it's for larger parties. Can't win. So we settle otherwise for the high top bar tables (aka- see above: detention center for folks made to feel dumb for not making a reservation).Fine. The service was great at first, waitress was lovely and friendly and attentive. We ordered. Then a group of people (not a larger party than us) are led to a table we had previously requested and were denied. We wait, and wait, and wait for our food. Nobody coming by to see if we need... um... food we ordered. But meanwhile several items (including menu items that were in our order) are promptly delivered to the table seated after us. Host dude hovering over them, etc...Look, I get it. I've served friends and VIPs at restaurants too. But try not to make it so obvious that service at other tables suffer as a result. Especially when in plain view. So we wait. Then we ask a very helpful server (not ours, couldn't find her) if the food is coming, she helps, some food comes, other server and good service kick back in again- all great. We finish, plates are slowly cleared. Then nothing.No offer for additional drinks or dessert (they always do here)... No check drop. Nothing. Server is MIA... We turtle neck around the place for about 20 minutes as the host rushes around avoiding eye contact... finally one of us catches him and he drops the check. What's the deal here? Legit annoyed at the recent changes here. We're loyal, friendly, easy to please, well tipping customers. But seems like a tone is being set- mainly by door guy host manager fella that is just setting up each experience for failure. Ever meet someone who you knew was just looking for a fight? Yeah. Like that. Meanwhile, we had brunch at a nearby French place on 36th Ave earlier in the day and even in tightly packed quarters with rapidly demanded orders and a BARELY there mess up with a menu item mixed up that took about 20 seconds to correct, and one chef making allll of the orders, the hostess and server were highly attentive, greeted us with friendly attitudes, let us WAIT for a table to open up, and comped some brunch drinks to make up for the slight wait on the item mix up. So now I'm off to write them a glowing 5 star yelp review.UPDATE: Restaurant manager (host referenced above) wrote back a private message defending himself. Apologetic yet unsurprisingly abrasive- Did not address service issues. Not going back, will speak to the owner.

(when more than half of the tables appear open) and if we say no he just tosses the menus away and shoots a glare as if we are peons that he can't help. If we ask how long it might be to wait otherwise he rolls his eyes and points at the bar as if it is a dentention center and tells us it's an option. reviews: Horable service, the risotto doesn't taste like risotto, the manager didn't even wanted to cancel it we paid full price for everything !!!! All my life eating Italian food! This is not an Italian restaurant!!!!

reviews: Amazing dusted texas toast!! Shrimp grits was amazing too. Nice outdoor seating area. Will be back for more texas toast and shrimp grits!!

reviews: Came here on labor day for brunch. There were seating   available outside, but since it was humid I rather stay in. The waitress took our order and it took forever for the food to come out. She said the kitchen was backed up, but it wasn't like all the tables were occupied. I got myself the California benedict, because everyone on yelp seems to be getting that. Upon arrival the dish just look sad. I understand that getting a benedict is not a big dish, but at least give me some more home fries. By the way I thought the home fries had more flavor than the California benedict.The only thing I would say that is good about this place is the decor, and their toast with nutella which was delicious.

reviews: I promised to write a review for this place before Steph gets an opportunity to go here. I came here last night with a friend after we realized we were both starving to death. He frequently comes in for brunch which he said was pretty good. It's not the boozey I'm going to get you crunked under the table style brunch but they have delicious rustic Italian foods with a modern twist that they claim all endorse fresh ingredients found locally in Astoria. For dinner we split the appetizer trio of bruschetta ($10): Fig Jam, Ricotta, and Prosciutto - Kind of a standard toast spread, it was tasty but not the best of the bunch. Stracchino, garlic, mushrooms - My personal favorite and definitely the most flavored with a rich thick soft cow's cheese. Sicilian Pineapple, mascarpone, chili flakes - Absolutely nothing was wrong with this. It was sweet and spicy and pretty much perfection. For my entrée I ended up going with the Crispy Gnocchi ($16): Pistachio pesto, spinach, and a liberal amount of shredded ricotta salata adorned on top. The dish was flavorful and I enjoyed the crispy exterior of the gnocchi which you don't typically find. The pastas definitely tasted hand made. Portions I will say for $15-20 dishes are pretty small as hell. While it was personally filling for me because of the density of the pasta and the richness I still usually expect more bang for your buck. This is Astoria after all. He ordered the Linguini Limone ($14): Accompanied with ramps and 4 cloves of garlic. I swear I tasted bacon and eggs in this but maybe I'm just crazy. It was sinfully decadent and very similar to a carbonara with extra lemon and garlic. Again, small portions - heavy dish. Service was pretty fast and excellent so I am not sure what all the other yelpers are complaining about. Though, the restaurant was pretty empty when I attended. Don't forget to use your 10% off coupon through Yelp because I totally did but I'd be willing to give the restaurant another shot, pats Yelp app lovingly.

reviews: I went here for brunch with my sister on Sunday August 30th. I had the waffle with caramel sauce and an almond based whipped cream. It was so delicious and my two year old niece approved! I just wish that it would have come with eggs I had to order them separately which whopped up my food cost to 16 bux. The decor of the place is beautiful and I'm interested to see what dinner is like although I have seen the menu to know it is more on the pricey side. There are better brunch deals pricewise in Astoria. My sister had a chicken club sandwich that was dry and had slightly burnt toast. She wishes she would have gotten the California eggs benedict she had been debating over, the people next to us had them and they looked so tasty. Would definitely come back since it is such an overall nice spot and service was relatively good.

Would definitely come back since it is such an overall nice spot and service was relatively good.

reviews: My boyfriend and I went to Gastroteca for brunch Sunday morning. The food was excellent, but there were a couple definite issues we had with our experience. First let me start by telling you, the place isn't that big - no more than 20 inside tables and 10 stools at the bar. When we arrived around 1:15, 5 4-seat tables were reserved for a large party showing up at 1:30. We ultimately sat outside, but at the same time as the large party. Our server seemed to be the odd man out, because the other tables were being attended to but our waiter took forever to come over to us and take our order. Then we waited for about 30 minutes to get the check. Not ideal to have that many tables blocked off and have slow service, but everyone has those busy times so I get it. It doesn't take away from the fact that the food was delicious. I had the scampi and grits, which was amazing. The combination seems weird but it's super tasty and the perfect amount of food. Sunny side up eggs were perfectly cooked and the dish had just enough heat. My boyfriend had the italian benedict and enjoyed it a lot as well. We split the banana ricotta zepoles which was probably too much food but they were delicious as well. Bottom line - great food, iffy service (at least that afternoon), and make a reservation if you're going at a busy time.

The combination seems weird but it's super tasty and the perfect amount of food. My boyfriend had the italian benedict and enjoyed it a lot as well. We split the banana ricotta zepoles which was probably too much food but they were delicious as well

reviews: Everything about this place is excellent! Food, service, and atmosphere were great. Came here for both brunch and dinner and will certainly be returning!
The atmosphere in this place is very quant and swanky. Everyone was delicious!!! I had the French Toast and omg it was amazinggggggg. I'll definitely come back
extracted: The atmosphere in this place is very quant and swanky. Everyone was delicious!!!

reviews: Really reliable quality of food and service. I have been here with large groups and just for date night and their service and food is consistent. We always over-order because there are so many great options on the menu. Great decor. They play classic movies in the background which is a fun distraction.  I forgot my food at the bar and one of the staff ran a block after me and my wife. I've been a bunch of times and never left disappointed. I definitely recommend the lamb ribs and the branzino.

reviews: Went here for brunch yesterday and the food was good and staff was friendly. I wasn't sure we could pull off a last minute brunch date for 6 people but we did without having to wait. They had disco music playing with the movie beetlejuice playing on a projector (for Halloween). My friends had a bus to catch so it was good that the food came quickly. I'd definitely go back!

reviews: This place exudes brunch. The atmosphere is great, the decor is homey, this place is a fantastic brunch spot. The outdoor seating on the 75 degree day I went was also a added bonus. On nice weather days, they open all the door/window things in front of their restaurant and it makes it look like a big open space. I have been twice and I have sat outside both times.  The food:Fried eggs with cheddar polenta & breakfast sausage. Holy Jesus did I enjoy this. The eggs were cooked perfectly and the sausage was homemade, it didn't have that supermarket feel to it. I am a big fan of polenta, add cheddar to it and I am sold. lol  Only issue I had was the noticeably greasy whole wheat toast. Weird. yelp.com/user_local_photPoached eggs, buttermilk biscuit and country gravy. The biscuits were just OK kinda dry though, the gravy was nice but this dish didn't have any meat. I was expecting the gravy to be a sausage gravy or something at least. The hash browns bugged me though, there were so greasy. They were more like fries than hash browns, they were crispy and had nice flavor but were super greasy. yelp.com/user_local_photCorned Beef Hash- The flavor of the hash was just so so, but the hash looks so unappealing. yelp.com/user_local_phot Locale Mojito- I really liked the Mojito, it was really nice and refreshing.

reviews: Got the chicken and waffles, they should use chicken thighs instead of chicken breast, wasn't flavorful enough :/

Went here for brunch with family during the week and ate some pretty good chicken and waffle. The waiter seemed to also be the hostess and chef but we didn't wait too long! Mom reported the burger was "excellent" which for the self-proclaimed "Meat and Milk" woman is a GLOWING review of this place. I want to go back for some nighttime drinks since the illuminated wall from the projected movie gives it a cool vibe.

Walked past it and decided to check it out for Saturday brunch. Went in without a reservation and got seated right away.  The service was excellent, our server was very friendly and attentive. The selection was pretty good, we went with the eggs benedict and the potatoes. The eggs were cooked properly, I just wish the hollandaise sauce was a bit more flavorful as I thought it was a little on the bland side. Overall the atmosphere there was great and I liked that they had a variety of drink options.

reviews: Great brunch menu.  I got the california benedict, and it was absolutely delicious.  Eggs were poached to perfection, and adding avocado along with the roasted tomato just added a great mixture of flavors that went well together.My wife had the sugar dusted texas toast, and it was as good as it can be.  The nutella along with the slightly sugary toast made for a very sweet and soft combination that'll wake up your taste buds.Good food for a good price; would definitely recommend.  Also, they're part of the rewards network on airline portals, so you can receive extra miles for your dining of $30 or more.  Recommended indeed!

reviews: Never had a bad experience here, however, today's experience was based on seating. I was seated in the lower tables next to the upper level. The food was good and ambience was chill until I got a whiff of stinky feet. That's when I saw that the person's sitting on the top level's feet was next to my food. It was unpleasant and instant turnoff. Thankfully, I was mostly done with my food though it did deter me from deserts.

reviews: Had a really great early dinner here last weekend.  We came here for the burger, but were too late for the brunch menu so we ordered dinner instead.  The food, service, and setting were all really great.We ordered the calamari appetizer which tasted fresh and was well cooked, but not anything special.  Still it was a good sized order for the price.  Next time we'll try the arancini.  I had the zuca ravioli in brown butter leek sauce, which was suggested by the server. It was a nice portion of homemade ravioli, a great fall dish.  My boyfriend had the fettucini and lamb sausage, which he could not get enough of.  We LOVED the bread with olive oil before the meal as well (could've eaten just that and have been happy!)  For drinks my boyfriend had a pumpkin based cocktail and the bold fashioned, both of which were really delicious and unique.  I had a drink with gin, cucumber, dill, and olive brine which was absolutely amazing.  Like nothing I've ever had before. The waiter was extremely attentive, and took the time to answer all our questions and to walk me through the Italian wines on the menu as we ate at an off time and he had few other customers.  He comped us one of the drinks when it took a long time to arrive at our table too! The place is beautiful with huge glass windows, lots of white tile and marble, and painted tin ceilings.  They were playing classic movies on the tv and playing 40's and 50's songs over the loudspeaker.  It's a great place for a date or special occasion.  Definitely going to return!

For drinks my boyfriend had a pumpkin based cocktail and the bold fashioned, both of which were really delicious and unique. The waiter was extremely attentive, and took the time to answer all our questions and to walk me through the Italian wines on the menu as we ate at an off time and he had few other customers. The place is beautiful with huge glass windows, lots of white tile and marble, and painted tin ceilings. Definitely going to return

reviews: The ambiance is cute but I probably won't come back. I have been to most of the brunch spots in Astoria and none have wowed me so we decided to try gastroteca. The space is nice, bright, and open and they play movies against the brick wall behind the bar which is cool. Plus side: you can call ahead and we got seated immediately. Biggest turn off is waiting an hour for brunch when you're already hangry. The food is forgettable. I got the California Benedict which was satisfactory- not bad but not great. The poached eggs were a little watery and the dish itself was way under seasoned. I got the side of home fries which were greasy. Fiancé got steak and eggs which were salty and the salad had a LOT of vinegar. Overall, meh.

Plus side: you can call ahead and we got seated immediately. Biggest turn off is waiting an hour for brunch when you're already hangry. The food is forgettable.

reviews: Deliciousness!!! Food is fantastic and portions are large. Fantastic spot for a mid week brunch!!!

reviews: I've come here for dinner on a few occasions (always with a reservation) and the food is always good. Our frequent server, Anna, makes great recommendations on wine and food. Last visit we had the salmon and horseradish risotto and it was the best dish I've had there. The salmon is cooked rare and is delicious. The risotto was flavored perfectly (warning, there are peas in it, in case you're not a fan, BUT the people at my table who don't like peas still enjoyed it!). Seriously, we didn't want this dish to end! It was just a special the night we went, but we hope it makes it into the regular menu! *hint hint*The crostini apps are always a treat, highly recommend trying the 3 for $10 deal. The kale caesar salad is an unexpected jem, with crutons and bacon tossed in. Organic Montepulciano from their wine list is also highly recommended.
extracted: enjoy I've come here for dinner on a few occasions (always with a reservation) and the food is always good. Last visit we had the salmon and horseradish risotto and it was the best dish I've had there. The salmon is cooked rare and is delicious

reviews: I've had this place bookmarked for awhile now so when after-movie plans fell through, we set out to find another place to eat at and Locale came up.I worry most of the time when my 9-yo babe come to dinner with us at a dimly lit restaurant. She is behave enough to take but not truly old enough to witness any debauchery that might go on lol. Locale may be dimly lit, offer different kinds of alcoholic beverages and give off that "adult only" vibe but it was most definitely kid friendly. As soon as we came in, our server (super bubbly and friendly), gave us our seating options. Of course we have to take the booth like corner up the few steps. "Whatever the princess wants" :). Thank you for making her super comfortable.Restaurant is spacious with high ceilings. Great decor. Candle lit tables. Tables good for two or groups all around. Bar looked fairly decent. Long bar height communal table in the middle. Conducive for a romantic first date dinner that won't break your bank and can seriously get you brownie points. Their menu wasn't massive. Crostinos, Antipasti, Pasta and Second Course - Main. Probably have about 6 items per section. We chose three crostinis - goat cheese and beet was on their special, burrata with hummus and artichoke and flash fried calamari with chillies for appetizers. For our main, we shared their Gnocchi and Taglaitelle Bolognese.Crostinis were tasty. It was 3 for $10. Burrata was the best one. Fried calamari was cooked perfect. Not chewy or overcooked at all. The marinara sauce that came with it had a little kick to it but it was a good kind of kick. Their pastas were awesome. All of them were freshly made according to the menu. Meat sauce in the Bolognese was spot on. And Gnocchi with some mushrooms and truffle was creamy and tasty as well.We were offered free dessert. Actually, they offered it to my 9-yo but when the wait staff mentioned dark chocolate Flourless cake, I had to exclaim "yes!". Oh, I'm sorry. Thought you were talking to me lol. She did choose the cake. It was a bit overcooked giving it a little crunch but I loved it. And my babe loved it as well.Overall, a resounding 5 stars for great service and good food. Will definitely come back here again.
extracted: Tables good for two or groups all around Bar looked fairly decent. Long bar height communal table in the middle Conducive for a romantic first date dinner that won't break your bank and can seriously get you brownie points. Their menu wasn't massive. Probably have about 6 items per section Burrata was the best one. Fried calamari was cooked perfect Not chewy or overcooked at all All of them were freshly made according to the menu Thought you were talking to me lol Will definitely come back here again

reviews: First and last time for brunch here. Ordered eggs well done came back soft. The drinks are extra cost to the menu and were lousy. Not really sure what people are thinking when they come here to eat. The water is from the sink then poured into different glass bottles. Someone said the water was the best lol you can get that at the hydrant on the corner for free. The only nice thing was the friendly staff.

reviews: This restaurant is very charming - a very inviting specious restaurant with a great bar. The waitstaff is very friendly and attentive as well.On a recent Visit we were very unhappy with our entrees. I had the rigatoni with eggplant which was very bland and barely had any flavor.  The pasta itself had no bite and just tasted off. The waitress realized something was off as we barely ate any of our food and after speaking to someone in charge comped us a $10 appetizer. Thanks management

reviews: Astoria's hidden gem! Love the food & ambiance. Italian food is one of my favs and they sure delivered

The ambiance alone is the reason to try out this restaurant...Came for late night drinks and appetizers and was not disappointed. They were playing an old Audrey Hepburn movie in the back, there was quiet jazz playing and low lighting - perfect for a date night. I got the veal meatballs and the crostini deal (3 for $10)...so delicious! The cocktails were also to die for, I tried a Moscow mule and a roman holiday cocktail.

reviews: Loved this place! Their gnocchi was outrageous.  Beautiful layout too. Will definitely be back!

reviews: My cousin did mention there were reviews about the slow service. It definitely held true tonight. 5:30 reservation for Mother's Day, we didn't receive our Crostini (3) and Antipasti until 6:50. Restaurant was not at full capacity, kitchen was apparently running behind.We ordered the following for primi piatti:-Fig jam, ricotta, prosciutto crostini-Stracchino, garlic, mushrooms crostini-Smoked salmon, zucchini pesto crostini-Shaved brussel sprouts, peppercorn dressing, hazelnut, pecorino (dressing and pecorino were non-existent)-Flash fried calamari, sicilian chiles (Hard to get wrong. What chiles?)The Crostinis were tasty, but throwing three slices of bread with toppings into an oven should not take 45+ minutes.Entrees:-3 orders of Tagliati, sliced ribeye, arugula radicchio salad, roasted potatoes. Ordered medium rare and two mediums, received medium well and two well dones. Returned the well done and got a new steak cooked medium. Don't understand how you can get the temperature wrong when the ribeye is sliced before serving! Retails $28-Two orders of Atlantic Salmon. One ordered medium rare, received well done.Decor: Small establishment with simple, modern decor. Windows allowing a lot of ambient light. Decent outdoor seating.Before leaving and after the slow service, we presented a Yelp coupon for 10% off. No fine print, but servers rejected because our party was larger than 4. Normally restaurants include promotion details with their offers.Verdict: Quality of food was acceptable, service and culinary abilities were subpar. Worth a visit if you're okay with lengthy meal and have good company to converse/drink with. Otherwise, plenty of other restaurants in Astoria with comparable decor to try.

Normally restaurants include promotion details with their offers.Verdict: Quality of food was acceptable, service and culinary abilities were subpar.

reviews: Went here for brunch on a hot, hot Saturday and immediately noticed that it was still pretty warm inside the restaurant with mostly just the fans going. It wasn't crowded at all so it was easy to get a table. Our waitress seemed pretty rushed all the same and I had to ask for more water, etc. (which was also lukewarm...some ice would have been nice given that it was 90+ degrees out)Food was overall pretty bland. I got the shrimp and grits which was essentially some veggies/shrimp stewed in tomato sauce then poured over some polenta. It could have used more spices and seasonings. Others at our table got the chicken sandwich and fries. Chicken was apparently dry and fries were just okay and seemed like they were old and the last of the batch. Overall a disappointing meal, and I would not come again.

Chicken was apparently dry and fries were just okay and seemed like they were old and the last of the batch. Overall a disappointing meal, and I would not come again.

reviews: After the movies we decided to see what was around the way. Locale seemed like a nice spot so we headed in. We were sat at the corner table with a couch. The ambience was nice and comfortable. Light was dim, decor was classical yet artfully modern. The service here is remarkable. Everyone is happy. The servers and hosts aim to please. Multiple servers would ask how we were numerous times, gave us fresh shaved cheese, and a free dessert just because. Best service I've had in a while. As for the food, we had the flash fried calamari which was great. We ordered three crostinis, artichoke, burrata - best one and a special goat cheese and beet which was also good. For our entrees, we had the truffle gnocchi which was delicious and creamy. Love the shaved truffle. The tagliatelle bolognese was really fresh and good as well. They even gave us a free dessert of our choice. We went with the dark chocolate flour less cake. Would definitely come here again for the service and romantic chill vibe. People here are awesome.

Multiple servers would ask how we were numerous times, gave us fresh shaved cheese, and a free dessert just because. We ordered three crostinis, artichoke, burrata - best one and a special goat cheese and beet which was also good. Love the shaved truffle The tagliatelle bolognese was really fresh and good as well. Would definitely come here again for the service and romantic chill vibe

reviews: We love this place! The homemade pasta is delicious and the service is great. If the weather is nice try and sit outside.
extracted: The homemade pasta is delicious and the service is great. If the weather is nice try and sit outside.

reviews: A real treat! From the service to the food, it was really excellent - great gf options!We live not too far and have been wanting to try it out for some time. When we arrived, we immediately loved the atmosphere - cozy, soft lighting and not too loud. We were seated right away and immediately greeted by Allison (hope I spelled that correctly). She was just the best. Attentive, knowledgeable, accommodating and really gracious. We ordered shaved Brussels sprouts to start - delicious. And for dinner, we had the Pollo Rosemary and Linguini with clams. Highlights included how tasty the chicken was. Often, chicken can get super dry but this was really great. Get this if you go there!I loved that I could easily sub gluten free penne in for the linguini and it was still super delicious. The sauce combo with the bacon and clams was really unique. I would go back in a heartbeat and try other things and take a few friends when they visit. Most of all, I'd say the #1 highlight was Allison. She was excellent.

The sauce combo with the bacon and clams was really unique. I would go back in a heartbeat and try other things and take a few friends when they visit. Most of all, I'd say the #1 highlight was Allison.

reviews: Locale is a GREAT restaurant in Astoria, located slightly off the beaten path.  I hate to admit it but I forget about this restaurant sometimes (it is a little far from my apartment) which is why I've only eaten here 3 or 4 times. I brought my sister and brother-in-law here on Saturday night and they were definitely impressed with the quality of the food as well as the service.  Having lived in the West Village for close to 10 years they've eaten at some of the finest restaurants in NYC but they were more than satisfied with every delectable dish they tried here.  We started with several of the special crostinis to start, along with the veal meatballs.  After we devoured the appetizers, I enjoyed a tortellini and meat dish, and they ordered the pasta bolognese.  I'm pretty sure the menu changes often because I don't currently see what I ate on their online menu, nevertheless, anything you order here is going to be fresh and taste amazing (pasta is made fresh on site).Locale has an impressive wine and cocktail list and everything on the menu is reasonably priced.I believe our waitress's name was Anna (blonde hair) and she was absolutely fantastic!  She recited the night's specials to us from memory and was able to efficiently answer every question posed at her.  I will definitely recommend this restaurant to family and friends and I'll be back sooner rather than later.  Their brunch menu is something I'd love to check out as well!*** I think they recently changed their name because when I called for my reservation I missed what the hostess first said but she ended with "formerly known as Locale."

I'm pretty sure the menu changes often because I don't currently see what I ate on their online menu, nevertheless, anything you order here is going to be fresh and taste amazing (pasta is made fresh on site).Locale has an impressive wine and cocktail list and everything on the menu is reasonably priced.I believe our waitress's name was Anna (blonde hair) and she was absolutely fantastic! I will definitely recommend this restaurant to family and friends and I'll be back sooner rather than later. Their brunch menu is something I'd love to check out as well!

reviews: Great service and delicious food.  Stopped in for brunch on Sunday with a group of friends.I had the Chicken Club Sandwich with a side salad. Delicious and light, yet filling.  I love how they melted the cheese on top of the toasted bread.  Garlic aioli was flavorful and chicken was juicy.  I'm more of a savory brunch person, so I like the salt.. but I hate eggs. So this was a good choice for me.I tried my friend's french toast and it was one of the best ones I've had.  It was coated with cereal or something, super crunchy on the outside.. and fluffy on the inside. Topped with fresh berries and powdered sugar. Definitely have to come back and get that next time.Service was also wonderful and attentive.
extracted: Delicious Great service and delicious food Garlic aioli was flavorful and chicken was juicy. Topped with fresh berries and powdered sugar Definitely have to come back and get that next time.Service was also wonderful and attentive.

reviews: I was here this past weekend with my girlfriend as we were exploring our new neighborhood and absolutely loved it!! The food and the drinks were Delicious!!! I love a great blood mary and this place definitely delivered on that. We ordered a burger and kale salad and some Zeppoles and nothing disappointed. The burger was nice and juicy and perfectly cooked. The Kale caesar salad came with bits of bacon (which i was not expecting.. always a great treat). The Zeppoles covered in that cinnamon sugar and sauce on the side was like the icing on the cake. Will definitely be back here soon!!

reviews: My boyfriend and I come here about three times a month for cocktails and dinner and have been regulars for over a year-- A testament to Gastroteca's consistency ! The baked gnocci with pesto is out of this world and they sure know how to make a stellar martini. Anna the waitress and Jeremy the bartender are fantastic and provide memorable service and dining experiences.

reviews: Super cute place for brunch. Found myself in the Astoria, NY area this weekend, and needed brunch. Yelp came to the rescue as always. The staff are very accommodating. When my cousin disliked the dressing that came with her salad, the owner I believe went in the back and whipped her up another one to suit her taste.  Don't miss the breakfast potatoes! Delicious.
